LOGICELEMENTSENSORGAS.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Gas is detected on this sensor's tile.\n\nSends a Red Signal when the selected Gas is not present.
LOGICELEMENTSENSORGAS.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if the selected Gas is detected
LOGICELEMENTSENSORGAS.NAME: <link=\"LOGICELEMENTSENSORGAS\">Gas Element Sensor</link>

LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID.DESC: These sensors can detect the presence of a specific liquid and alter systems accordingly.
LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal when the selected Liquid is detected on this sensor's tile.\n\nSends a Red Signal when the selected Liquid is not present.
LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if the selected Liquid is detected
LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID.NAME: <link=\"LOGICELEMENTSENSORLIQUID\">Liquid Element Sensor</link>

LOGICGATEAND.DESC: This gate outputs a Green Signal when both its inputs are receiving Green Signals at the same time.
LOGICGATEAND.EFFECT: Outputs a Green Signal when both Input A AND Input B are receiving Green.\n\nOutputs a Red Signal when even one Input is receiving Red.
LOGICGATEAND.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEAND\">AND Gate</link>
LOGICGATEAND.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if both Inputs are receiving Green
LOGICGATEAND.OUTPUT_INACTIVE: Sends a Red Signal if any Input is receiving Red

LOGICGATEBUFFER.DESC: This gate continues outputting a Green Signal for a short time after the gate stops receiving a Green Signal.
LOGICGATEBUFFER.EFFECT: Outputs a Green Signal if the Input is receiving a Green Signal.\n\nContinues sending a Green Signal for an amount of buffer time after the Input receives a Red Signal.
LOGICGATEBUFFER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEBUFFER\">BUFFER Gate</link>
LOGICGATEBUFFER.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal while receiving Green. After receiving Red, will continue sending Green until the timer has expired

LOGICGATEDEMULTIPLEXER.DESC: Signal Distributors can be used to choose which circuit should receive a given automation signal.
LOGICGATEDEMULTIPLEXER.EFFECT: Route a single Input signal out one of four possible Outputs, based on the selection made by the Control Inputs.\n\nSend a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the two Control Inputs to determine which Output is selected.
LOGICGATEDEMULTIPLEXER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEDEMULTIPLEXER\">Signal Distributor</link>
LOGICGATEDEMULTIPLEXER.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green or Red signal to the selected output

LOGICGATEFILTER.DESC: This gate only lets a Green Signal through if its Input has received a Green Signal that lasted longer than the selected filter time.
LOGICGATEFILTER.EFFECT: Only lets a Green Signal through if the Input has received a Green Signal for longer than the selected filter time.\n\nWill continue outputting a Red Signal if the Green Signal did not last long enough.
LOGICGATEFILTER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEFILTER\">FILTER Gate</link>
LOGICGATEFILTER.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal after receiving Green for longer than the selected filter timer

LOGICGATEMULTIPLEXER.DESC: Signal Selectors can be used to select which automation signal is relevant to pass through to a given circuit
LOGICGATEMULTIPLEXER.EFFECT: Select which one of four Input signals should be sent out the Output, using Control Inputs.\n\nSend a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the two Control Inputs to determine which Input is selected.
LOGICGATEMULTIPLEXER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEMULTIPLEXER\">Signal Selector</link>
LOGICGATEMULTIPLEXER.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Receives a Green or Red signal from the selected input

LOGICGATENOT.DESC: This gate reverses automation signals, turning a Green Signal into a Red Signal and vice versa.
LOGICGATENOT.EFFECT: Outputs a Green Signal if the Input is receiving a Red Signal.\n\nOutputs a Red Signal when its Input is receiving a Green Signal.
LOGICGATENOT.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATENOT\">NOT Gate</link>

LOGICGATEOR.DESC: This gate outputs a Green Signal if receiving one or more Green Signals.
LOGICGATEOR.EFFECT: Outputs a Green Signal if at least one of Input A OR Input B is receiving Green.\n\nOutputs a Red Signal when neither Input A or Input B are receiving Green.
LOGICGATEOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEOR\">OR Gate</link>
LOGICGATEOR.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if any Input is receiving Green
LOGICGATEOR.OUTPUT_INACTIVE: Sends a Red Signal if both Inputs are receiving Red

LOGICGATEXOR.DESC: This gate outputs a Green Signal if exactly one of its Inputs is receiving a Green Signal.
LOGICGATEXOR.EFFECT: Outputs a Green Signal if exactly one of its Inputs is receiving Green.\n\nOutputs a Red Signal if both or neither Inputs are receiving a Green Signal.
LOGICGATEXOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICGATEXOR\">XOR Gate</link>
LOGICGATEXOR.OUTPUT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if exactly one of its Inputs is receiving Green
LOGICGATEXOR.OUTPUT_INACTIVE: Sends a Red Signal if both Input signals match (any color)

LOGICHAMMER.DESC: The hammer makes neat sounds when it strikes buildings.
LOGICHAMMER.EFFECT: In its default orientation, the hammer strikes the building to the left when it receives a Green Signal. Each building has a unique sound when struck by the hammer. The hammer does no damage when it strikes.
LOGICHAMMER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICHAMMER\">Hammer</link>

LOGICHEPSENSOR.DESC: Radbolt sensors can send a signal when a Radbolt passes over them.
LOGICHEPSENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Radbolts detected enters the chosen range.
LOGICHEPSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if detected Radbolts are within the selected range
LOGICHEPSENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICHEPSENSOR\">Radbolt Sensor</link>

LOGICINTERASTEROIDRECEIVER.EFFECT: Receives a Green Signal or a Red Signal from an Automation Broadcaster over vast distances in space.\n\nBoth the Automation Receiver and the Automation Broadcaster must be exposed to space to function.
LOGICINTERASTEROIDRECEIVER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICINTERASTEROIDRECEIVER\">Automation Receiver</link>

LOGICINTERASTEROIDSENDER.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal to an Automation Receiver over vast distances in space.\n\nBoth the Automation Broadcaster and the Automation Receiver must be exposed to space to function.
LOGICINTERASTEROIDSENDER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICINTERASTEROIDSENDER\">Automation Broadcaster</link>

LOGICLIGHTSENSOR.DESC: Light sensors can tell surface bunker doors above solar panels to open or close based on solar light levels.
LOGICLIGHTSENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Brightness enters the chosen range.
LOGICLIGHTSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if ambient Brightness is within the selected range
LOGICLIGHTSENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICLIGHTSENSOR\">Light Sensor</link>

LOGICMEMORY.DESC: A Memory stores a Green Signal received in the Set Port (S) until the Reset Port (R) receives a Green Signal.
LOGICMEMORY.EFFECT: Contains an internal Memory, and will output whatever signal is stored in that Memory. Signals sent to the Inputs only affect the Memory, and do not pass through to the Output. Sending a Green Signal to the Set Port (S) will set the memory to Green. Sending a Green Signal to the Reset Port (R) will reset the memory back to Red.
LOGICMEMORY.NAME: <link=\"LOGICMEMORY\">Memory Toggle</link>
LOGICMEMORY.READ_PORT_ACTIVE: Outputs a Green Signal if the internal Memory is set to Green
LOGICMEMORY.READ_PORT_INACTIVE: Outputs a Red Signal if the internal Memory is set to Red
LOGICMEMORY.RESET_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Reset the internal Memory to Red
LOGICMEMORY.SET_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Set the internal Memory to Green

LOGICPOWERRELAY.DESC: Automated systems save power and time by removing the need for Duplicant input.
LOGICPOWERRELAY.EFFECT: Connects to an <link=\"LOGIC\">Automation</link> grid to automatically turn <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> on or off.\n\nDoes not affect circuitry preceding the switch.
LOGICPOWERRELAY.LOGIC_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Prevent Power from flowing through connected circuits
LOGICPOWERRELAY.NAME: <link=\"LOGICPOWERRELAY\">Power Shutoff</link>

LOGICPRESSURESENSORGAS.DESC: Atmo sensors can be used to prevent excess oxygen production and overpressurization.
LOGICPRESSURESENSORGAS.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Gas pressure enters the chosen range.
LOGICPRESSURESENSORGAS.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if Gas pressure is within the selected range
LOGICPRESSURESENSORGAS.NAME: <link=\"LOGICPRESSURESENSORGAS\">Atmo Sensor</link>

LOGICPRESSURESENSORLIQUID.DESC: A hydro sensor can tell a pump to refill its basin as soon as it contains too little liquid.
LOGICPRESSURESENSORLIQUID.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Liquid pressure enters the chosen range.\n\nMust be submerged in Liquid.
LOGICPRESSURESENSORLIQUID.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if Liquid pressure is within the selected range
LOGICPRESSURESENSORLIQUID.NAME: <link=\"LOGICPRESSURESENSORLIQUID\">Hydro Sensor</link>

LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.DESC: Radiation sensors can disable buildings when they detect dangerous levels of radiation.
LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Radiation enters the chosen range.
LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if ambient Radiation is within the selected range
LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICRADIATIONSENSOR\">Radiation Sensor</link>

LOGICRIBBON.DESC: Logic ribbons use significantly less space to carry multiple automation signals.
LOGICRIBBON.EFFECT: A 4-Bit <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link> which can carry up to four automation signals.\n\nUse a <link=\"LOGICRIBBONWRITER\">Ribbon Writer</link> to output to multiple Bits, and a <link=\"LOGICRIBBONREADER\">Ribbon Reader</link> to input from multiple Bits.
LOGICRIBBON.NAME: <link=\"LOGICRIBBON\">Automation Ribbon</link>

LOGICRIBBONBRIDGE.DESC: Wire bridges allow multiple automation grids to exist in a small area without connecting.
LOGICRIBBONBRIDGE.EFFECT: Runs one <link=\"LOGICRIBBON\">Automation Ribbon</link> section over another without joining them.\n\nCan be run through wall and floor tile.
LOGICRIBBONBRIDGE.NAME: <link=\"LOGICRIBBONBRIDGE\">Automation Ribbon Bridge</link>

LOGICRIBBONREADER.DESC: Inputs the signal from a single Bit in an <link=\"LOGICRIBBON\">Automation Ribbon</link> into an <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>.
LOGICRIBBONREADER.EFFECT: Reads a Green Signal or a Red Signal from the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon onto an Automation Wire.
LOGICRIBBONREADER.INPUT_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Reads a Green Signal from selected Bit
LOGICRIBBONREADER.INPUT_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Reads a Red Signal from selected Bit
LOGICRIBBONREADER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICRIBBONREADER\">Ribbon Reader</link>
LOGICRIBBONREADER.OUTPUT_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Sends a Green Signal to attached Automation Wire
LOGICRIBBONREADER.OUTPUT_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Sends a Red Signal to attached Automation Wire

LOGICRIBBONWRITER.DESC: Translates the signal from an <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link> to a single Bit in an <link=\"LOGICRIBBON\">Automation Ribbon</link>
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.EFFECT: Writes a Green Signal or a Red Signal to the specified Bit of an Automation Ribbon\n\nAutomation Ribbon must be used as the output wire to avoid overloading.
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.INPUT_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Receives Green Signal to be written to selected Bit
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.INPUT_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Receives Red Signal to to be written selected Bit
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.NAME: <link=\"LOGICRIBBONWRITER\">Ribbon Writer</link>
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.OUTPUT_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Writes a Green Signal to selected Bit of an Automation Ribbon
LOGICRIBBONWRITER.OUTPUT_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Writes a Red Signal to selected Bit of an Automation Ribbon

LOGICSWITCH.DESC: Signal switches don't turn grids on and off like power switches, but add an extra signal.
LOGICSWITCH.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal on an Automation grid.
LOGICSWITCH.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if toggled ON
LOGICSWITCH.LOGIC_PORT_INACTIVE: Sends a Red Signal if toggled OFF
LOGICSWITCH.NAME: <link=\"LOGICSWITCH\">Signal Switch</link>

LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR.DESC: Thermo sensors can disable buildings when they approach dangerous temperatures.
LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when ambient Temperature enters the chosen range.
LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if ambient Temperature is within the selected range
LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICTEMPERATURESENSOR\">Thermo Sensor</link>

LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.DESC: Cycle sensors ensure systems always turn on at the same time, day or night, every cycle.
LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.EFFECT: Sets an automatic Green Signal and Red Signal schedule within one day-night cycle.
LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if current time is within the selected Green range
LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICTIMEOFDAYSENSOR\">Cycle Sensor</link>

LOGICTIMERSENSOR.DESC: Timer sensors create automation schedules for very short or very long periods of time.
LOGICTIMERSENSOR.EFFECT: Creates a timer to send Green Signals and Red Signals for specific amounts of time.
LOGICTIMERSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal for the selected amount of Green time
LOGICTIMERSENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_INACTIVE: Then, sends a Red Signal for the selected amount of Red time
LOGICTIMERSENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICTIMERSENSOR\">Timer Sensor</link>

LOGICWATTAGESENSOR.DESC: Wattage sensors can send a signal when a building has switched on or off.
LOGICWATTAGESENSOR.EFFECT: Sends a Green Signal or a Red Signal when Wattage consumed enters the chosen range.
LOGICWATTAGESENSOR.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal if current Wattage is within the selected range
LOGICWATTAGESENSOR.NAME: <link=\"LOGICWATTAGESENSOR\">Wattage Sensor</link>

LOGICWIRE.DESC: Automation wire is used to connect building ports to automation gates.
LOGICWIRE.EFFECT: Connects buildings to <link=\"LOGIC\">Sensors</link>.\n\nCan be run through wall and floor tile.
LOGICWIRE.NAME: <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>

LOGICWIREBRIDGE.DESC: Wire bridges allow multiple automation grids to exist in a small area without connecting.
LOGICWIREBRIDGE.EFFECT: Runs one <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link> section over another without joining them.\n\nCan be run through wall and floor tile.
LOGICWIREBRIDGE.NAME: <link=\"LOGICWIREBRIDGE\">Automation Wire Bridge</link>

LONELYMAILBOX.DESC: There's nothing quite like receiving homemade gifts in the mail.
LONELYMAILBOX.NAME: Mailbox

LONELYMINIONHOUSE.DESC: Its occupant has been alone for so long, he's forgotten what friendship feels like.
LONELYMINIONHOUSE.EFFECT: A large transport unit from the facility's sub-sub-basement.\n\nIt has been modified into a crude yet functional temporary shelter.
LONELYMINIONHOUSE.NAME: <link=\"STORYTRAITLONELYMINION\">Gravitas Shipping Container</link>

LONELYMINIONHOUSE_COMPLETE.DESC: Someone lived inside it for a while.
LONELYMINIONHOUSE_COMPLETE.EFFECT: A super-spacious container for the <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">Solid Materials</link> of your choosing.
LONELYMINIONHOUSE_COMPLETE.NAME: <link=\"STORYTRAITLONELYMINION\">Gravitas Shipping Container</link>

LUXURYBED.DESC: Duplicants prefer comfy beds to cots and wake up more rested after sleeping in them.
LUXURYBED.EFFECT: Provides a sleeping area for one Duplicant and restores additional stamina.\n\nDuplicants will automatically sleep in their assigned beds at night.

BOUNCY_BED.DESC: An inflatable party prop makes a surprisingly good bed.
BOUNCY_BED.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Bouncy Castle Bed</link>

GRANDPRIX.DESC: Where every Duplicant wakes up a winner.
GRANDPRIX.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Grand Prix Bed</link>

GREEN_MUSH.DESC: The mattress is so soft, it's almost impossible to climb out of.
GREEN_MUSH.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Comfy Mush Bed</link>

HAND.DESC: It's so nice to be held.
HAND.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Cradled Bed</link>

PUFT_BED.DESC: A comfy, if somewhat 'fragrant', place to sleep.
PUFT_BED.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Puft Bed</link>

PURPLE_BRAINFAT.DESC: A soft landing spot for swooners.
PURPLE_BRAINFAT.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Comfy Fainting Bed</link>

RED_ROSE.DESC: A pink-hued bed for rosy dreams.
RED_ROSE.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Comfy Puce Bed</link>

ROCKET_BED.DESC: Launches sleepy Duplicants into a deep-space slumber.
ROCKET_BED.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">S.S. Napmaster Bed</link>

RUBIKS.DESC: A little pattern recognition at bedtime soothes the mind.
RUBIKS.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Puzzle Cube Bed</link>

YELLOW_TARTAR.DESC: When life is icky, bed rest is the only answer.
YELLOW_TARTAR.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Comfy Ick Bed</link>

LUXURYBED.NAME: <link=\"LUXURYBED\">Comfy Bed</link>

MACHINESHOP.DESC: Duplicants will only improve the efficiency of buildings in the same room as this station.
MACHINESHOP.EFFECT: Allows the assigned <link=\"MACHINETECHNICIAN\">Engineer</link> to improve building production efficiency.\n\nThis building is a necessary component of the Machine Shop room.
MACHINESHOP.NAME: <link=\"MACHINESHOP\">Mechanics Station</link>

MANUALGENERATOR.DESC: Watching Duplicants run on it is adorable... the electrical power is just an added bonus.
MANUALGENERATOR.NAME: <link=\"MANUALGENERATOR\">Manual Generator</link>

MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER.DESC: Radbolts are necessary for producing Materials Science research.
MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER.EFFECT: Refines radioactive ores to generate Radbolts.\n\nEmits generated Radbolts in the direction of your choosing.
MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER.NAME: <link=\"MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER\">Manual Radbolt Generator</link>
MANUALHIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER.RECIPE_DESCRIPTION: Creates <link=\"RADIATION\">Radbolts</link> by processing {0}. Also creates {1} as a byproduct.

MANUALPRESSUREDOOR.DESC: Airlocks can quarter off dangerous areas and prevent gases from seeping into the colony.
MANUALPRESSUREDOOR.EFFECT: Blocks <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link> and <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gas</link> flow, maintaining pressure between areas.\n\nWild <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link> cannot pass through doors.
MANUALPRESSUREDOOR.NAME: <link=\"MANUALPRESSUREDOOR\">Manual Airlock</link>

MARBLESCULPTURE.DESC: Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.
MARBLESCULPTURE.EFFECT: Majorly increases <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link>, contributing to <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nMust be sculpted by a Duplicant.

SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_1.DESC: She's not afraid to take up space.
SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_1.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMARBLEAMAZING1\">The Large-ish Mermaid</link>

SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_2.DESC: The artist took great pleasure in conveying their displeasure.
SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_2.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMARBLEAMAZING2\">Grouchy Beast</link>

SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_4.DESC: A masterful celebration of one of the universe's most mysterious - and flatulent - organisms.
SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_4.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMARBLEAMAZING4\">Truly A-Moo-Zing</link>

SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_5.DESC: A masterful celebration of the deep bond between a horticulturalist and her prize Bristle Blossom.
SCULPTURE_MARBLE_AMAZING_5.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMARBLEAMAZING5\">Green Goddess</link>

SCULPTURE_MARBLE_CRAP_1.DESC: The artist was a very fungi.
SCULPTURE_MARBLE_CRAP_1.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMARBLECRAP1\">Lumpy Fungus</link>

MARBLESCULPTURE.NAME: <link=\"MARBLESCULPTURE\">Marble Block</link>

MASSAGETABLE.ACTIVATE_TOOLTIP: Duplicants must take a massage break when their <style=\"KKeyword\">Stress</style> reaches {0}%
MASSAGETABLE.DEACTIVATE_TOOLTIP: Breaktime ends when <style=\"KKeyword\">Stress</style> is reduced to {0}%
MASSAGETABLE.DESC: Massage tables quickly reduce extreme stress, at the cost of power production.
MASSAGETABLE.EFFECT: Rapidly reduces <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> for the Duplicant user.\n\nDuplicants will automatically seek a massage table when <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> exceeds breaktime range.

DEFAULT_MASSAGETABLE.DESC: Massage tables quickly reduce extreme stress, at the cost of power production.
DEFAULT_MASSAGETABLE.NAME: <link=\"MASSAGETABLE\">Massage Table</link>

MASSAGETABLE.NAME: <link=\"MASSAGETABLE\">Massage Table</link>

MASSIVEHEATSINK.EFFECT: A self-sustaining machine powered by what appears to be refined <link=\"UNOBTANIUM\">Neutronium</link>.\n\nAbsorbs and neutralizes <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> energy when provided with piped <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link>.
MASSIVEHEATSINK.NAME: <link=\"MASSIVEHEATSINK\">Anti Entropy Thermo-Nullifier</link>

MECHANICALSURFBOARD.DESC: Mechanical waves make for radical relaxation time.
MECHANICALSURFBOARD.EFFECT: Increases Duplicant <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nSome <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> gets splashed on the floor during use.
MECHANICALSURFBOARD.LEAK_REQUIREMENT_TOOLTIP: This building will spill {amount} of its contents on to the floor during use, which must be replenished.
MECHANICALSURFBOARD.NAME: <link=\"MECHANICALSURFBOARD\">Mechanical Surfboard</link>
MECHANICALSURFBOARD.WATER_REQUIREMENT_TOOLTIP: This building must be filled with {amount} {element} in order to function.

MEDICALCOT.DESC: Duplicants use triage cots to recover from physical injuries and receive aid from peers.
MEDICALCOT.EFFECT: Accelerates <link=\"HEALTH\">Health</link> restoration and the healing of physical injuries.\n\nRevives incapacitated Duplicants.
MEDICALCOT.NAME: <link=\"MEDICALCOT\">Triage Cot</link>

MEGABRAINTANK.EFFECT:
An organic multi-cortex repository and processing system fuelled by <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>.

Analyzes <link="DREAMJOURNAL">Dream Journals</link> produced by Duplicants wearing <link="SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS">Pajamas</link>.

Provides a sustainable boost to Duplicant skills and abilities throughout the colony.
MEGABRAINTANK.NAME: <link=\"MEGABRAINTANK\">Somnium Synthesizer</link>

MERCURYCEILINGLIGHT.DESC: Mercury ceiling lights take a while to reach full brightness, but once they do...zowie!
MERCURYCEILINGLIGHT.EFFECT: Uses <link=\"MERCURY\">Mercury</link> and <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> to produce <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link>.\n\nLight reduces Duplicant stress and is required to grow certain plants.
MERCURYCEILINGLIGHT.NAME: <link=\"MERCURYCEILINGLIGHT\">Mercury Ceiling Light</link>

MESHTILE.DESC: Mesh tile can be used to make Duplicant pathways in areas where liquid flows.
MESHTILE.EFFECT: Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.\n\nDoes not obstruct <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link> or <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gas</link> flow.
MESHTILE.NAME: <link=\"MESHTILE\">Mesh Tile</link>

METALREFINERY.DESC: Refined metals are necessary to build advanced electronics and technologies.
METALREFINERY.EFFECT:
Produces <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metals</link> from raw <link="RAWMETAL">Metal Ore</link>.

Significantly <link="HEAT">Heats</link> and outputs the <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> piped into it.

Duplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
METALREFINERY.NAME: <link=\"METALREFINERY\">Metal Refinery</link>

METALSCULPTURE.DESC: Duplicants who have learned art skills can produce more decorative sculptures.
METALSCULPTURE.EFFECT: Majorly increases <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link>, contributing to <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nMust be sculpted by a Duplicant.

SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_1.DESC: It's quite lovely, until someone stubs their toe on it in the dark.
SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_1.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALAMAZING1\">Insatiable Appetite</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_2.DESC: Not quite expressionist, but undeniably expressive.
SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_2.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALAMAZING2\">Agape</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_3.DESC: It emits no light, but it sure does brighten up a room.
SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_3.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALAMAZING3\">Friendly Flier</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_4.DESC: A masterful likeness of the mischievous critter that Duplicants love to love.
SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_4.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALAMAZING4\">Whatta Pip</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_5.DESC: What if the entire head is one big bump?
SCULPTURE_METAL_AMAZING_5.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALAMAZING5\">Phrenologist's Dream</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_CRAP_1.DESC: Actually, it's a very good likeness.
SCULPTURE_METAL_CRAP_1.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALCRAP1\">Unnatural Beauty</link>

SCULPTURE_METAL_GOOD_1.DESC: The Morb's eye is mounted on a swivel that activates at random intervals.
SCULPTURE_METAL_GOOD_1.NAME: <link=\"SCULPTUREMETALGOOD1\">Beautiful Biohazard</link>

METALSCULPTURE.NAME: <link=\"METALSCULPTURE\">Metal Block</link>

METALTILE.DESC: Heat travels much more quickly through metal tile than other types of flooring.
METALTILE.EFFECT: Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.\n\nSignificantly increases Duplicant runspeed.
METALTILE.NAME: <link=\"METALTILE\">Metal Tile</link>

METHANEGENERATOR.DESC: Natural gas generators leak polluted water and are best built above a waste reservoir.
METHANEGENERATOR.EFFECT: Converts <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link> into electrical <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.\n\nProduces <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.
METHANEGENERATOR.NAME: <link=\"METHANEGENERATOR\">Natural Gas Generator</link>

MICROBEMUSHER.DESC: Musher recipes will keep Duplicants fed, but may impact health and morale over time.
MICROBEMUSHER.EFFECT: Produces low quality <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> using common ingredients.\n\nDuplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.

DEFAULT_MICROBEMUSHER.DESC: Musher recipes will keep Duplicants fed, but may impact health and morale over time.
DEFAULT_MICROBEMUSHER.NAME: <link=\"MICROBEMUSHER\">Microbe Musher</link>

PURPLE_BRAINFAT.DESC: A colorful distraction from the actual quality of the food.
PURPLE_BRAINFAT.NAME: <link=\"MICROBEMUSHER\">Faint Purple Microbe Musher</link>

RED_ROSE.DESC: Hunger strikes are not an option, but color-coordination is.
RED_ROSE.NAME: <link=\"MICROBEMUSHER\">Puce Pink Microbe Musher</link>

YELLOW_TARTAR.DESC: Makes meals that are memorable for all the wrong reasons.
YELLOW_TARTAR.NAME: <link=\"MICROBEMUSHER\">Ick Yellow Microbe Musher</link>

MICROBEMUSHER.NAME: <link=\"MICROBEMUSHER\">Microbe Musher</link>

MILKFATSEPARATOR.DESC: Duplicants can slather up with brackwax to increase their travel speed in transit tubes.
MILKFATSEPARATOR.EFFECT: Refines <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> into <link=\"BRINE\">Brine</link> and <link=\"MILKFAT\">Brackwax</link>, and emits <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>.
MILKFATSEPARATOR.NAME: <link=\"MILKFATSEPARATOR\">Brackwax Gleaner</link>

MILKFEEDER.DESC: It's easier to tolerate overcrowding when you're all hopped up on brackene.
MILKFEEDER.EFFECT: Dispenses <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> to a wide variety of <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link>.\n\nAccessing the fountain significantly improves <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link>' moods.
MILKFEEDER.NAME: <link=\"MILKFEEDER\">Critter Fountain</link>

MILKINGSTATION.DESC: The harvested liquid is basically the equivalent of soda for critters.
MILKINGSTATION.EFFECT: Allows Duplicants with the <link=\"RANCHING2\">Critter Ranching II</link> skill to milk <link=\"MOO\">Gassy Moos</link> for <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link>.\n\n<link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> can be used to refill the <link=\"MILKFEEDER\">Critter Fountain</link>.
MILKINGSTATION.NAME: <link=\"MILKINGSTATION\">Milking Station</link>

MILKPRESS.DESC: For Duplicants who are too squeamish to milk critters.
MILKPRESS.EFFECT: Crushes organic materials to extract liquids such as <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> or <link=\"PHYTOOIL\">Phyto Oil</link>.\n\n<link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> can be used to refill the <link=\"MILKFEEDER\">Critter Fountain</link>.
MILKPRESS.NAME: <link=\"MILKPRESS\">Plant Pulverizer</link>
MILKPRESS.RESIN_FROM_AMBER_RECIPE_DESCRIPTION: Converts {0} into {1}, {2}, and a small amount of {3}

MINERALDEOXIDIZER.DESC: Oxygen diffusers are inefficient, but output enough oxygen to keep a colony breathing.
MINERALDEOXIDIZER.EFFECT: Converts large amounts of <link=\"ALGAE\">Algae</link> into <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>.\n\nBecomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
MINERALDEOXIDIZER.NAME: <link=\"MINERALDEOXIDIZER\">Oxygen Diffuser</link>

MISSILEFABRICATOR.DESC: Blastshot shells are an effective defense against incoming meteor showers.
MISSILEFABRICATOR.EFFECT: Produces <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Blastshot</link> from <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metals</link> combined with <link=\"PETROLEUM\">Petroleum</link>.\n\nDuplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.
MISSILEFABRICATOR.NAME: <link=\"MISSILEFABRICATOR\">Blastshot Maker</link>

BODY.CONTAINER1:
Fires <link="MISSILELAUNCHER">Blastshot</link> shells at meteor showers to defend the colony from impact-related damage.

Range: 16 tiles horizontally, 32 tiles vertically.

Meteors that have been blown to smithereens leave behind no harvestable resources.

MISSILELAUNCHER.DESC: Some meteors drop harvestable resources when they're blown to smithereens.
MISSILELAUNCHER.EFFECT:
Fires explosive projectiles at incoming space objects to defend the colony from impact-related damage.

Projectiles must be crafted at a <link="MISSILEFABRICATOR">Blastshot Maker</link>.

Range: 16 tiles horizontally, 32 tiles vertically.
MISSILELAUNCHER.NAME: <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Meteor Blaster</link>

MISSILESETLOCKER.DESC: A locker that once belonged to an explosives engineer.\n\nIt holds one <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Intracosmic Blastshot</link>.
MISSILESETLOCKER.NAME: Explosives Locker

MISSIONCONTROL.DESC: Like a backseat driver who actually does know better.
MISSIONCONTROL.EFFECT:
Provides guidance data to rocket pilots, to improve rocket speed.

Must be operated by a Duplicant with the <link="ASTRONOMY">Astronomy</link> skill.

Requires a clear line of sight to space in order to function.
MISSIONCONTROL.NAME: <link=\"MISSIONCONTROL\">Mission Control Station</link>

MISSIONCONTROLCLUSTER.DESC: Like a backseat driver who actually does know better.
MISSIONCONTROLCLUSTER.EFFECT:
Provides guidance data to rocket pilots within range, to improve rocket speed.

Must be operated by a Duplicant with the <link="ASTRONOMY">Astronomy</link> skill.

Requires a clear line of sight to space in order to function.
MISSIONCONTROLCLUSTER.NAME: <link=\"MISSIONCONTROLCLUSTER\">Mission Control Station</link>

MODULARGASINPUT.DESC: A hub from which to input <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gas</link>.
MODULARGASINPUT.NAME: <link=\"MODULARGASINPUT\">Gas Input Hub</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTBRIDGE.DESC: Allows rocket platforms to be built farther apart.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTBRIDGE.EFFECT: Automatically links when built to the side of a <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link> or any <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID\">Rocket Port</link>.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTBRIDGE.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTBRIDGE\">Rocket Port Extension</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGAS.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGAS.EFFECT:
Loads <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the gas filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGAS.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGAS\">Gas Rocket Port Loader</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGASUNLOADER.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGASUNLOADER.EFFECT:
Unloads <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the gas filters set on this unloader.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGASUNLOADER.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTGASUNLOADER\">Gas Rocket Port Unloader</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUID.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUID.EFFECT:
Loads <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the liquid filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUID.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUID\">Liquid Rocket Port Loader</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUIDUNLOADER.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUIDUNLOADER.EFFECT:
Unloads <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the liquid filters set on this unloader.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUIDUNLOADER.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTLIQUIDUNLOADER\">Liquid Rocket Port Unloader</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID.EFFECT:
Loads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solids</link> to the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the solid material filters set on the rocket's cargo bays.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID\">Solid Rocket Port Loader</link>

MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLIDUNLOADER.DESC: Rockets must be landed to load or unload resources.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLIDUNLOADER.EFFECT:
Unloads <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solids</link> from the storage of a linked rocket.

Automatically links when built to the side of a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link> or another <link="MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLID">Rocket Port</link>.

Uses the solid material filters set on this unloader.
MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLIDUNLOADER.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLAUNCHPADPORTSOLIDUNLOADER\">Solid Rocket Port Unloader</link>

MODULARLIQUIDINPUT.DESC: A hub from which to input <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link>.
MODULARLIQUIDINPUT.NAME: <link=\"MODULARLIQUIDINPUT\">Liquid Input Hub</link>

MODULARSOLIDINPUT.DESC: A hub from which to input <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">Solids</link>.
MODULARSOLIDINPUT.NAME: <link=\"MODULARSOLIDINPUT\">Solid Input Hub</link>

MONUMENTBOTTOM.DESC: The base of a monument must be constructed first.
MONUMENTBOTTOM.EFFECT:
Builds the bottom section of a Great Monument.

Can be customized.

A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.

OPTION_F.DESC: One knee tucked toward the other.
OPTION_F.NAME: On Asteroid V

OPTION_H.DESC: Atop a pair of conquered critters.
OPTION_H.NAME: Hatch Hunter

OPTION_K.DESC: One must give the soul time to truly hatch.
OPTION_K.NAME: Egg Equanimity

OPTION_M.DESC: In honor of the sugar engine.
OPTION_M.NAME: Sweet Seat

OPTION_N.DESC: Riding a carbon dioxide rocket engine to glory.
OPTION_N.NAME: CO2 Straddle

OPTION_O.DESC: Atop a small petroleum rocket engine.
OPTION_O.NAME: Petroleum Pose

OPTION_P.DESC: Atop a solo spacefarer rocket nosecone.
OPTION_P.NAME: Spacefarer Stance

OPTION_T.DESC: Atop a happy lil' Sweepy bot.
OPTION_T.NAME: Sweepy III

MONUMENTBOTTOM.NAME: <link=\"MONUMENTBOTTOM\">Monument Base</link>

MONUMENTMIDDLE.DESC: Customized sections of a Great Monument can be mixed and matched.
MONUMENTMIDDLE.EFFECT:
Builds the middle section of a Great Monument.

Can be customized.

A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.

OPTION_D.DESC: Makes the torso seem bigger and more intimidating than it is.
OPTION_D.NAME: Hands on Hips

OPTION_E.DESC: Sometimes things are good enough just as they are.
OPTION_E.NAME: The Shrug

OPTION_K.DESC: Hands hover slightly away from the body, as though raised in wonder.
OPTION_K.NAME: Arms Ajar

OPTION_L.DESC: Cradling a couple of smooth lil' critter babies.
OPTION_L.NAME: Babes in Arms I

OPTION_N.DESC: An armful of chonky lil' critter babies.
OPTION_N.NAME: Babes in Arms II

MONUMENTMIDDLE.NAME: <link=\"MONUMENTMIDDLE\">Monument Midsection</link>

MONUMENTTOP.DESC: Building a Great Monument will declare to the universe that this hunk of rock is your own.
MONUMENTTOP.EFFECT:
Builds the top section of a Great Monument.

Can be customized.

A Great Monument must be built to achieve the Colonize Imperative.

OPTION_A.DESC: A massive replica of Leira's smiling face.
OPTION_A.NAME: Leira Noggin

OPTION_B.DESC: A massive replica of Gossmann's determined gaze.
OPTION_B.NAME: Gossmann Noggin

OPTION_D.DESC: A massive replica of Nikola's post-explosion expression.
OPTION_D.NAME: Nikola Noggin

OPTION_E.DESC: A massive replica of Burt's critter-spotting expression.
OPTION_E.NAME: Burt Noggin

OPTION_F.DESC: A massive replica of Rowan's serene smile.
OPTION_F.NAME: Rowan Noggin

OPTION_G.DESC: A massive replica of Nisbet when she sees someone whose name she's forgotten.
OPTION_G.NAME: Nisbet Noggin

OPTION_H.DESC: A massive replica of Ashkan's fossil-discovering expression.
OPTION_H.NAME: Ashkan Noggin

OPTION_I.DESC: A massive replica of Ren's smoochy face.
OPTION_I.NAME: Ren Noggin

OPTION_M.DESC: A great-monument-sized Gassy Moo. Gassier and moo-ier than ever.
OPTION_M.NAME: Gassy Moo Top

OPTION_T.DESC: A great-monument-sized Plug Slug. Does not require a power source.
OPTION_T.NAME: Plug Slug Top

OPTION_V.DESC: It has no mouth, but still looks like it's smiling.
OPTION_V.NAME: Rover Top

OPTION_W.DESC: A visual reminder about radiation safety.
OPTION_W.NAME: Radsick Top I

OPTION_Y.DESC: A cautionary tale for careless Duplicants.
OPTION_Y.NAME: Radsick Top III

OPTION_Z.DESC: Excellent choice of decor for the entrance to highly radioactive site.
OPTION_Z.NAME: Radsick Top IV

MONUMENTTOP.NAME: <link=\"MONUMENTTOP\">Monument Top</link>

MORBROVERMAKER.DESC: Allows a skilled Duplicant to manufacture a steady supply of icky yet effective bots.
MORBROVERMAKER.EFFECT: Uses <link=\"ZOMBIESPORES\">Zombie Spores</link> and <link=\"STEEL\">Steel</link> to craft biofueled machines that can be sent into hostile environments.\n\nDefunct <link=\"STORYTRAITMORBROVER\">Biobots</link> drop harvestable <link=\"STEEL\">Steel</link>.
MORBROVERMAKER.NAME: <link=\"STORYTRAITMORBROVER\">Biobot Builder</link>

MOULDINGTILE.DESC: Trimming is used as purely decorative lining for walls and structures.
MOULDINGTILE.EFFECT: Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.\n\nIncreases <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link>, contributing to <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.
MOULDINGTILE.NAME: <link=\"MOUDLINGTILE\">Trimming Tile</link>

MULTIMINIONDININGTABLE.DESC: Given the option, Duplicants prefer to dine with friends.
MULTIMINIONDININGTABLE.EFFECT: Gives three Duplicants a place to eat.\n\nSharing a meal with one or more companions provides a <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> boost.
MULTIMINIONDININGTABLE.NAME: <link=\"MULTIMINIONDININGTABLE\">Communal Table</link>

NOSECONEBASIC.DESC: Every rocket requires a nosecone to fly.
NOSECONEBASIC.EFFECT: Protects a rocket during takeoff and entry, enabling space travel.\n\nMust be built via <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>, and built at the top of a rocket.
NOSECONEBASIC.NAME: <link=\"NOSECONEBASIC\">Basic Nosecone</link>

NOSECONEHARVEST.DESC: Collecting the drilled-out resources requires a storage module.
NOSECONEHARVEST.EFFECT:
Enables a rocket to drill into interstellar debris to free up <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gas</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquid</link> and <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">solid</link> resources in space.

Engine must be built via <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link>. 

Must be built at the top of a rocket with <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gas</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquid</link> or <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">solid</link> Cargo Module attached to store the appropriate resources.
NOSECONEHARVEST.NAME: <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link>

NUCLEARREACTOR.DESC: Radbolt generators and reflectors make radiation usable by other buildings.
NUCLEARREACTOR.EFFECT: Uses <link=\"ENRICHEDURANIUM\">Enriched Uranium</link> to produce <link=\"RADIATION\">Radiation</link> for Radbolt production.\n\nGenerates a massive amount of <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link>. Overheating will result in an explosive meltdown.
NUCLEARREACTOR.NAME: <link=\"NUCLEARREACTOR\">Research Reactor</link>

NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER.DESC: Comes with a few ions thrown in, free of charge.
NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER.EFFECT:
Conducts <link="RESEARCHDLC1">Materials Science Research</link> to unlock new technologies.

Consumes Radbolts.

Assigned Duplicants must possess the <link="ATOMICRESEARCH">Applied Sciences Research</link> skill.
NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER.NAME: <link=\"NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER\">Materials Study Terminal</link>

OBJECTDISPENSER.DESC: Automatic dispensers will store and drop resources in small quantities.
OBJECTDISPENSER.EFFECT: Stores any Solid Materials delivered to it by Duplicants.\n\nDumps stored materials back into the world when it receives a Green Signal.
OBJECTDISPENSER.NAME: <link=\"OBJECTDISPENSER\">Automatic Dispenser</link>

OILCHANGER.DESC: A fresh supply of oil keeps the ol' joints from getting too creaky.
OILCHANGER.EFFECT: Uses <link=\"LUBRICATINGOIL\">Gear Oil</link> to keep Duplicants' bionic parts running smoothly.
OILCHANGER.NAME: <link=\"OILCHANGER\">Lubrication Station</link>

OILREFINERY.DESC: Petroleum can only be produced from the refinement of crude oil.
OILREFINERY.NAME: <link=\"OILREFINERY\">Oil Refinery</link>

OILWELLCAP.DESC: Water pumped into an oil reservoir cannot be recovered.
OILWELLCAP.EFFECT: Extracts <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link> using clean <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.\n\nMust be built atop an <link=\"OILWELL\">Oil Reservoir</link>.
OILWELLCAP.NAME: <link=\"OILWELLCAP\">Oil Well</link>

ORBITALCARGOMODULE.DESC: It's a generally good idea to pack some supplies when exploring unknown worlds.
ORBITALCARGOMODULE.EFFECT: Delivers cargo to the surface of Planetoids that do not yet have a <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>. \n\nMust be built via Rocket Platform.
ORBITALCARGOMODULE.NAME: <link=\"ORBITALCARGOMODULE\">Orbital Cargo Module</link>

ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER.DESC: Orbital Data Collection Labs record data while orbiting a Planetoid and write it to a <link=\"ORBITALRESEARCHDATABANK\">Data Bank</link>.
ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER.EFFECT: Creates <link=\"ORBITALRESEARCHDATABANK\">Data Banks</link> that can be consumed at a <link=\"DLC1COSMICRESEARCHCENTER\">Virtual Planetarium</link> to unlock new technologies.\n\nConsumes <link=\"POLYPROPYLENE\">Plastic</link> and <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.
ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER.NAME: <link=\"ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER\">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>

ORESCRUBBER.DESC: Scrubbers sanitize freshly mined materials before they're brought into the colony.
ORESCRUBBER.EFFECT: Kills a significant amount of <link=\"DISEASE\">Germs</link> present on <link=\"RAWMINERAL\">Raw Ore</link>.
ORESCRUBBER.NAME: <link=\"ORESCRUBBER\">Ore Scrubber</link>

OUTHOUSE.DESC: The colony that eats together, excretes together.
OUTHOUSE.EFFECT:
Gives Duplicants a place to relieve themselves.

Requires no <link="LIQUIDPIPING">Piping</link>.

Must be periodically emptied of <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>.
OUTHOUSE.NAME: <link=\"OUTHOUSE\">Outhouse</link>

OXIDIZERTANK.DESC: Solid oxidizers allows rocket fuel to be efficiently burned in the vacuum of space.
OXIDIZERTANK.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> and other oxidizers for burning rocket fuels.
OXIDIZERTANK.NAME: <link=\"OXIDIZERTANK\">Solid Oxidizer Tank</link>

OXIDIZERTANKCLUSTER.DESC: Solid oxidizers allows rocket fuel to be efficiently burned in the vacuum of space.
OXIDIZERTANKCLUSTER.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> and other oxidizers for burning rocket fuels.\n\nMust be built via <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>.
OXIDIZERTANKCLUSTER.NAME: <link=\"OXIDIZERTANKCLUSTER\">Large Solid Oxidizer Tank</link>

OXIDIZERTANKLIQUID.DESC: Liquid oxygen improves the thrust-to-mass ratio of rocket fuels.
OXIDIZERTANKLIQUID.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"LIQUIDOXYGEN\">Liquid Oxygen</link> for burning rocket fuels.
OXIDIZERTANKLIQUID.NAME: <link=\"OXIDIZERTANKLIQUID\">Liquid Oxidizer Tank</link>

OXIDIZERTANKLIQUIDCLUSTER.DESC: Liquid oxygen improves the thrust-to-mass ratio of rocket fuels.
OXIDIZERTANKLIQUIDCLUSTER.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"LIQUIDOXYGEN\">Liquid Oxygen</link> for burning rocket fuels. \n\nMust be built via <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>.
OXIDIZERTANKLIQUIDCLUSTER.NAME: <link=\"OXIDIZERTANKLIQUIDCLUSTER\">Liquid Oxidizer Tank</link>

OXYGENMASKLOCKER.DESC: An oxygen mask dock will store and refill masks while they're not in use.
OXYGENMASKLOCKER.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"OXYGENMASK\">Oxygen Masks</link> and refuels them with <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>.\n\nBuild next to an <link=\"OXYGENMASKMARKER\">Oxygen Mask Checkpoint</link> to make Duplicants put on masks when passing by.
OXYGENMASKLOCKER.NAME: <link=\"OXYGENMASKLOCKER\">Oxygen Mask Dock</link>

OXYGENMASKMARKER.DESC: A checkpoint must have a correlating dock built on the opposite side its arrow faces.
OXYGENMASKMARKER.EFFECT:
Marks a threshold where Duplicants must put on or take off an <link="OXYGENMASK">Oxygen Mask</link>.

Must be built next to an <link="OXYGENMASKLOCKER">Oxygen Mask Dock</link>.

Can be rotated before construction.
OXYGENMASKMARKER.NAME: <link=\"OXYGENMASKMARKER\">Oxygen Mask Checkpoint</link>

OXYGENMASKSTATION.DESC: Duplicants can't pass by a station if it lacks enough oxygen to fill a mask.
OXYGENMASKSTATION.EFFECT:
Uses designated <link="METAL">Metal Ores</link> from filter settings to create <link="OXYGENMASK">Oxygen Masks</link>.

Automatically draws in ambient <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> to fill masks.

Marks a threshold where Duplicants must put on or take off a mask.

Can be rotated before construction.
OXYGENMASKSTATION.NAME: <link=\"OXYGENMASKSTATION\">Oxygen Mask Station</link>

OXYLITEREFINERY.DESC: Oxylite is a solid and easily transportable source of consumable oxygen.
OXYLITEREFINERY.EFFECT: Synthesizes <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> using <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> and a small amount of <link=\"GOLD\">Gold</link>.
OXYLITEREFINERY.NAME: <link=\"OXYLITEREFINERY\">Oxylite Refinery</link>

OXYSCONCE.DESC: Sconces prevent diffused oxygen from being wasted inside storage bins.
OXYSCONCE.EFFECT: Stores a small chunk of <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> which gradually releases <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> into the environment.
OXYSCONCE.NAME: <link=\"OXYSCONCE\">Oxylite Sconce</link>

PARKSIGN.DESC: Passing through parks will increase Duplicant Morale.
PARKSIGN.EFFECT: Classifies an area as a Park or Nature Reserve.
PARKSIGN.NAME: <link=\"PARKSIGN\">Park Sign</link>

PARTYCAKE.DESC: Any way you slice it, that's a good looking cake.
PARTYCAKE.EFFECT: Increases <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link>, contributing to <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nAdds a <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> bonus to Duplicants' parties.
PARTYCAKE.NAME: <link=\"PARTYCAKE\">Triple Decker Cake</link>

PEATGENERATOR.DESC: It gives off an aroma that some Duplicants find inexplicably nostalgic.
PEATGENERATOR.EFFECT: Burns <link=\"PEAT\">Peat</link> to produce electrical <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.\n\nProduces a small amount of <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.
PEATGENERATOR.NAME: <link=\"PEATGENERATOR\">Peat Burner</link>

PETROLEUMGENERATOR.DESC: Petroleum generators have a high energy output but produce a great deal of waste.
PETROLEUMGENERATOR.EFFECT: Converts <link=\"PETROLEUM\">Petroleum</link>, <link=\"ETHANOL\">Ethanol</link> or <link=\"REFINEDLIPID\">Biodiesel</link> into electrical <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.\n\nProduces <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.
PETROLEUMGENERATOR.NAME: <link=\"PETROLEUMGENERATOR\">Petroleum Generator</link>

PHONOBOX.DESC: Dancing helps Duplicants get their innermost feelings out.
PHONOBOX.EFFECT: Plays music for Duplicants to dance to on their breaks.\n\nIncreases Duplicant <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.
PHONOBOX.NAME: <link=\"PHONOBOX\">Jukebot</link>

PIONEERLANDER.DESC: Lands a Duplicant on a Planetoid from an orbiting <link=\"PIONEERMODULE\">Trailblazer Module</link>.
PIONEERLANDER.NAME: <link=\"PIONEERMODULE\">Trailblazer Lander</link>

PIONEERMODULE.DESC: That's one small step for Dupekind.
PIONEERMODULE.EFFECT:
Enables travel to Planetoids that do not yet have a <link="LAUNCHPAD">Rocket Platform</link>.

Can hold one Duplicant traveller.

Deployment is available while in a Starmap hex adjacent to a Planetoid. 

Must be built via Rocket Platform.
PIONEERMODULE.NAME: <link=\"PIONEERMODULE\">Trailblazer Module</link>

PIXELPACK.DESC: Four pixels which can be individually designated different colors.
PIXELPACK.EFFECT: Pixels can be designated a color when it receives a Green Signal and a different color when it receives a Red Signal.\n\nInput from an Automation Wire controls the whole strip. Input from an Automation Ribbon can control individual pixels on the strip.
PIXELPACK.INPUT_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Display the configured Green Signal pixels
PIXELPACK.INPUT_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Display the configured Red Signal pixels
PIXELPACK.NAME: <link=\"PIXELPACK\">Pixel Pack</link>

PLANTERBOX.DESC: Domestically grown seeds mature more quickly than wild plants.

BRISTLEBLOSSOM.DESC: The interior is lined with tiny barbs.
BRISTLEBLOSSOM.NAME: <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Bristly Green Planter Box</link>

DEFAULT_PLANTERBOX.DESC: Domestically grown seeds mature more quickly than wild plants.
DEFAULT_PLANTERBOX.NAME: <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Planter Box</link>

SALMON_PINK.DESC: It's not exactly a subtle color.
SALMON_PINK.NAME: <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Flashy Planter Box</link>

SLEETWHEAT.DESC: The thick paint drips are invisible from a distance.
SLEETWHEAT.NAME: <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Sleet Blue Planter Box</link>

PLANTERBOX.NAME: <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Planter Box</link>

PLASTICFLOWERS.DESCRIPTION: Maintenance-free blooms that will outlive us all.
PLASTICFLOWERS.LORE_DLC2: Manufactured by Home Staging Heroes Ltd. as commissioned by the Gravitas Facility, to \"Make Space Feel More Like Home.\"\n\nThis bouquet is designed to smell like freshly baked cookies.
PLASTICFLOWERS.NAME: Plastic Flowers

PLASTICTILE.DESC: Plastic tile is mildly antiseptic and can help limit the spread of germs in a colony.
PLASTICTILE.EFFECT: Used to build the walls and floors of rooms.\n\nSignificantly increases Duplicant runspeed.
PLASTICTILE.NAME: <link=\"PLASTICTILE\">Plastic Tile</link>

POIBUNKEREXTERIORDOOR.EFFECT: A strong door with a sophisticated genetic lock.
POIBUNKEREXTERIORDOOR.NAME: Security Door

POIDLC2SHOWROOMDOOR.EFFECT: Large double doors identical to those you might find at the main entrance to a large facility.
POIDLC2SHOWROOMDOOR.NAME: Showroom Doors

POIDOORINTERNAL.EFFECT: A strong door with a sophisticated genetic lock.
POIDOORINTERNAL.NAME: Security Door

POIFACILITYDOOR.EFFECT: Large double doors that were once the main entrance to a large facility.
POIFACILITYDOOR.NAME: Lobby Doors

POLYMERIZER.DESC: Plastic can be used to craft unique buildings and goods.
POLYMERIZER.NAME: <link=\"POLYMERIZER\">Polymer Press</link>

POWERCONTROLSTATION.DESC: Only one Duplicant may be assigned to a station at a time.
POWERCONTROLSTATION.EFFECT: Produces <link=\"POWERSTATIONTOOLS\">Microchip</link> to increase the <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> output of generators.\n\nAssigned Duplicants must possess the <link=\"TECHNICALS2\">Tune Up</link> trait.
POWERCONTROLSTATION.NAME: <link=\"POWERCONTROLSTATION\">Power Control Station</link>

POWERTRANSFORMER.DESC: It's a power transformer, but larger.
POWERTRANSFORMER.EFFECT:
Limits <link="POWER">Power</link> flowing through the Transformer to 4 kW.

Connect <link="BATTERY">Batteries</link> on the large side to act as a valve and prevent <link="WIRE">Wires</link> from drawing more than 4 kW.

Can be rotated before construction.
POWERTRANSFORMER.NAME: <link=\"POWERTRANSFORMER\">Large Power Transformer</link>

POWERTRANSFORMERSMALL.DESC: Limiting the power drawn by wires prevents them from incurring overload damage.
POWERTRANSFORMERSMALL.EFFECT:
Limits <link="POWER">Power</link> flowing through the Transformer to 1000 W.

Connect <link="BATTERY">Batteries</link> on the large side to act as a valve and prevent <link="WIRE">Wires</link> from drawing more than 1000 W.

Can be rotated before construction.
POWERTRANSFORMERSMALL.NAME: <link=\"POWERTRANSFORMERSMALL\">Power Transformer</link>

PRESSUREDOOR.DESC: Mechanized airlocks open and close more quickly than other types of door.
PRESSUREDOOR.EFFECT:
Blocks <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> and <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> flow, maintaining pressure between areas.

Functions as a <link="MANUALPRESSUREDOOR">Manual Airlock</link> when no <link="POWER">Power</link> is available.

Wild <link="CREATURES">Critters</link> cannot pass through doors.
PRESSUREDOOR.NAME: <link=\"PRESSUREDOOR\">Mechanized Airlock</link>

PRESSURESWITCHGAS.DESC: An atmo switch shuts off power when the air pressure surrounding it surpasses the set threshold.
PRESSURESWITCHGAS.EFFECT: Automatically turns <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> on or off using ambient <link=\"PRESSURE\">Gas Pressure</link> .\n\nDoes not affect circuitry preceding the switch.
PRESSURESWITCHGAS.NAME: <link=\"PRESSURESWITCHGAS\">Atmo Switch</link>

PRESSURESWITCHLIQUID.DESC: A hydro switch shuts off power when the liquid pressure surrounding it surpasses the set threshold.
PRESSURESWITCHLIQUID.EFFECT:
Automatically turns <link="POWER">Power</link> on or off using ambient <link="PRESSURE">Liquid Pressure</link>.

Does not affect circuitry preceding the switch.

Must be submerged in <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>.
PRESSURESWITCHLIQUID.NAME: <link=\"PRESSURESWITCHLIQUID\">Hydro Switch</link>

PROPCERESPOSTERA.DESC: A poster promoting a local tourist attraction.\n\nActual scenery may vary.
PROPCERESPOSTERA.NAME: Travel Poster

PROPCERESPOSTERB.DESC: A poster promoting local wildlife.\n\nThe first in an unfinished series.
PROPCERESPOSTERB.NAME: Travel Poster

PROPCERESPOSTERLARGE.DESC: A sound-absorbing panel that makes small-space living more bearable.\n\nThe artwork features a  power source.
PROPCERESPOSTERLARGE.NAME: Acoustic Art Panel

PROPCLOCK.DESC: A simple wall clock.\n\nIt is no longer ticking.
PROPCLOCK.NAME: Clock

PROPCLOTHESHANGER.DESC: Holds one <link=\"WARMVEST\">Warm Coat</link>.\n\nIt'd be silly not to use it.
PROPCLOTHESHANGER.NAME: Coat Rack

PROPDESK.DESC: An intact office desk, decorated with several personal belongings and a barely functioning computer.
PROPDESK.NAME: Computer Desk

PROPDLC2DISPLAY1.DESC: An electronic display projecting the blueprint of an engineering project.\n\nIt looks like a pump of some kind.
PROPDLC2DISPLAY1.NAME: Electronic Display

PROPDLC2GEOTHERMALCART.DESC: Maintenance equipment that once flushed debris out of complex mechanisms.\n\nOne of the wheels is squeaky.
PROPDLC2GEOTHERMALCART.NAME: Service Cart

PROPELEVATOR.DESC: Out of service.\n\nThe buttons inside indicate it went down more than a dozen floors at one point in time.
PROPELEVATOR.NAME: Broken Elevator

PROPEXOSETLOCKER.DESC: A locker made with ultra-lightweight textiles.\n\nIt contains an assortment of personal effects.
PROPEXOSETLOCKER.NAME: Off-site Locker

PROPEXOSHELFLONG.DESC: A shelf made out of flat-packed pieces that can be assembled in various ways.\n\nThis is the long way.
PROPEXOSHELFLONG.NAME: Long Prefab Shelf

PROPEXOSHELSHORT.DESC: A shelf made out of flat-packed pieces that can be assembled in various ways.\n\nIt looks nice, actually.
PROPEXOSHELSHORT.NAME: Prefab Shelf

PROPFACILITYCHAIR.DESC: A chair where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.
PROPFACILITYCHAIR.NAME: Lobby Chair

PROPFACILITYCHANDELIER.DESC: A large chandelier that hangs from the ceiling.\n\nIt does not appear to function.
PROPFACILITYCHANDELIER.NAME: Chandelier

PROPFACILITYCOUCH.DESC: A couch where visitors can comfortably wait before their appointments.
PROPFACILITYCOUCH.NAME: Lobby Couch

PROPFACILITYDESK.DESC:
A spotless desk filled with impeccably organized office supplies.

A photo peeks out from beneath the desk pad, depicting two beaming young women in caps and gowns.

The photo is quite old.
PROPFACILITYDESK.NAME: Director's Desk

PROPFACILITYDISPLAY1.DESC: An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.\n\nIt looks like a Printing Pod.
PROPFACILITYDISPLAY1.NAME: Electronic Display

PROPFACILITYDISPLAY2.DESC: An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a familiar device.\n\nIt looks like a Mining Gun.
PROPFACILITYDISPLAY2.NAME: Electronic Display

PROPFACILITYDISPLAY3.DESC: An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a strange device.\n\nPerhaps these displays were used to entice visitors.
PROPFACILITYDISPLAY3.NAME: Electronic Display

PROPFACILITYGLOBEDROORS.DESC: A filing cabinet for storing hard copy employee records.\n\nThe contents have been shredded.
PROPFACILITYGLOBEDROORS.NAME: Filing Cabinet

PROPFACILITYLAMP.DESC: A long light fixture that hangs from the ceiling.\n\nIt does not appear to function.
PROPFACILITYLAMP.NAME: Light Fixture

PROPFACILITYPAINTING.DESC: A painting featuring a copse of fir trees and a magnificent mountain range on the horizon.\n\nThe air in the room prickles with the sensation that I'm not meant to be here.
PROPFACILITYPAINTING.NAME: Landscape Portrait

PROPFACILITYSTATUE.DESC: A large, modern sculpture that sits in the center of the lobby.\n\nIt's an artistic cross between an hourglass shape and a double helix.
PROPFACILITYSTATUE.NAME: Gravitas Monument

PROPFACILITYTABLE.DESC: A low coffee table that may have once held old science magazines.
PROPFACILITYTABLE.NAME: Coffee Table

PROPFACILITYTALLPLANT.DESC: It's survived the vacuum of space by virtue of being plastic.
PROPFACILITYTALLPLANT.NAME: Office Plant

PROPFACILITYWALLDEGREE.DESC: Certification in Applied Physics, awarded in recognition of one \"Jacquelyn A. Stern\".
PROPFACILITYWALLDEGREE.NAME: Doctorate Degree

PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMMIRROR.DESC: A one-way mirror and shelf.\n\nThe skincare products still smell faintly of shea butter.
PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMMIRROR.NAME: Mirror

PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMSINK.DESC: A handwashing station that looks suspiciously under-utilized.\n\nIt was once part of a bulk office order.
PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMSINK.NAME: Enamel Sink

PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMTOILETPAPERHOLDER.DESC: It holds one roll of sanitary paper.\n\nThe sheets are single-ply.
PROPGRAVITASBATHROOMTOILETPAPERHOLDER.NAME: Toilet Paper Holder

PROPGRAVITASCEILINGLIGHT.DESC: A flush mount ceiling light that no longer functions.\n\nThere's dust inside.
PROPGRAVITASCEILINGLIGHT.NAME: Light Fixture

PROPGRAVITASCEILINGROBOT.DESC: Non-functioning robotic arms that once assisted lab technicians.
PROPGRAVITASCEILINGROBOT.NAME: Ceiling Robot

PROPGRAVITASCLOCKSQUARE.DESC: A square wall clock.\n\nIt's quite damaged.
PROPGRAVITASCLOCKSQUARE.NAME: Clock

PROPGRAVITASCREATUREPOSTER.DESC: An anatomical illustration of the very first <link=\"HATCH\">Hatch</link> ever produced.\n\nWhile the ratio of egg sac to brain may appear outlandish, it is in fact to scale.
PROPGRAVITASCREATUREPOSTER.NAME: Anatomy Poster

PROPGRAVITASDECORATIVEWINDOW.DESC: A tall, thin window which once pointed to a courtyard.
PROPGRAVITASDECORATIVEWINDOW.NAME: Window

PROPGRAVITASDESK.DESC: The unkempt workspace of a long-departed scientist who expected to return.
PROPGRAVITASDESK.NAME: Biophysics Research Desk

PROPGRAVITASDESKPODIUM.DESC: A clutter-proof desk to minimize distractions.\n\nThere appears to be something stored in the computer.
PROPGRAVITASDESKPODIUM.NAME: Computer Podium

PROPGRAVITASDISPLAY4.DESC: An electronic display projecting the blueprint of a robotic device.\n\nIt looks like a ceiling robot.
PROPGRAVITASDISPLAY4.NAME: Electronic Display

PROPGRAVITASFIREEXTINGUISHER.DESC: Essential lab equipment.\n\nThe inspection tag indicates it has long expired.
PROPGRAVITASFIREEXTINGUISHER.NAME: Broken Fire Extinguisher

PROPGRAVITASFIRSTAIDKIT.DESC: It looks like it's been used a lot.
PROPGRAVITASFIRSTAIDKIT.NAME: First Aid Kit

PROPGRAVITASFLIPPHONE.DESC: An outdated phone left behind by a distracted lab technician.\n\nIt doesn't work.
PROPGRAVITASFLIPPHONE.NAME: Flip Phone

PROPGRAVITASFLOORROBOT.DESC: The grasping robotic claw designed to assist technicians in a lab.
PROPGRAVITASFLOORROBOT.NAME: Robotic Arm

PROPGRAVITASFRIDGE.DESC: A non-functional cold storage unit full of expired samples.\n\nIt was originally someone's home appliance.
PROPGRAVITASFRIDGE.NAME: Mini Fridge

PROPGRAVITASHANDSCANNER.DESC: A sophisticated security device.\n\nIt appears to use a method other than fingerprints to verify an individual's identity.
PROPGRAVITASHANDSCANNER.NAME: Hand Scanner

PROPGRAVITASJAR1.DESC: An abnormally large brain floating in embalming liquid to prevent decomposition.
PROPGRAVITASJAR1.NAME: Big Brain Jar

PROPGRAVITASJAR2.DESC: The corpse of a proto-hatch creature meticulously preserved in a jar.
PROPGRAVITASJAR2.NAME: Sample Jar

PROPGRAVITASLABTABLE.DESC: The quaint research desk of a departed lab technician.\n\nPerhaps the computer stores something of interest.
PROPGRAVITASLABTABLE.NAME: Lab Desk

PROPGRAVITASLABWALL.EFFECT: A regular wall that once existed in a working lab.
PROPGRAVITASLABWALL.NAME: Lab Wall

PROPGRAVITASLABWINDOW.EFFECT: A lab window. Formerly a portal to the outside world.
PROPGRAVITASLABWINDOW.NAME: Lab Window

PROPGRAVITASLABWINDOWHORIZONTAL.EFFECT: A lab window.\n\nSomeone once stared out of this, contemplating the results of an experiment.
PROPGRAVITASLABWINDOWHORIZONTAL.NAME: Lab Window

PROPGRAVITASPAPERTOLELDISPENSER.DESC: It once dispensed paper made from 100% post-consumer recycled content.\n\nThe remaining sheet is jammed.
PROPGRAVITASPAPERTOLELDISPENSER.NAME: Paper Towel Dispenser

PROPGRAVITASPOSTERPLANTS.DESC: A handy reference text with illustrations.\n\nIt details the genetic makeup of proprietary botanicals.
PROPGRAVITASPOSTERPLANTS.NAME: Wall Chart

PROPGRAVITASPOSTERSEED.DESC: A handy reference text with illustrations.\n\nIt compares the genetic makeup of select organisms.
PROPGRAVITASPOSTERSEED.NAME: Wall Chart

PROPGRAVITASPOTPLANTDEAD.DESC: A very dead plant.\n\nIt's a wonder it hasn't crumbled into nothingness.
PROPGRAVITASPOTPLANTDEAD.NAME: Dead Plant

PROPGRAVITASROBTICTABLE.DESC: The work space of an extinct robotics technician who left behind some unfinished prototypes.
PROPGRAVITASROBTICTABLE.NAME: Robotics Research Desk

PROPGRAVITASSHELF.DESC: A shelf holding jars just out of reach for a short person.
PROPGRAVITASSHELF.NAME: Shelf

PROPGRAVITASSMALLSEEDLOCKER.DESC: A small glass cabinet.\n\nThere's a biohazard symbol on it.
PROPGRAVITASSMALLSEEDLOCKER.NAME: Wall Cabinet

PROPGRAVITASTOOLCRATE.DESC: A packing crate intended for safety equipment.\n\nIt has been repurposed for tool storage.
PROPGRAVITASTOOLCRATE.NAME: Tool Crate

PROPGRAVITASTOOLSHELF.DESC: A wall-mounted rack for storing and displaying useful tools at a not-so-useful height.
PROPGRAVITASTOOLSHELF.NAME: Tool Rack

PROPGRAVITASTRASHCAN.DESC: A wall-mounted garbage receptacle.\n\nThe lid does not close.
PROPGRAVITASTRASHCAN.NAME: Trash Can

PROPGRAVITASWALL.EFFECT: The wall of a once-great scientific facility.
PROPGRAVITASWALL.NAME: Wall

PROPGRAVITASWALLPURPLE.EFFECT: The wall of an ambitious research and development department.
PROPGRAVITASWALLPURPLE.NAME: Wall

PROPGRAVITASWALLPURPLEWHITEDIAGONAL.EFFECT: The wall of an ambitious research and development department.
PROPGRAVITASWALLPURPLEWHITEDIAGONAL.NAME: Wall

PROPHUMANCHESTERFIELDCHAIR.DESC: A luxurious chair where future generations can comfortably sit and dream of home.
PROPHUMANCHESTERFIELDCHAIR.NAME: Showroom Chair

PROPHUMANCHESTERFIELDSOFA.DESC: A luxurious couch where potential residents can comfortably nap and dream of home.
PROPHUMANCHESTERFIELDSOFA.NAME: Showroom Couch

PROPHUMANMURPHYBED.DESC: A bed that folds into the wall, for small live/work spaces.\n\nThis is the display model.
PROPHUMANMURPHYBED.NAME: Murphy Bed

PROPLIGHT.DESC: An elegant ceiling lamp, slightly worse for wear.
PROPLIGHT.NAME: Light Fixture

PROPRECEPTIONDESK.DESC: A full coffee cup and a note abandoned mid sentence sit behind the desk.\n\nIt gives me an eerie feeling, as if the receptionist has stepped out and will return any moment.
PROPRECEPTIONDESK.NAME: Reception Desk

PROPSKELETON.DESC: A detailed anatomical model.\n\nIt appears to be made of resin.
PROPSKELETON.NAME: Model Skeleton

PROPSURFACESATELLITE1.DESC: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.
PROPSURFACESATELLITE1.NAME: Crashed Satellite

PROPSURFACESATELLITE2.DESC: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.
PROPSURFACESATELLITE2.NAME: Wrecked Satellite

PROPSURFACESATELLITE3.DESC: All that remains of a once peacefully orbiting satellite.
PROPSURFACESATELLITE3.NAME: Crushed Satellite

PROPTALLPLANT.DESC: Looking closely, it appears to be fake.
PROPTALLPLANT.NAME: Potted Plant

RADIATIONLIGHT.DESC: Duplicants can become sick if exposed to radiation without protection.
RADIATIONLIGHT.EFFECT: Emits <link=\"RADIATION\">Radiation</link> when <link=\"POWER\">Powered</link> that can be collected by a <link=\"HIGHENERGYPARTICLESPAWNER\">Radbolt Generator</link>.
RADIATIONLIGHT.NAME: <link=\"RADIATIONLIGHT\">Radiation Lamp</link>

RAILGUN.DESC: It's tempting to climb inside but trust me... don't.
RAILGUN.EFFECT:
Launches <link="RAILGUNPAYLOAD">Interplanetary Payloads</link> between Planetoids.

Payloads can contain <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>, or <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> materials.

Cannot transport Duplicants.
RAILGUN.NAME: <link=\"RAILGUN\">Interplanetary Launcher</link>

RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER.DESC: Payload openers can be hooked up to conveyors, plumbing and ventilation for improved sorting.
RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER.EFFECT: Unpacks <link=\"RAILGUNPAYLOAD\">Interplanetary Payloads</link> delivered by Duplicants.\n\nAutomatically separates <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">Solid</link>, <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link>, and <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gas</link> materials and distributes them to the appropriate systems.
RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER.NAME: <link=\"RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER\">Payload Opener</link>

RANCHSTATION.DESC: A groomed critter is a happy, healthy, productive critter.
RANCHSTATION.EFFECT: Allows the assigned <link=\"RANCHER\">Rancher</link> to care for <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link>.\n\nAssigned Duplicants must possess the <link=\"RANCHING1\">Critter Ranching</link> skill.
RANCHSTATION.NAME: <link=\"RANCHSTATION\">Grooming Station</link>

RATIONBOX.DESC: Ration boxes keep food safe from hungry critters, but don't slow food spoilage.
RATIONBOX.EFFECT: Stores a small amount of <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nFood must be delivered to boxes by Duplicants.
RATIONBOX.NAME: <link=\"RATIONBOX\">Ration Box</link>

REFRIGERATOR.DESC: Food spoilage can be slowed by ambient conditions as well as by refrigerators.
REFRIGERATOR.EFFECT: Stores <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> at an ideal <link=\"HEAT\">Temperature</link> to prevent spoilage.

BLUE_BABYTEARS.DESC: For food so cold, it brings a tear to the eye.
BLUE_BABYTEARS.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Weepy Blue Refrigerator</link>

DEFAULT_REFRIGERATOR.DESC: Food spoilage can be slowed by ambient conditions as well as by refrigerators.
DEFAULT_REFRIGERATOR.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Refrigerator</link>

GREEN_MUSH.DESC: Honestly, this hue is particularly chilling.
GREEN_MUSH.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Mush Green Refrigerator</link>

PURPLE_BRAINFAT.DESC: This fridge makes color-coordination a (cold) snap.
PURPLE_BRAINFAT.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Faint Purple Refrigerator</link>

RED_ROSE.DESC: Inspired by the Duplicant poem, \"Pretty in Puce.\"
RED_ROSE.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Puce Pink Refrigerator</link>

STRIPES_RED_WHITE.DESC: Bold on the outside, cold on the inside!
STRIPES_RED_WHITE.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Bold Stripe Refrigerator</link>

YELLOW_TARTAR.DESC: Some Duplicants call it \"sunny\" yellow, but only because they've never seen the sun.
YELLOW_TARTAR.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Ick Yellow Refrigerator</link>

REFRIGERATOR.NAME: <link=\"REFRIGERATOR\">Refrigerator</link>

REMOTEWORKERDOCK.EFFECT: <link=\"REMOTEWORKERDOCK\">Remote Worker Docks</link> deploy automatons that operate machinery based on instructions received from a connected <link=\"REMOTEWORKTERMINAL\">Remote Controller</link>.\n\nMust be placed within range of its target building.
REMOTEWORKERDOCK.NAME: <link=\"REMOTEWORKERDOCK\">Remote Worker Dock</link>

REMOTEWORKTERMINAL.DESC: Remote controllers cut down on colony commute times.
REMOTEWORKTERMINAL.EFFECT: Enables Duplicants to operate machinery remotely via a connected <link=\"REMOTEWORKERDOCK\">Remote Worker Dock</link>.
REMOTEWORKTERMINAL.NAME: <link=\"REMOTEWORKTERMINAL\">Remote Controller</link>

RESEARCHCENTER.DESC: Research stations are necessary for unlocking all research tiers.
RESEARCHCENTER.EFFECT: Conducts <link=\"RESEARCH\">Novice Research</link> to unlock new technologies.\n\nConsumes <link=\"DIRT\">Dirt</link>.
RESEARCHCENTER.NAME: <link=\"RESEARCHCENTER\">Research Station</link>

RESEARCHCLUSTERMODULE.DESC: Unlocks the possibility of Gathering Databanks floating in space
RESEARCHCLUSTERMODULE.EFFECT: The Research module allows the rocket to gather Data banks that happen to be on the same hex cell than the rocket when it travels through the galaxy
RESEARCHCLUSTERMODULE.NAME: <link=\"RESEARCHMODULE\">Research Module</link>

RESEARCHMODULE.DESC: Data banks can be used at virtual planetariums to produce additional research.
RESEARCHMODULE.EFFECT:
Completes one <link="RESEARCH">Research Task</link> per space mission.

Produces a small Data Bank regardless of mission destination.

Generated <link="RESEARCH">Research Points</link> become available upon the rocket's return.
RESEARCHMODULE.NAME: <link=\"RESEARCHMODULE\">Research Module</link>

RESETSKILLSSTATION.DESC: Erase skills from a Duplicant's mind, returning them to their default abilities.
RESETSKILLSSTATION.EFFECT: Refunds a Duplicant's Skill Points for reassignment.\n\nDuplicants will lose all assigned skills in the process.
RESETSKILLSSTATION.NAME: <link=\"RESETSKILLSSTATION\">Skill Scrubber</link>

REUSABLETRAP.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Sends a Green Signal when a critter has been trapped

ROBOPILOTCOMMANDMODULE.DESC: Robo-pilot modules do not require a Duplicant astronaut.
ROBOPILOTCOMMANDMODULE.EFFECT: Enables rockets to travel swiftly and safely without a <link=\"COMMANDMODULE\">Command Capsule</link>.\n\nA Robo-Pilot Capsule must be the last module installed at the top of a rocket.
ROBOPILOTCOMMANDMODULE.NAME: <link=\"ROBOPILOTCOMMANDMODULE\">Robo-Pilot Capsule</link>

ROBOPILOTMODULE.DESC: Robo-pilot modules do not require a Duplicant astronaut.
ROBOPILOTMODULE.EFFECT: Enables rockets to travel swfitly without a <link=\"ROCKETCONTROLSTATION\">Rocket Control Station</link>.\n\nMust be built via <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>.
ROBOPILOTMODULE.NAME: <link=\"ROBOPILOTMODULE\">Robo-Pilot Module</link>

ROCKCRUSHER.DESC: Rock Crushers loosen nuggets from raw ore and can process many different resources.
ROCKCRUSHER.EFFECT: Inefficiently produces refined materials from raw resources.\n\nDuplicants will not fabricate items unless recipes are queued.

BALLOON.DESC: Wherever there's raw ore, there's a rock crusher lurking nearby.
BALLOON.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Pop-A-Rocks-E</link>

CHOMP.DESC: Buffs rough ore into smooth little nuggets.
CHOMP.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Mani Rock Crusher</link>

DEFAULT_ROCKCRUSHER.DESC: Rock Crushers loosen nuggets from raw ore and can process many different resources.
DEFAULT_ROCKCRUSHER.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Rock Crusher</link>

GEARS.DESC: Uncrushed ore really grinds its gears.
GEARS.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Super-Mech Rock Crusher</link>

ROUNDSTAMP.DESC: Inspired by the traditional mortar and pestle.
ROUNDSTAMP.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Smooth Rock Crusher</link>

TEETH.DESC: Not designed to handle overcooked food waste.
TEETH.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Toothy Rock Crusher</link>

ROCKCRUSHER.LIME_FROM_LIMESTONE_RECIPE_DESCRIPTION: Crushes {0} into {1} and a small amount of pure {2}
ROCKCRUSHER.NAME: <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Rock Crusher</link>
ROCKCRUSHER.RESIN_FROM_AMBER_RECIPE_DESCRIPTION: Crushes {0} into {1} and {2}, and a small amount of {3}

ROCKETCOMMANDCONSOLE.EFFECT: Allows a Duplicant to pilot a rocket.\n\nCargo rockets must possess a Rocket Cockpit in order to function.
ROCKETCOMMANDCONSOLE.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETCOMMANDCONSOLE\">Rocket Cockpit</link>

ROCKETCONTROLSTATION.DESC: Someone needs to be around to jiggle the controls when the screensaver comes on.
ROCKETCONTROLSTATION.EFFECT: Allows Duplicants to use pilot-operated rockets and control access to interior buildings.\n\nAssigned Duplicants must have the <link=\"ROCKETPILOTING1\">Rocket Piloting</link> skill.
ROCKETCONTROLSTATION.LOGIC_PORT_ACTIVE: Green Signal: Restrict access to interior buildings
ROCKETCONTROLSTATION.LOGIC_PORT_INACTIVE: Red Signal: Unrestrict access to interior buildings
ROCKETCONTROLSTATION.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETCONTROLSTATION\">Rocket Control Station</link>

ROCKETENVELOPEWINDOWTILE.DESC: I can see my asteroid from here!
ROCKETENVELOPEWINDOWTILE.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETENVELOPEWINDOWTILE\">Rocket Window</link>

ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> to be pumped into rocket storage via <link="GASCONDUIT">Pipes</link>.

Sends gas to the first Rocket Module with available space.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUT\">Gas Intake Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUTPORT.DESC: A direct attachment leading to the output port on the exterior of the rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUTPORT.EFFECT: Allows a direct conduit connection out of the <link=\"HABITATMODULEMEDIUM\">Spacefarer Module</link> of the rocket.\nCan be used to vent <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gasses</link> to space during flight.
ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUTPORT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORGASINPUTPORT\">Gas Spacefarer Input Port</link>

ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gases</link> to be drawn from rocket storage via <link="GASCONDUIT">Pipes</link>.

Draws gas from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUT\">Gas Output Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUTPORT.DESC: A direct attachment to the input port on the exterior of a rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUTPORT.EFFECT: Allows a direct conduit connection into the <link=\"HABITATMODULEMEDIUM\">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUTPORT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORGASOUTPUTPORT\">Gas Spacefarer Output Port</link>

ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to be pumped into rocket storage via <link="LIQUIDCONDUIT">Pipes</link>.

Sends liquid to the first Rocket Module with available space.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUT\">Liquid Intake Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUTPORT.DESC: A direct attachment to the output port on the exterior of a rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUTPORT.EFFECT: Allows a direct conduit connection out of the <link=\"HABITATMODULEMEDIUM\">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.\nCan be used to vent <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link> to space during flight.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUTPORT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDINPUTPORT\">Liquid Spacefarer Input Port</link>

ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUT.DESC: Now if only we had some water balloons...
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquids</link> to be drawn from rocket storage via <link="LIQUIDCONDUIT">Pipes</link>.

Draws liquid from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUT\">Liquid Output Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUTPORT.DESC: A direct attachment to the input port on the exterior of a rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUTPORT.EFFECT: Allows a direct conduit connection into the <link=\"HABITATMODULEMEDIUM\">Spacefarer Module</link> of a rocket.
ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUTPORT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORLIQUIDOUTPUTPORT\">Liquid Spacefarer Output Port</link>

ROCKETINTERIORPOWERPLUG.DESC: Outlets conveniently power buildings inside a cockpit using their rocket's power stores.
ROCKETINTERIORPOWERPLUG.EFFECT:
Provides <link="POWER">Power</link> to connected buildings.

Pulls power from <link="BATTERYMODULE">Battery Modules</link> and Rocket Engines.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORPOWERPLUG.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORPOWERPLUG\">Power Outlet Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDINPUT.DESC: Why organize your shelves when you can just shove everything in here?
ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDINPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> to be moved into rocket storage via <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rails</link>.

Sends solid material to the first Rocket Module with available space.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDINPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDINPUT\">Conveyor Receptacle Fitting</link>

ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDOUTPUT.DESC: For accessing your stored luggage mid-flight.
ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDOUTPUT.EFFECT:
Allows <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid Materials</link> to be moved out of rocket storage via <link="SOLIDCONDUIT">Conveyor Rails</link>.

Draws solid material from the first Rocket Module with the requested material.

Must be built within the interior of a Rocket Module.
ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDOUTPUT.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETINTERIORSOLIDOUTPUT\">Conveyor Loader Fitting</link>

ROCKETPOD.DESC: The Duplicant inside is equal parts nervous and excited.
ROCKETPOD.EFFECT: Contains a Duplicant deployed from orbit by a <link=\"PIONEERMODULE\">Trailblazer Module</link>.\n\nPod will disintegrate on arrival.
ROCKETPOD.NAME: <link=\"ROCKETPOD\">Trailblazer Deploy Pod</link>

ROLESTATION.DESC: A skills board can teach special skills to Duplicants they can't learn on their own.
ROLESTATION.EFFECT: Allows Duplicants to spend Skill Points to learn new <link=\"JOBS\">Skills</link>.
ROLESTATION.NAME: <link=\"ROLESTATION\">Skills Board</link>

RUSTDEOXIDIZER.DESC: Rust and salt goes in, oxygen comes out.
RUSTDEOXIDIZER.EFFECT: Converts <link=\"RUST\">Rust</link> into <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> and <link=\"CHLORINE\">Chlorine Gas</link>.\n\nBecomes idle when the area reaches maximum pressure capacity.
RUSTDEOXIDIZER.NAME: <link=\"RUSTDEOXIDIZER\">Rust Deoxidizer</link>

SAUNA.DESC: A steamy sauna soothes away all the aches and pains.
SAUNA.EFFECT: Uses <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link> to create a relaxing atmosphere.\n\nIncreases Duplicant <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> and provides a lingering sense of warmth.
SAUNA.NAME: <link=\"SAUNA\">Sauna</link>

SCANNERMODULE.DESC: Allows Duplicants to boldly go where other Duplicants haven't been yet.
SCANNERMODULE.EFFECT: Automatically analyzes adjacent space while on a voyage. \n\nMust be built via <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link>.
SCANNERMODULE.NAME: <link=\"SCANNERMODULE\">Cartographic Module</link>
