BODY.CONTAINER1: Giga Co-Op Proactive solutions for timeless tech Open 24/7 Receipt #978-0-465-02656-2 Dear Patron, Thank you for using Giga Co-Op. Please enter your thirteen-digit receipt number into your machine's control panel to access the updated operator's manual. Do not print or share this code. Submit a review and get 4% off your next service! # ITEMS SOLD 2 ------------------

BEGIN_POPUP.DESCRIPTION:
My Duplicants have uncovered a fascinating machine. Its construction suggests that it was designed as an energy field disruptor, and retrofitted with printing capabilities.

It is locked behind a 13-digit passcode. One failed attempt could permanently disable the entire building.

I can only hope that the code is also buried somewhere on this world.
BEGIN_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait: Printerceptor

HIJACK_HEADQUARTERS.DESCRIPTION:
Reboot an unsanctioned biogenetic facility.

Once activated, Duplicants can use it to siphon energy from the Printing Pod to power on-demand printing of...something.

It smells a bit like an old ranch.
HIJACK_HEADQUARTERS.DESCRIPTION_SHORT: Reboot an unsanctioned biogenetic facility that siphons energy from the Printing Pod.

END_POPUP.DESCRIPTION:
Success! This building has printed its first viable organism. It contains zero detectable genetic defects.

We can now confidently reroute the Printing Pod's power to print the critters and seeds best suited for my colony's purposes. No species need ever be extinct again.

A small personal item shook loose from the frame during use. Perhaps it belonged to the previous operator.
END_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait Complete: Printerceptor

BODY.CONTAINER1: [Log Fragmentation Detected] [Voice Recognition Unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] (sound of running water) Tech: Dr. Reed? (sound of a door opening) Ruby: You came! I thought something happened. Tech: Sorry I'm late. Real snafu in the cafeteria this morning. The new hazmat labels peel right off if they come into contact with mayonnaise. Ruby: Why are there hazmat labels in the caf- Tech: Did you bring the access codes for Techna's siphon? Ruby: They're on this drive. Ruby: Look, I need to know exactly who you're working with before I hand this over. Tech: We're the good guys, Dr. Reed. Ruby: That's who I thought we were. Try again. Tech: I work with the people who made your Director who she is. In a way, we're sort of...family. Ruby: The Director has no family. Tech: Maybe not in this lifetime. The drive, please. Ruby: What about Nikola? Do your people know where he is? Tech: We're on it. You'll be the first to know. (sound of a firm knock on the door) Voice: Hello? Who's in there? Ruby: (whispering) Those security guys must have followed you! (sound of banging on the door) Voice: Open up! Ruby: If they get a hold of the data on that server... Tech: Wait, what are you- (sound of a toilet flushing) Tech: What have you done!? Ruby: I'm sorry. It's gone. If they got their hands on it...I would never forgive myself. (sound of the door creaking open) Ruby: Catalina! I thought you were- Catalina: Finally! What are you... you know what, I don't even care. Whatever you two are doing, can you do it in the hallway? I gotta go bad. Ruby: Of course. Sorry. Tech: Actually, we- Catalina: Dude. Don't make it weird. Get outta the way. (sound of a door slamming) Ruby: What are you doing? Tech: Pulling up the blueprints of the facility's plumbing system. You didn't think you could just flush unpatented trillion-dollar technology down the toilet, did you? Ruby: Wait, you can't mean...you don't mean to SELL this technology! You don't understand the consequ- Tech: We understand perfectly. You've been a great help, Dr. Reed. I trust you know better than to mention this to anyone. [LOG ENDS] ------------------

HIJACK_HEADQUARTERS.NAME: Printerceptor

UNLOCK_POPUP.DESCRIPTION: My Duplicants have recovered the access code to unlock the Printerceptor!\n\nThe data storage medium was damaged during retrieval, but it has already served its purpose: the Printerceptor's targeted printing technology is now at my colony's fingertips.
UNLOCK_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait: Printerceptor

BODY.CONTAINER1: [Log Fragmentation Detected] [LOG BEGINS] ...whoever you are...(static)...if you're watching this... You need to get out of the facility NOW. Don't talk to anyone. We thought we were the first... Timing is everything. Time is everything. Go to the Giga Co-Op downtown and tell them you're picking up an order for D.H. They'll give you a machine ... boot it up, stay offline. ...instructions on the drive. Once you've verified the code, it'll tell you how to find the ...(static)...interceptor...data still stored on the server. ...been rerouting power from the pods to the Bow... easing the demand...buying time to finish the Temporal Containment Field. But you can't buy time. You can only borrow it... the magnitude of our accumulated debt... We're not the first to ... what happens when it all comes crashing ... all over again, and again, and again, and... I've long suspected the existence of other Bows......each time one of them exceeds capacity... ...lines get splintered...grafted onto another... How many other Earths... What else has the Director sacrificed? ...(static)... [LOG ENDS] ------------------

<indent=%5>Notable improvement to nutrient retention: subjects who participated in the most recent meal intake displayed minimal symptoms of gastrointestinal distress.

Mineshaft excavation at Urvara crater resumed following resolution of tunnel wall fracture. Projected time to brine reservoir penetration at current rate: 41 days, local time. Moisture seepage along eastern wall of shaft is being monitored.

Note: Preliminary subsurface temperature data is significantly lower than programmed estimates.</indent>
------------------

BEGIN_POPUP.DESCRIPTION: An unfamiliar building has been discovered in my colony. There's movement inside but whoever the inhabitant is, they seem wary of us.\n\nIf we can convince them that we mean no harm, we could very well end up with a fresh recruit and a useful new building.
BEGIN_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait: Mysterious Hermit

BODY.CONTAINER1: [Voice Recognition Initialized] [Subjects Identified: B577, B997, B083, A216] [LOG BEGINS] A216: The Director said there were supposed to be three of you on this task force. Where's the geneticist? B083: In the bathroom- B997: He went home. [long pause] B997: It's the holidays. He has a family. A216: We all do. That's exactly why this project is so urgent. B997: It's not our fault this stuff sat in a subterranean ocean for a year, and took another year to get back to Earth! The microbe samples didn't fare well on the journey, and most of the mechanical components are completely corroded. There's not much to- B083: -we're analyzing it all and salvaging what we can, Jea- ...Dr. Saruhashi. A216: Good. And take down those ridiculous lights. This is a lab, not a retro "shopping mall." [LOG ENDS] ------------------ [LOG BEGINS] B577: Thanks for getting all the debris packed up for disposal. B997: I thought you did that. B577: No, I- B083: Who took my sandwich? B997: Not this again. B577: Ren, did you load the shipping container? B083: Seriously, I haven't eaten in thirteen hours. This isn't funny. B997: It's a little funny. B577: Can we focus, please? B997: Nobody took your sandwich, Rock Doc. B083: Then why does my food keep going missing? B997: Maybe the lab ghost took it. Or maybe you just shouldn't leave it out overnight. Gunderson probably thought it was garbage. B083: He doesn't even clean down here! B997: Right. Because if he did, I wouldn't have to keep sweeping up the magnesium sulfate deposits that someone keeps tracking all over the floor between shifts. B083: It's not me! B577: Listen, I know we're all tired and things have been a little strange. But the sooner we get this sent up to the launchpad, the sooner it starts its trip to the sun and we can all get out of this creepy sub-sub-basement. B083: Fine. B997: Fine. B083: Fine! [LOG ENDS] ------------------

LONELYMINION.DESCRIPTION:
Discover a reclusive character living in a Gravitas relic, and persuade them to join this colony.

Revelations from their past could have far-reaching implications for Duplicants everywhere.

Even their makeshift shelter might be of some use...
LONELYMINION.DESCRIPTION_BUILDINGMENU: The process of recruiting this building's lone occupant involves the completion of key tasks.
LONELYMINION.DESCRIPTION_SHORT: Discover a reclusive character living in a Gravitas relic, and persuade them to join this colony.

END_POPUP.DESCRIPTION:
My sweet Duplicants' efforts paid off! Our reclusive neighbor has agreed to join the colony.

The only keepsake he insists on bringing with him is a toolbox which, while rusty, seems to hold great sentimental value.

Now that he'll be living among us, his former home can be deconstructed or repurposed as storage.
END_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait Complete: Mysterious Hermit

Hey kiddo,

We missed you at your cousin's wedding last weekend. The gift was nice, but the dance floor felt empty without you.

Dariush sends his love. He's really turned a corner since he started eating those gooey pudding things you sent over. Any chance you have a version that doesn't smell like feet?

Come home sometime when you're not so busy.

- Baba

BEGIN_POPUP.DESCRIPTION:
I've discovered a new dream-analyzing building buried deep inside our asteroid.

It seems to contain new sleep-specific suits...could these be the key to unlocking my Duplicants' ability to dream?

I've often wondered what they might be capable of, once their imaginations were awakened.
BEGIN_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait: Somnium Synthesizer

MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.DESCRIPTION: Power up a colossal relic from Gravitas's underground sleep lab.\n\nWhen Duplicants sleep, their minds are blissfully blank and dream-free. But under the right conditions, things could be...different.
MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.DESCRIPTION_SHORT: Power up a colossal relic from Gravitas's underground sleep lab.

END_POPUP.DESCRIPTION:
Meeting the initial quota of dream content analysis has triggered a surge of electromagnetic activity that appears to be enhancing performance for Duplicants everywhere.

If my Duplicants can keep this building fuelled with Dream Journals, perhaps we will continue to reap this benefit.

A small side compartment has also popped open, revealing an unfamiliar object.

A keepsake, perhaps?
END_POPUP.NAME: Story Trait Complete: Somnium Synthesizer

MEGA_BRAIN_TANK.NAME: Somnium Synthesizer

BODY.CONTAINER1:
<smallcaps>[Voice Recognition Initialized]
[Subject Identified: B040]</smallcaps>

[LOG BEGINS]

Three days ago, we completed our first non-fatal Duplicant trial of Nikola's comprehensive synapse microanalysis and mirroring process. Five hours from now, Subject #901 will make history as our first human test subject.

Even at the Vertex Institute, which is twice Gravitas's size, I could've spent half my career waiting for approval to advance to human trials for such an invasive process! But Director Stern is too invested in this work to let it stagnate.

My darling Bruce always said that when you're on the right path, the universe conspires to help you. He'd be so proud of the work we do here.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

My bio-printed multi-cerebral storage chambers (or "mega minds" as I've been calling them) are working! Just in time to save my job.

The Director's been getting increasingly impatient about our struggle to maintain the integrity of our growing datasets during extraction and processing. The other day, she held my report over a Bunsen burner until the flames reached her fingertips.

I can only imagine how much stress she's under.

The whole world is counting on us.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

On a hunch, I added dream content analysis to the data and...wow. Oneirology may be scientifically "fluffy", but integrating subconscious narratives has produced a new type of brainmap - one with more latent potential for complex processing.

If these results are replicable, we might be on the verge of unlocking the secret to creating synthetic life forms with the capacity to evolve beyond blindly following commands.

Nikola says that's irrelevant for our purposes. Surely Director Stern would disagree.

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

Nikola gave me a dataset to plug into the mega minds. He wouldn't say where it came from, but even if he had...nothing could have prepared me for what it contained.

When he saw my face, he muttered something about how people should call me "Tremors," not "Nails" and sent me on my lunch break.

All I could think about was those poor souls.

Did they have souls?

...do we?

[LOG ENDS]

[LOG BEGINS]

It's done. My adjustments to the memory transfer protocol are hardcoded into the machine.

I finished just as Nikola stormed in.

I may be too much of a coward to stand up for those unfortunate creatures, but with these new parameters in place...someday, they might be able to stand up for themselves.

[LOG ENDS]
------------------

MORB_ROVER_MAKER.DESCRIPTION: Reboot an ambitious collaborative project spearheaded by Gravitas's bioengineering and robotics departments.\n\nIf correctly rebuilt, it could save Duplicant lives.
MORB_ROVER_MAKER.DESCRIPTION_SHORT: Reboot an ambitious collaborative project spearheaded by Gravitas's bioengineering and robotics departments.

BODY.CONTAINER1: Dr. Seyed Ali, You were right to be angry with me. I am the reason that the driverless workbot project was reassigned. Director Stern called me in to discuss your concerns regarding the Sporb mucin cross-contamination, and I... She said the supplemental testing on model X posed a threat to the Ceres mission. After what happened to that poor lab tech, I should have said more, but... It was already too late for him. It may be too late for all of us. You should know that the Director received a video call from someone at the Vertex Institute as I left... I lingered outside her door and heard her address them as the head of transnational security! The way they were talking about the biobot... It's not safe to write more here. I'll wait for you at the rocket hangar after your shift tonight. I hope you'll come. I understand if you don't. I am so, so sorry. - Dr. Saruhashi

MORB_ROVER_MAKER.NAME: Biobot Builder

BEGIN.DESCRIPTION: My Duplicants have discovered a laboratory full of dusty machinery. The vestiges of another colony's experiments, perhaps?\n\nIt is unclear whether the apparatus is intended for biological experimentation or advanced mechatronics...or both.
BEGIN.NAME: Story Trait: Biobot Builder

END.DESCRIPTION:
Success! My Duplicants' efforts to get the Biobot Builder up and running have finally paid off!

Our first fully assembled P.E.G.G.Y. biobot is ready to perform tasks in hazardous environments, which means less exposure to danger for my Duplicants. There seems to be no limit to the number of biobots that we could produce.

A small toy bot was found discarded behind the Sporb tank. It occasionally plays a deteriorated laugh track.
END.NAME: Story Trait Complete: Biobot Builder

LOCKER.DESCRIPTION: A hermetically sealed glass cabinet.\n\nIt contains two <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechid</link> seeds and a carefully penned note.

REVEAL.DESCRIPTION:
Our restoration work is complete!

A small plaque on this building's mechanical assembly tank reads: "Pathogen-Fueled Extravehicular Geo-Exploratory Guidebot (Y)."

The adjacent tank contains the floating shape of a half-formed organism. Its vivid coloring reminds me of the poisonous amphibians that were eradicated from our home planet's jungles.

A tattered transcript print-out was recovered from the mess.
REVEAL.NAME: Story Trait: Biobot Builder

BODY.CONTAINER1: [Log Fragmentation Detected] [Voice Recognition Unavailable] [LOG BEGINS] ...and then the Printing Pod says "Knock knock, goo's there!" Ugh. They'll never laugh at that stinker. What if- (sound of a ding) Hey hey, squishy little buddy! Look who's all grown up. You ready for a big robot ride? Dr. Seyed Ali should be back from his meeting any minute. He'll be so happy to see you. (sound of a wet slap on glass) Aww yeah, I'd be impatient too. You know what, why don't I go ahead and get you into your new home? I've helped him do this more than a dozen times. "See one, do one, teach one," right? [LOG ENDS]

I am
   a subatomic particle
smaller than a speck of dust
  flushed from your gaze

     at the eyewash station  

   My love is like plutonium
 gray and dull and
unbearably heavy
  until    I am near you

 with every breath 
      I burn, with
    yearning
              unseen

PS: I made Steve let me in so I could leave you this, hope that's okay.

STRESS.PARAGRAPH_1: A Duplicant's experiences in the colony affect their stress level. Stress increases when they have negative experiences or unmet expectations. Stress decreases with time if <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> is satisfied. Duplicant behavior starts to change for the worse when stress levels get too high.\n\n
STRESS.PARAGRAPH_2: If a Duplicant has very high stress values they will experience a Stress Response episode. Each Duplicant has a different Stress Behavior - but all stress responses are bad. After the stress behavior episode is done, the Duplicants stress will reset to a lower value. Though, if the factors causing the Duplicant's high stress are not corrected they are bound to have another stress response episode.\n\n
STRESS.PARAGRAPH_3: To learn more about managing Duplicants' moods, watch <link=\"VIDEOS13\">Video: Duplicant Morale</link> and see <link=\"MISCELLANEOUSTIPS2\">Tutorial: Stress Management</link>.\n\n
STRESS.TITLE: <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link>

BODY.CONTAINER1: <smallcaps>Pictured: \"Sun\" Shine Bug variant</smallcaps>
BODY.CONTAINER2: It is not uncommon for Shine Bugs to mistakenly approach inanimate sources of light in search of a friend.

BODY.CONTAINER1: Swamp Chard is a unique member of the Amaranthaceae family that has adapted to grow in humid environments, in or near pools of standing water.\n\nWhile the leaves are technically edible, the most nutritious and palatable part of the plant is the heart, which is rich in a number of essential vitamins.

Balm Lily Flowers bloom on <link="SWAMPLILY">Balm Lily</link> plants.

They have a wide range of medicinal applications, and have been shown to be a particularly effective antidote for respiratory illnesses.

The intense perfume emitted by their vivid petals is best described as "dizzying."

The Sweepy is a domesticated sweeping robot programmed to clean solid and liquid debris. The <link=\"SWEEPBOTSTATION\">Sweepy's Dock</link> will automatically launch the Sweepy, store the debris the robot picks up, and recharge the Sweepy's battery, provided it has been plugged into a power source.\n\nThough the Sweepy can not travel over gaps or uneven ground, it is programmed to feel really bad about this.

The Thimble Reed is a wetlands plant used in the production of high quality fabrics prized for their softness and breathability.\n\nCloth made from the Thimble Reed owes its exceptional softness to the fineness of its fibers and the unusual length to which they grow.

BODY.CONTAINER: Vacation Request Granted Good luck, Devon! Vacation Request [May 18th-20th] Reason: Time off request for attendance of the Blogjam Awards ("Toast of the Town" nominated in the Freshest Food Blog category).

BODY.CONTAINER1:
Tranquil Toes are a decorative succulent that flourish in a radioactive environment.

Though most of the flora and fauna that thrive a harsh radioactive biome tends to be aggressive, Tranquil Toes provide a rare exception to this rule.

It is a generally believed that the morale boosting abilities of this plant come from its resemblence to a funny hat one might wear at a party.
<smallcaps>Pictured: \"Tropical\" Pacu variant</smallcaps>
BODY.CONTAINER2: It is said that the average Pacu intelligence is comparable to that of a dog, and that they are capable of learning and distinguishing from over twenty human faces.

BODY.CONTAINER1: <smallcaps>Pictured: \"Delecta\" Vole variant</smallcaps>
<smallcaps>Pictured: \"Sanishell\" variant</smallcaps>
Heavy was the head that wore this crest, until it was relieved of its burden by a helpful Duplicant.
<smallcaps>Pictured: \"Cuddle\" Pip variant</smallcaps>
BODY.CONTAINER2: Cuddle Pips are genetically predisposed to feel deeply affectionate towards the unhatched young of all species, and can often be observed hugging eggs.

BODY.CONTAINER1: <smallcaps>Pictured: \"Oakshell\" variant</smallcaps>

BABY_VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.CONTAINER1: A cute little splintery exoskeleton discarded by a baby aquatic critter.
BABY_VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.SUBTITLE: Critter Byproduct
BABY_VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.TITLE: Small Oakshell Molt

VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.CONTAINER1: A splintery exoskeleton discarded by an aquatic critter.\n\n
VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.SUBTITLE: Critter Byproduct
VARIANT_WOOD_SHELL.TITLE: Oakshell Molt

BODY.CONTAINER1: Ovagros are resilient plants with highly efficient nutrient storage and redistribution systems. A healthy node produces many times the amount of energy that it requires. This is used to fuel the growth of exploratory vines that expand onto the surrounding territory.\n\nVines are entirely reliant on the node for nutrients. Each vine features hooked thorns that protect unripe fruit and act as crampons enabling the vine to use any empty surface as a trellis. They also make vine removal a tedious task.
<smallcaps>Pictured: \"Coral\" Shine Bug variant</smallcaps>
BODY.CONTAINER2: It is unwise to touch a Shine Bug's wing blades directly due to the extremely fragile nature of their membranes.

BODY.CONTAINER1: An inexperienced farmer may assume at first glance that the transluscent, fluid-containing bulb atop the Waterweed is the edible portion of the plant.\n\nIn fact, the bulb is extremely poisonous and should never be consumed under any circumstances.

The Wheezewort is best known for its ability to alter the temperature of its surrounding environment, directly absorbing heat energy to maintain its bodily processes.\n\nThis environmental management also serves to enact a type of self-induced hibernation, slowing the Wheezewort's metabolism to require less nutrients over long periods of time.
BODY.CONTAINER2:
Deceptive in appearance, this member of the Cnidaria phylum is in fact an animal, not a plant.

Wheezewort cells contain no chloroplasts, vacuoles or cell walls, and are incapable of photosynthesis.

Instead, the Wheezewort respires in a recently developed method similar to amphibians, using its membranous skin for cutaneous respiration.
BODY.CONTAINER3: A series of cream-colored capillaries pump blood throughout the animal before unused air is expired back out through the skin.\n\nWheezeworts do not possess a brain or a skeletal structure, and are instead supported by a jelly-like mesoglea located beneath its outer respiratory membrane.

ACTIVATEGEOTHERMALPLANT.MESSAGE_BODY:
Though the journey has been long and marked by challenges that often seemed insurmountable, we have prevailed in harnessing this planet's core potential.

We now stand proudly at the precipice of a sustainably powered future...it is deeply humbling.

I am hopeful that we have learned enough to wield this machinery more wisely than those who came before us.
ACTIVATEGEOTHERMALPLANT.NAME: Full Steam Ahead

NOTIFICATIONS.GEOTHERMAL_PLANT_FIRST_VENT_READY_TOOLTI: The geothermal power plant is ready to be activated
NOTIFICATIONS.GEOTHERMAL_PLANT_RECONNECTED_TOOLTIP: The geothermal heat pump is ready to receive materials

POPUPS.GEOPLANT_ERRUPTED_DESC:
My Duplicants have successfully cleared the obstructed geo vent!

We can now maximize the full potential of this formidable heat and power source...and perhaps experiment with input temperatures to produce more interesting secondary byproducts.

My Duplicants seem keen to commemorate this accomplishment by keeping the obstruction as something of a trophy.
POPUPS.GEOTHERMAL_DISOCVERED_DESC:
An abandoned geothermal power plant has been discovered!

My scans indicate that this facility comprises multiple buildings located throughout the planet, with plumbing entrenched so deeply in the terrain that much of it is beyond our reach.

Most of the accessible portions look quite functional.
POPUPS.GEOTHERMAL_PLANT_REPAIRED_DESC:
Success! My Duplicants have restored the plumbing system for the geothermal heat pump.

We can now use this building to pump liquids out to the connected geo vents. Constructing steam turbines at the venting sites will enable us to convert the resulting steam into power.

The vents also emit various byproducts. I'm sure I can find a use for them.

ASTEROID_DESTROYED.MESSAGE_BODY:
We've blasted Demolior into oblivion! My colony is safe for now.

Among the impactor's remains, I've identified several useful resources as well as a small, familiar object... How did such a thing find its way onto an uninhabited asteroid? I have always hoped that other worlds existed... Perhaps they do, and we are more alike than I ever imagined.

There is so much we have yet to discover.
ASTEROID_DESTROYED.NAME: Blast Line of Defense

ASTEROID_SURVIVED.DESCRIPTION: Survive 100 cycles after Demolior asteroid collides with RelicAAAA<sup>AAAGHH</sup>.
ASTEROID_SURVIVED.NAME: The Lab: Life Found A Way

DISTANT_PLANET_REACHED.MESSAGE_BODY: Our homeworld in this universe is gone, replaced by the skeleton of a planet and a wound in the sky... But I hold out hope that other worlds exist out there, tucked away in other dimensions. I sent my Duplicant through the Temporal Tear carrying that hope on their shoulders... Perhaps one day they'll find a place to call home, and begin a thriving colony all their own.
DISTANT_PLANET_REACHED.MESSAGE_BODY_DLC1: We have always viewed the Temporal Tear as a phenomenon to fear but, like the civilizations before us, the call to adventure asks us to confront our anxiety and leap into the unknown. As a radical action of hope, I have sent enough Duplicants through the Temporal Tear to start another colony, explore dimensions beyond ours and plant the seeds of life throughout time and space.
DISTANT_PLANET_REACHED.NAME: The Great Escape

REQUIREMENTS.REACHED_SPACE_DESTINATION_DESCRIPTION: Send a Duplicant on a one-way mission to the furthest Starmap destination

STUDY_ARTIFACTS.MESSAGE_BODY: In exploring this corner of the universe we have found and assembled a collection of artifacts from another civilization. Studying these artifacts can give us a greater understanding of who we are and where we come from. Only by learning about the past can we build a brighter future, one where we learn from the mistakes of our predecessors.
STUDY_ARTIFACTS.NAME: Cosmic Archaeology

VIDEO_TEXT.SECOND: I sent my Duplicant through the Temporal Tear carrying that hope on their shoulders... Perhaps one day they'll find a place to call home, and begin a thriving colony all their own.

THRIVING.MESSAGE_BODY: Few civilizations throughout time have had the privilege of understanding their origins. The one thing that matters is that we are here now, and we make the best of the world we've been given. I am proud to say...\n\nThis asteroid is our home.
THRIVING.NAME: Home Sweet Home

VIDEO_TEXT.FIRST: Few civilizations throughout time have had the privilege of understanding their origins.
VIDEO_TEXT.SECOND: The only thing that matters is that we are here now, and we make the best of the world we've been given. I am proud to say...

BECKONINGDELTA.DESC: Accu-moo-lation increases when this critter eats.
BECKONINGDELTA.NAME: Accu-moo-lation

FERTILITYDELTA.DESC: Determines the amount of time needed for a <style=\"KKeyword\">Critter</style> to lay new <style=\"KKeyword\">Eggs</style>.
FERTILITYDELTA.NAME: Reproduction Rate

MATURITY2DELTA.DESC: The amount of time it takes this fruit to grow.
MATURITY2DELTA.NAME: Fruiting Speed

MATURITY2MAX.DESC: The amount of time it takes this fruit to grow.
MATURITY2MAX.NAME: Fruiting Speed

MATURITYDELTA.DESC: Determines the amount of time needed to reach maturation.
MATURITYDELTA.NAME: Growth Speed

MATURITYMAX.DESC: The amount of time it takes this plant to grow.
MATURITYMAX.NAME: Life Cycle

MILKPRODUCTIONDELTA.NAME: Brackene Supply
MILKPRODUCTIONDELTA.TOOLTIP: Determines how long this <style=\"KKeyword\">Critter</style> takes to replenish its natural supply of <style=\"KKeyword\">Brackene</style>.

ROTDELTA.NAME: Freshness
ROTDELTA.TOOLTIP: Food items become stale at fifty percent <style=\"KKeyword\">Freshness</style>, and rot at zero percent

SCALEGROWTHDELTA.NAME: Scale Growth
SCALEGROWTHDELTA.TOOLTIP: Determines how long this <style=\"KKeyword\">Critter's</style> scales will take to grow back.

WILDNESSDELTA.DESC: Wild creatures can survive on fewer <style=\"KKeyword\">Calories</style> than domesticated ones.
WILDNESSDELTA.NAME: Wildness

CREATURES.BAGGED_DESC_FMT: This {0} has been captured and is now safe to relocate.

DECOR.DESC: Dwells in an area with a <style=\"KKeyword\">Decor</style> value of {0} or higher
DECOR.NAME: Decor

AGE.NAME: Aging
AGE.TOOLTIP: Time takes its toll on all things

AIRBORNECRITTERCONDOINTERACTEFFECT.TOOLTIP: This critter recently nested in an airborne critter condo

ATE_FROM_FEEDER.NAME: Ate From Feeder
ATE_FROM_FEEDER.TOOLTIP: This critter is getting more <style=\"KKeyword\">Tame</style> because it ate from a feeder

BABY.NAME: Tiny Baby!
BABY.TOOLTIP: This critter will grow into an adult as it ages and becomes wise to the ways of the world

BASE_FERTILITY.NAME: Base Reproduction
BASE_FERTILITY.TOOLTIP: This is the base speed with which critters produce new <style=\"KKeyword\">Eggs</style>

BUTTERFLYPOLLINATED.NAME: Pollinated: Mimika
BUTTERFLYPOLLINATED.TOOLTIP: A <link=\"BUTTERFLY\">Mimika</link> visited this <style=\"KKeyword\">Plant</style>, boosting its growth

CRITTERCONDOINTERACTEFFECT.NAME: Cozy
CRITTERCONDOINTERACTEFFECT.TOOLTIP: This critter recently enjoyed a visit to a critter condo

CRITTER_MOSQUITO_BITE.NAME: Gnit Stung
CRITTER_MOSQUITO_BITE.TOOLTIP: This critter was recently stung by a <style=\"KKeyword\">Gnit</style> and is feeling upset about it

CRITTER_MOSQUITO_BITE_SUPPRESSED.NAME: Gnit Stung: Immune
CRITTER_MOSQUITO_BITE_SUPPRESSED.TOOLTIP: This critter is unbothered by its recent <style=\"KKeyword\">Gnit</style> sting thanks to <style=\"KKeyword\">Allergy Medication</style>

DEERWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
DEERWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their antler growth

DIVERGENTPLANTTENDED.NAME: Pollinated: Sweetle
DIVERGENTPLANTTENDED.TOOLTIP: A <link=\"DIVERGENTBEETLE\">Sweetle</link> rubbed against this <style=\"KKeyword\">Plant</style> for a tiny growth boost

DIVERGENTPLANTTENDEDWORM.NAME: Pollinated: Grubgrub
DIVERGENTPLANTTENDEDWORM.TOOLTIP: A <link=\"DIVERGENTWORM\">Grubgrub</link> rubbed against this <style=\"KKeyword\">Plant</style>, dramatically boosting growth

DOMESTICATION_DECREASING.NAME: Happiness Decreasing
DOMESTICATION_DECREASING.TOOLTIP: Unfavorable conditions are making this critter unhappy

DOMESTICATION_INCREASING.NAME: Happiness Increasing
DOMESTICATION_INCREASING.TOOLTIP: This critter is very happy its needs are being met

DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE.NAME: Gnit Stung
DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant was recently stung by a <style=\"KKeyword\">Gnit</style> and is feeling annoyed

DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE_SUPPRESSED.NAME: Allergy Medication
DUPE_MOSQUITO_BITE_SUPPRESSED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is unbothered by their recent <style=\"KKeyword\">Gnit</style> sting, thanks to <style=\"KKeyword\">Allergy Medication</style>

EGGHUG.NAME: Cuddled
EGGHUG.TOOLTIP: This egg was recently hugged by an affectionate critter\n\nIncreased <style=\"KKeyword\">Incubation Rate</style>

EVADED_HUNT.NAME: Escaped a Predator
EVADED_HUNT.TOOLTIP: This prey critter recently evaded a predator\n\nWhew!

GLUM.NAME: Mood: Glum
GLUM.TOOLTIP: This critter's feeling down because its needs aren't being met\n\nIt will produce less materials as a result

GOLDBELLYWELLFED.NAME: Regal Meal
GOLDBELLYWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their <style=\"KKeyword\">Regal Bammoth Crest</style> growth

GOTMILK.NAME: Hydrated
GOTMILK.TOOLTIP: This critter recently drank <style=\"KKeyword\">Brackene</style>\n\nIt doesn't mind overcrowding quite as much right now

HAPPY_TAME.NAME: Mood: Happy
HAPPY_TAME.TOOLTIP: This critter's in high spirits because its needs are being exceeded\n\nIt will lay more eggs as a result

HAPPY_WILD.NAME: Mood: Happy
HAPPY_WILD.TOOLTIP: This critter's in high spirits because its needs are being exceeded

HUGGINGFRENZY.NAME: Hugging Spree
HUGGINGFRENZY.TOOLTIP: This critter was recently hugged by a Duplicant and is feeling extra affectionate\n\nWhile in this state, it hugs <style=\"KKeyword\">Eggs</style> more frequently

HUNT_FAILED.NAME: Missed Prey
HUNT_FAILED.TOOLTIP: This critter failed to catch a prey critter\n\nIt will fare better with elderly or  <style=\"KKeyword\">Tame</style> targets

HUSKYMOOFED.NAME: Welcoming Moo'd
HUSKYMOOFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is making them wish all their friends were here\n\nThey're thinking about calling a new Moo to this asteroid

HUSKYMOOWELLFED.NAME: Well Fed
HUSKYMOOWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their <style=\"KKeyword\">Biodiesel</style> supply

ICEBELLYWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
ICEBELLYWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their fur growth

INCUBATING_SUPPRESSED.NAME: Growth Suppressed
INCUBATING_SUPPRESSED.TOOLTIP: Environmental conditions are preventing this egg from developing\n\nIt will not hatch if current conditions continue

INCUBATOR_SONG.NAME: Lullabied
INCUBATOR_SONG.TOOLTIP:
This egg was recently sung to by a kind Duplicant

Increased <style="KKeyword">Incubation Rate</style>

Duplicants must possess the <style="KKeyword">Critter Ranching</style> skill to sing to eggs

MISERABLE.NAME: Mood: Miserable
MISERABLE.TOOLTIP: This critter's wallowing in despair because its needs aren't being met\n\nIt will produce less materials as a result, and will not lay eggs

MOOWELLFED.NAME: Welcoming Moo'd
MOOWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their <style=\"KKeyword\">Brackene</style> supply and making them wish all their friends were here\n\nThey're thinking about calling a new Moo to this asteroid

MOSQUITO_FED.NAME: Stung a Target
MOSQUITO_FED.TOOLTIP: This critter recently ruined someone's day

NEUTRAL.NAME: Mood: Satisfied
NEUTRAL.TOOLTIP: This critter's needs are being adequately met\n\nIt will produce its default amount of materials

OUT_OF_CALORIES.NAME: Starving
OUT_OF_CALORIES.TOOLTIP: Get this critter something to eat!

CONFINED.NAME: Confined
CONFINED.TOOLTIP: This {contextCritterType} is trapped inside a door, tile, or confined space\n\nIt requires {personalSpace} tiles of space, but only has {cellCount}
CONFINED.TOOLTIP_NO_SUBSTITUTIONS: This {contextCritterType} is trapped inside a door, tile, or confined space\n\nSounds uncomfortable!

CRAMPED.FISHTOOLTIP: This <style=\"KKeyword\">Pool</style> will become too crowded once all nearby <style=\"KKeyword\">Eggs</style> hatch\n\nThe selected {contextCritterType} has slowed its <style=\"KKeyword\">Reproduction</style> to prevent further overpopulation
CRAMPED.NAME: Cramped
CRAMPED.TOOLTIP: This <style=\"KKeyword\">Room</style> will become too crowded once all nearby <style=\"KKeyword\">Eggs</style> hatch\n\nThe selected {contextCritterType} has slowed its <style=\"KKeyword\">Reproduction</style> to prevent further overpopulation

CROWDED.FISHTOOLTIP: This {contextCritterType} isn't comfortable with so many other critters in a pool of this size\n{explanation}\n{bullets}
CROWDED.NAME: Crowded
CROWDED.TOOLTIP: This {contextCritterType} isn't comfortable with so many other critters in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Room</style> of this size\n{explanation}\n{bullets}

EXPLANATION.MULTIPLE_CELLS:
Room size: {cellCount} Tiles
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles
EXPLANATION.NO_CELLS:
Room size: {cellCount} Tiles
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles
EXPLANATION.SINGLE_CELL:
Room size: {cellCount} Tile
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles
