Pool size: {cellCount} Tiles
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles
EXPLANATION_AQUATIC.NO_CELLS:
Pool size: {cellCount} Tiles
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles
EXPLANATION_AQUATIC.SINGLE_CELL:
Pool size: {cellCount} Tile
Current critter population requirement: {occupiedCellCount} Tiles

RANCHED.NAME: Groomed
RANCHED.TOOLTIP: This critter has recently been attended to by a kind Duplicant\n\nDuplicants must possess the <style=\"KKeyword\">Critter Ranching</style> skill to care for critters

RAPTORWELLFED.NAME: Just Ate
RAPTORWELLFED.TOOLTIP: This critter's recent meal is boosting their feather growth

UNDERWATERCRITTERCONDOINTERACTEFFECT.TOOLTIP: This critter recently enjoyed a visit to a water fort

BLOOMS.DESCRIPTION: Vestigial flowers increase the beauty of this plant. Don't inhale the pollen, though!
BLOOMS.NAME: Blooming

BONUSLICE.DESCRIPTION: Something about this mutation causes Meal Lice to pupate on this plant.
BONUSLICE.NAME: Licey

EXTREMELYTIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Plants with this mutation are very difficult to keep alive, but produce a bounty.
EXTREMELYTIGHT.NAME: Superspecialized

HEAVYFRUIT.DESCRIPTION: Extra water in these plump mutant veggies causes them to fall right off the plant! There's no extra nutritional value, though...
HEAVYFRUIT.NAME: Juicy Fruits

LOADEDWITHFRUIT.DESCRIPTION: This mutation produces lots of extra produce, though it also takes a long time to pick it all!
LOADEDWITHFRUIT.NAME: Bountiful

MODERATELYLOOSE.DESCRIPTION: Plants with this mutation are easier to take care of, but don't yield as much produce.
MODERATELYLOOSE.NAME: Easygoing

MODERATELYTIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Plants with this mutation are pickier about their conditions but yield more produce.
MODERATELYTIGHT.NAME: Specialized

ROTTENHEAPS.DESCRIPTION: Plants with this mutation grow extremely quickly, though the produce they make is sometimes questionable.
ROTTENHEAPS.NAME: Exuberant

SLOWBURN.DESCRIPTION: These plants grow almost as slow as their wild cousins, but also consume almost no fertilizer.
SLOWBURN.NAME: Wildish

SUNNYSPEED.DESCRIPTION: This mutation provides the plant with sun-collecting leaves, allowing faster growth.
SUNNYSPEED.NAME: Leafy

PLANT_MUTATIONS.UNIDENTIFIED_DESC: This seed must be identified at the <link=\"GENETICANALYSISSTATION\">Botanical Analyzer</link> before it can be planted.

BABY.DESC: A slightly moist Blum Lumb baby.\n\nIn time, it will grow into a stompy <link=\"ALGAESTEGO\">Blum Lumb</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"ALGAESTEGO\">Blumblet</link>

ALGAE_STEGO.DESC: Blum Lumbs are non-hostile critters that produce <link=\"ALGAE\">Algae</link>.\n\nWhen they stomp heavily near <link=\"PLANTS\">plants</link>, the commotion causes harvestable items to fall to the ground.
ALGAE_STEGO.NAME: <link=\"ALGAESTEGO\">Blum Lumb</link>

BASICFABRICMATERIALPLANT.DESC: Thimble Reeds produce indescribably soft <link=\"BASICFABRIC\">Reed Fiber</link> for <link=\"EQUIPMENT\">Clothing</link> production.
BASICFABRICMATERIALPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BASICFABRICPLANT\">Thimble Reed</link>

BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.DESC: Muckroots are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> serving.
BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.NAME: <link=\"BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTED\">Buried Muckroot</link>

BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT.DESC: Mealwoods produce <link=\"BASICPLANTFOOD\">Meal Lice</link>, an oddly wriggly grain that can be harvested for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT\">Mealwood</link>

BEAN_PLANT.DESC: Nosh Sprouts thrive in colder climates and produce edible <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link>.
BEAN_PLANT.NAME: <link=\"BEANPLANT\">Nosh Sprout</link>

BABY.DESC: A harmless little Beetiny.\n\nIn time, it will mature into a vicious adult <link=\"BEE\">Beeta</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"BEE\">Beetiny</link>

BEE.DESC: Beetas are hostile critters that thrive in <link=\"RADIATION\">Radioactive</link> environments.\n\nThey commonly gather <link=\"URANIUMORE\">Uranium Ore</link> for their <link=\"BEEHIVE\">Beeta Hives</link> to produce <link=\"ENRICHEDURANIUM\">Enriched Uranium</link>.
BEE.NAME: <link=\"BEE\">Beeta</link>

BLUE_GRASS.DESC: Alveo Veras consume <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>, and form harvestable <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> deposits.
BLUE_GRASS.NAME: <link=\"BLUEGRASS\">Alveo Vera</link>

BULBPLANT.DESC: Buddy Buds are leafy plants that have a positive effect on <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>, much like a friend.
BULBPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BULBPLANT\">Buddy Bud</link>

BUTTERFLY.DESC: Mimikas are airborne organisms that help nearby <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link> grow more quickly.\n\nWhen its leaves dry up, it will harden into <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED\">Mimillet</link>.
BUTTERFLY.NAME: <link=\"BUTTERFLY\">Mimika</link>

BUTTERFLYPLANT.DESC: Mimika Buds are self-harvesting plants that produce airborne <link=\"BUTTERFLY\">Mimikas</link>.\n\n<link=\"BUTTERFLY\">Mimikas</link> boost growth for nearby <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link> before hardening into <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED\">Mimillet</link>.
BUTTERFLYPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANT\">Mimika Bud</link>

CACTUSPLANT.DESC: Joyas are <link=\"DECOR\">Decorative</link> <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link> that are colloquially said to make gardeners \"jump for joy\".
CACTUSPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CACTUSPLANT\">Jumping Joya</link>

CARROTPLANT.DESC: Plume Squashes are sweet, nutrient-rich tubers that can be harvested for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
CARROTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CARROTPLANT\">Plume Squash Plant</link>

BABY.DESC: A wide-eyed little Dartlet.\n\nSomeday it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"CHAMELEON\">Dartle</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"CHAMELEON\">Dartlet</link>

CHAMELEON.DESC: Dartles are non-hostile critters who eat <link=\"DEWDRIP\">Dewdrips</link> and excrete <link=\"BLEACHSTONE\">Bleach Stone</link> and <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link> .\n\nThey are preyed on by <link=\"RAPTOR\">Rhexes</link>.
CHAMELEON.NAME: <link=\"CHAMELEON\">Dartle</link>

CHLORINEGEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CHLORINEGEYSER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICCHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Geyser</link>

COLDBREATHER.DESC: Wheezeworts can be planted in <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Planter Boxes</link>, <link=\"FARMTILE\">Farm Tiles</link> or <link=\"HYDROPONICFARM\">Hydroponic Farms</link>, and absorb <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> by respiring through their porous outer membranes.
COLDBREATHER.NAME: <link=\"COLDBREATHER\">Wheezewort</link>

COLDBREATHERCLUSTER.DESC: Wheezeworts can be planted in <link=\"PLANTERBOX\">Planter Boxes</link>, <link=\"FARMTILE\">Farm Tiles</link> or <link=\"HYDROPONICFARM\">Hydroponic Farms</link>, and absorb <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> by respiring through their porous outer membranes.
COLDBREATHERCLUSTER.NAME: <link=\"COLDBREATHERCLUSTER\">Wheezewort</link>

COLDWHEAT.DESC: Sleet Wheat produces <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>, a chilly grain that can be processed into <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
COLDWHEAT.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant produces edible <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.
COLDWHEAT.NAME: <link=\"COLDWHEAT\">Sleet Wheat</link>

BABY.DESC: A snippy little Pokeshell Spawn.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"CRAB\">Pokeshell</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"CRAB\">Pokeshell Spawn</link>

CRAB.DESC:
Pokeshells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.

The shells they leave behind after molting can be crushed into <link="LIME">Lime</link>.
CRAB.NAME: <link=\"CRAB\">Pokeshell</link>

BABY.DESC: A picky little Sanishell Spawn.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"CRABFRESHWATER\">Sanishell</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"CRABFRESHWATER\">Sanishell Spawn</link>

VARIANT_FRESH_WATER.DESC:
Sanishells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They thrive in <link="WATER">Water</link> and eliminate <link="DISEASE">Germs</link> from any liquid it inhabits.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>, <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.
VARIANT_FRESH_WATER.NAME: <link=\"CRABFRESHWATER\">Sanishell</link>

BABY.DESC: A knotty little Oakshell Spawn.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"CRABWOOD\">Oakshell</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"CRABWOOD\">Oakshell Spawn</link>

VARIANT_WOOD.DESC:
Oakshells are nonhostile critters unless their eggs are nearby.

They eat <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>, <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link> and <link="COMPOST">Rot Piles</link>.

The shells they leave behind after molting can be crushed into <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.

Oakshells thrive in <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link>.
VARIANT_WOOD.NAME: <link=\"CRABWOOD\">Oakshell</link>

CRITTERTRAPPLANT.DESC: Critter Traps are carnivorous plants that consume small-to-medium-sized critters and release <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link> as waste.
CRITTERTRAPPLANT.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant eats small critters and produces <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link>.
CRITTERTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CRITTERTRAPPLANT\">Saturn Critter Trap</link>

CYLINDRICA.DESC: Bliss Bursts release an explosion of <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> into otherwise dull environments.
CYLINDRICA.NAME: <link=\"CYLINDRICA\">Bliss Burst</link>

DEWDRIPPERPLANT.DESC: Dew Drippers produce <link=\"DEWDRIP\">Dewdrips</link> that can be crushed into <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link>.
DEWDRIPPERPLANT.NAME: <link=\"DEWDRIPPERPLANT\">Dew Dripper</link>

DIESELMOO.DESC: Husky Moos are extraterrestrial critters that feed on <link=\"PLANTFIBER\">Plant Husk</link> and <link=\"GASGRASS\">Gas Grass</link>, and excrete <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>.\n\nWhen domesticated and fed, they can be milked for <link=\"REFINEDLIPID\">Biodiesel</link>.
DIESELMOO.NAME: <link=\"DIESELMOO\">Husky Moo</link>

DINOFERN.DESC: Megafronds produce <link=\"FERNFOOD\">Megafrond Grain</link>, an ancient grain that can be processed into <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
DINOFERN.NAME: <link=\"DINOFERN\">Megafrond</link>

BABY.DESC: A crawly little Sweetle Larva.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"DIVERGENTBEETLE\">Sweetle</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"DIVERGENTBEETLE\">Sweetle Larva</link>

VARIANT_BEETLE.DESC: Sweetles are nonhostile critters that excrete large amounts of <link=\"SUCROSE\">Sucrose</link>.\n\nThey are closely related to the <link=\"DIVERGENTWORM\">Grubgrub</link> and exhibit similar, albeit less effective farming behaviors.
VARIANT_BEETLE.NAME: <link=\"DIVERGENTBEETLE\">Sweetle</link>

BABY.DESC: A squirmy little Grubgrub Wormling.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"WORM\">Grubgrub</link> and drastically grow in size.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"DIVERGENTWORM\">Grubgrub Wormling</link>

VARIANT_WORM.DESC: Grubgrubs form symbiotic relationships with plants, especially <link=\"WORMPLANT\">Grubfruit Plants</link>, and instinctually tend to them.\n\nGrubgrubs are closely related to <link=\"DIVERGENTBEETLE\">Sweetles</link>.
VARIANT_WORM.NAME: <link=\"DIVERGENTWORM\">Grubgrub</link>

BABY.DESC: A little, bug-eyed Drecklet.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecko</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecklet</link>

DRECKO.DESC: Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on <link=\"SPICEVINE\">Pincha Pepperplants</link>, <link=\"SWAMPLILY\">Balm Lily</link> or <link=\"BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT\">Mealwood Plants</link>.\n\nTheir backsides are covered in thick woolly fibers that only grow in <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen</link> climates.
DRECKO.NAME: <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecko</link>

BABY.DESC: A bug-eyed little Glossy Drecklet.\n\nIn time it will mature into an adult Drecko morph, the <link=\"DRECKOPLASTIC\">Glossy Drecko</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"DRECKOPLASTIC\">Glossy Drecklet</link>

VARIANT_PLASTIC.DESC: Glossy Dreckos are nonhostile critters that graze on live <link=\"BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT\">Mealwood Plants</link> and <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Bristle Blossoms</link>.\n\nTheir backsides are covered in bioplastic scales that only grow in <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link> climates.
VARIANT_PLASTIC.NAME: <link=\"DRECKOPLASTIC\">Glossy Drecko</link>

EVILFLOWER.DESC: Sporechids have an eerily alluring appearance to mask the fact that they host particularly nasty strain of brain fungus.
EVILFLOWER.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant improves ambient <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> but produces high quantities of <link=\"ZOMBIESPORES\">Zombie Spores</link>.
EVILFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechid</link>

FILTERPLANT.DESC: Hydrocacti act as natural <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> filters when given access to <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link>.
FILTERPLANT.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant uses <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link> to convert <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link> into <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.
FILTERPLANT.NAME: <link=\"FILTERPLANT\">Hydrocactus</link>

FLYTRAPPLANT.DESC: Lura plants are carnivorous plants that trap flying critters, such as <link=\"MOSQUITO\">Gnits</link>.\n\nTheir digestive processes produce harvestable <link=\"AMBER\">Amber</link>.
FLYTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"FLYTRAPPLANT\">Lura Plant</link>

FORESTFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.DESC: Hexalents are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single, calorie dense <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> serving.
FORESTFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.NAME: <link=\"FORESTFORAGEPLANTPLANTED\">Hexalent</link>

GARDENDECORPLANT.DESC: Ring Rosebushes are <link=\"DECOR\">Decorative</link> <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link> that add a touch of whimsy wherever they are planted.
GARDENDECORPLANT.NAME: <link=\"GARDENDECORPLANT\">Ring Rosebush</link>

GARDENFOODPLANT.DESC: Sweatcorn Stalks produce <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD\">Sweatcorn</link>, a crisp vegetable that can be harvested for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
GARDENFOODPLANT.NAME: <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANT\">Sweatcorn Stalk</link>

GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.DESC: Snacti are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> serving.
GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.NAME: <link=\"GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANTED\">Snactus</link>

GASGRASS.DESC: Gas Grass is an alien lifeform tentatively categorized as a \"plant.\"\n\nIt can be harvested for <link=\"PLANTFIBER\">Plant Husk</link> or eaten as-is by <link=\"MOOSPECIES\">Moos</link>.
GASGRASS.DOMESTICATEDDESC: An alien grass variety that is eaten by <link=\"MOO\">Gassy Moos</link>.
GASGRASS.NAME: <link=\"GASGRASS\">Gas Grass</link>

BIG_VOLCANO.DESC: A massive volcano that periodically erupts with molten <link=\"MAGMA\">Magma</link>.
BIG_VOLCANO.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICBIGVOLCANO\">Volcano</link>

CHLORINE_GAS.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CHLORINE_GAS.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICCHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas Vent</link>

CHLORINE_GAS_COOL.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with cool <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link>.
CHLORINE_GAS_COOL.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICCHLORINEGASCOOL\">Cool Chlorine Gas Vent</link>

GEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts, spraying <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link> and boiling hot <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.

FILTHY_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with boiling <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.
FILTHY_WATER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICFILTHYWATER\">Polluted Water Vent</link>

HOT_CO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>.
HOT_CO2.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICHOTCO2\">Carbon Dioxide Vent</link>

HOT_HYDROGEN.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot gaseous <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen</link>.
HOT_HYDROGEN.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICHOTHYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Vent</link>

HOT_PO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with hot <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
HOT_PO2.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICHOTPO2\">Hot Polluted Oxygen Vent</link>

HOT_STEAM.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with scalding <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link>.
HOT_STEAM.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICHOTSTEAM\">Steam Vent</link>

HOT_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.
HOT_WATER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICHOTWATER\">Water Geyser</link>

LIQUID_CO2.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with boiling <link=\"LIQUIDCARBONDIOXIDE\">Liquid Carbon Dioxide</link>.
LIQUID_CO2.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICLIQUIDCO2\">Carbon Dioxide Geyser</link>

LIQUID_SULFUR.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with boiling <link=\"LIQUIDSULFUR\">Liquid Sulfur</link>.
LIQUID_SULFUR.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICLIQUIDSULFUR\">Liquid Sulfur Geyser</link>

METHANE.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with hot <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link>.
METHANE.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMETHANE\">Natural Gas Geyser</link>

MOLTEN_ALUMINUM.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENALUMINUM\">Molten Aluminum</link>.
MOLTEN_ALUMINUM.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENALUMINUM\">Aluminum Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_COBALT.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENCOBALT\">Molten Cobalt</link>.
MOLTEN_COBALT.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENCOBALT\">Cobalt Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_COPPER.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENCOPPER\">Molten Copper</link>.
MOLTEN_COPPER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENCOPPER\">Copper Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_GOLD.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENGOLD\">Molten Gold</link>.
MOLTEN_GOLD.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENGOLD\">Gold Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_IRON.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENIRON\">Molten Iron</link>.
MOLTEN_IRON.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENIRON\">Iron Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_NIOBIUM.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"NIOBIUM\">Niobium</link>.
MOLTEN_NIOBIUM.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENNIOBIUM\">Niobium Volcano</link>

MOLTEN_TUNGSTEN.DESC: A large volcano that periodically erupts with <link=\"MOLTENTUNGSTEN\">Molten Tungsten</link>.
MOLTEN_TUNGSTEN.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMOLTENTUNGSTEN\">Tungsten Volcano</link>

GEYSER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSER\">Steam Geyser</link>

OIL_DRIP.DESC: A fissure that periodically erupts with boiling <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link>.
OIL_DRIP.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICOILDRIP\">Leaky Oil Fissure</link>

SALT_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link=\"SALTWATER\">Salt Water</link>.
SALT_WATER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSALTWATER\">Salt Water Geyser</link>

SLIMY_PO2.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with warm <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
SLIMY_PO2.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSLIMYPO2\">Infectious Polluted Oxygen Vent</link>

SLUSH_SALT_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing <link=\"BRINE\">Brine</link>.
SLUSH_SALT_WATER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSLUSHSALTWATER\">Cool Salt Slush Geyser</link>

SLUSH_WATER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with freezing <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.
SLUSH_WATER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSLUSHWATER\">Cool Slush Geyser</link>

SMALL_VOLCANO.DESC: A miniature volcano that periodically erupts with molten <link=\"MAGMA\">Magma</link>.
SMALL_VOLCANO.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSMALLVOLCANO\">Minor Volcano</link>

STEAM.DESC: A highly pressurized vent that periodically erupts with <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link>.
STEAM.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICSTEAM\">Cool Steam Vent</link>

BABY.DESC: A little yipping Shatter Flox Fawn.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"GLASSDEER\">Shatter Flox</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"GLASSDEER\">Shatter Flox Fawn</link>

GLASSDEER.DESC: Shatter Floxes are nonhostile critters that can subsist on <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Bristle Blossom</link> and <link=\"HARDSKINBERRYPLANT\">Pikeapple Bush</link>.\n\nTheir shearable <link=\"GLASS\">Glass</link> antlers grow only when they are fed <link=\"KATAIRITE\">Abyssalite</link>.
GLASSDEER.NAME: <link=\"GLASSDEER\">Shatter Flox</link>

GLOM.DESC: Morbs are attracted to unhygienic conditions and frequently excrete bursts of <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link>.
GLOM.NAME: <link=\"GLOM\">Morb</link>

HARDSKINBERRYPLANT.DESC: Pikeapple bushes produce <link=\"HARDSKINBERRY\">Pikeapple</link>, a useful yet almost unbearably fragrant <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
HARDSKINBERRYPLANT.NAME: <link=\"HARDSKINBERRYPLANT\">Pikeapple Bush</link>

BABY.DESC: An innocent little Hatchling.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"HATCH\">Hatch</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"HATCH\">Hatchling</link>

HATCH.DESC: Hatches excrete solid <link=\"CARBON\">Coal</link> as waste and may be uncovered by digging up Buried Objects.
HATCH.NAME: <link=\"HATCH\">Hatch</link>

BABY.DESC: A doofy little Stone Hatchling.\n\nIt matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link=\"HATCHHARD\">Stone Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on various rocks and metals.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"HATCHHARD\">Stone Hatchling</link>

VARIANT_HARD.DESC: Stone Hatches excrete solid <link=\"CARBON\">Coal</link> as waste and enjoy burrowing into the ground.
VARIANT_HARD.NAME: <link=\"HATCHHARD\">Stone Hatch</link>

BABY.DESC: A doofy little Smooth Hatchling.\n\nIt matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link=\"HATCHMETAL\">Smooth Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on different types of metals.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"HATCHMETAL\">Smooth Hatchling</link>

VARIANT_METAL.DESC: Smooth Hatches enjoy burrowing into the ground and excrete <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metal</link> when fed <link=\"RAWMETAL\">Metal Ore</link>.
VARIANT_METAL.NAME: <link=\"HATCHMETAL\">Smooth Hatch</link>

BABY.DESC: A doofy little Sage Hatchling.\n\nIt matures into an adult Hatch morph, the <link=\"HATCHVEGGIE\">Sage Hatch</link>, which loves nibbling on organic materials.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"HATCHVEGGIE\">Sage Hatchling</link>

VARIANT_VEGGIE.DESC: Sage Hatches excrete solid <link=\"CARBON\">Coal</link> as waste and enjoy burrowing into the ground.
VARIANT_VEGGIE.NAME: <link=\"HATCHVEGGIE\">Sage Hatch</link>

BABY.DESC: A floofy little Bammini.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"ICEBELLY\">Bammoth</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"ICEBELLY\">Bammini</link>

ICEBELLY.DESC: Bammoths are lumbering, nonhostile creatures that subsist on <link=\"CARROT\">Plume Squash</link>, <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link> and <link=\"FRIESCARROT\">Squash Fries</link>.\n\nTheir thick overcoats can be shorn for <link=\"BASICFABRIC\">Reed Fiber</link>.
ICEBELLY.NAME: <link=\"ICEBELLY\">Bammoth</link>

BABY.DESC: A haughty little Regal Bammini.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"GOLDBELLY\">Regal Bammoth</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"GOLDBELLY\">Regal Bammini</link>

VARIANT_GOLD.DESC: Regal Bammoths are nonhostile creatures that subsist on <link=\"CARROT\">Plume Squash</link> and <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link>.\n\nTheir ornate crests grow only when they are fed <link=\"FRIESCARROT\">Squash Fries</link>.
VARIANT_GOLD.NAME: <link=\"GOLDBELLY\">Regal Bammoth</link>

ICECAVESFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.DESC: Sherberries are incapable of propagating, but can be harvested for a single <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> serving.
ICECAVESFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.NAME: <link=\"ICECAVESFORAGEPLANTPLANTED\">Sherberry Plant</link>

ICEFLOWER.DESC: Idyllas are <link=\"DECOR\">Decorative</link> <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link> with soft, pompom-shaped blossoms.\n\nGazing dreamily at them has a positive effect on <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.
ICEFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"ICEFLOWER\">Idylla Flower</link>

JUNGLEGASPLANT.DESC: A large, chlorine-dwelling <link=\"PLANTS\">Plant</link> that can be grown in farm buildings.\n\nPalmeras grow inedible buds that emit unbreathable hydrogen gas.
JUNGLEGASPLANT.DOMESTICATEDDESC: A large, chlorine-dwelling <link=\"PLANTS\">Plant</link> that grows inedible buds which emit unbreathable hydrogen gas.
JUNGLEGASPLANT.NAME: <link=\"JUNGLEGASPLANT\">Palmera Tree</link>

KELPPLANT.DESC: Seakombs consume <link=\"TOXICSAND\">Polluted Dirt</link>.\n\nTheir leaves can be processed to extract <link=\"PHYTOOIL\">Phyto Oil</link>.
KELPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"KELPPLANT\">Seakomb</link>

LEAFYPLANT.DESC: Mirth Leaves sport a calm green hue known for alleviating <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> and improving <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.
LEAFYPLANT.NAME: <link=\"LEAFYPLANT\">Mirth Leaf</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Bug</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Nymph</link>

LIGHTBUG.DESC: Shine Bugs emit a soft <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
LIGHTBUG.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLACK\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is an Abyss morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLACK\">Abyss Nymph</link>

VARIANT_BLACK.DESC: This Shine Bug emits no <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link>, but it makes up for it by having an excellent personality.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_BLACK.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLACK\">Abyss Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLUE\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is an Azure morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLUE\">Azure Nymph</link>

VARIANT_BLUE.DESC: Azure Bugs emit a soft blue <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_BLUE.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGBLUE\">Azure Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGCRYSTAL\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is a Radiant morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGCRYSTAL\">Radiant Nymph</link>

VARIANT_CRYSTAL.DESC: Radiant Bugs emit an extra-bright <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_CRYSTAL.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGCRYSTAL\">Radiant Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGORANGE\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is a Sun morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGORANGE\">Sun Nymph</link>

VARIANT_ORANGE.DESC: Sun Bugs emit a soft orange <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_ORANGE.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGORANGE\">Sun Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGPINK\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is a Coral morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGPINK\">Coral Nymph</link>

VARIANT_PINK.DESC: Coral Bugs emit a soft pink <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_PINK.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGPINK\">Coral Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGPURPLE\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is a Royal morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGPURPLE\">Royal Nymph</link>

VARIANT_PURPLE.DESC: Royal Bugs emit a soft purple <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.\n\nTheir eggs contain small amounts of <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> that can be harvested when cracked at the <link=\"EGGCRACKER\">Egg Cracker</link>.
VARIANT_PURPLE.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGPURPLE\">Royal Bug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby baby <link=\"LIGHTBUGRADIOACTIVE\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nThis one is an Ionizing morph.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGRADIOACTIVE\">Ionizing Nymph</link>

VARIANT_RADIOACTIVE.DESC: Shine Bugs emit a dangerously radioactive <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> in hopes of attracting more of their kind for company.
VARIANT_RADIOACTIVE.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUGRADIOACTIVE\">Ionizing Bug</link>

METHANEGEYSER.DESC: A highly pressurized geyser that periodically erupts with <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link>.
METHANEGEYSER.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERGENERICMETHANE\">Natural Gas Geyser</link>

BABY.DESC: A snuggly little pup.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult <link=\"MOLE\">Shove Vole</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"MOLE\">Vole Pup</link>

MOLE.DESC: Shove Voles are burrowing critters that eat the <link=\"REGOLITH\">Regolith</link> collected on terrestrial surfaces.\n\nThey cannot burrow through <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metals</link>.
MOLE.NAME: <link=\"MOLE\">Shove Vole</link>

BABY.DESC: A tender little Delecta Vole pup.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult Shove Vole morph, the <link=\"MOLEDELICACY\">Delecta Vole</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"MOLEDELICACY\">Delecta Vole Pup</link>

VARIANT_DELICACY.DESC: Delecta Voles are burrowing critters whose bodies sprout shearable <link=\"GINGERCONFIG\">Tonic Root</link> when <link=\"REGOLITH\">Regolith</link> is ingested at preferred temperatures.\n\nThey cannot burrow through <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metals</link>.
VARIANT_DELICACY.NAME: <link=\"MOLEDELICACY\">Delecta Vole</link>

MOO.DESC: Moos are extraterrestrial critters that feed on <link=\"GASGRASS\">Gas Grass</link> and excrete <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link>.\n\nWhen domesticated and fed, they can be milked for <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link>.
MOO.NAME: <link=\"MOO\">Gassy Moo</link>

BABY.DESC: A wiggly little Gnit Larva.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an irritating <link=\"MOSQUITO\">Gnit</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"MOSQUITO\">Gnit Larva</link>

MOSQUITO.DESC: Gnits are hostile airborne critters primarily bred as food for the carnivorous <link=\"FLYTRAPPLANT\">Lura Plants</link> to produce <link=\"AMBER\">Amber</link>.\n\nTheir offspring must be exposed to <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link> in order to survive.
MOSQUITO.NAME: <link=\"MOSQUITO\">Gnit</link>

MUSHROOMPLANT.DESC: Dusk Caps produce <link=\"MUSHROOM\">Mushrooms</link>, fungal growths that can be harvested for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
MUSHROOMPLANT.NAME: <link=\"MUSHROOMPLANT\">Dusk Cap</link>

MYSTERYEGG.DESC: What's growing inside? Something nice? Something mean?
MYSTERYEGG.NAME: <link=\"MYSTERYEGG\">Mysterious Egg</link>

BABY.DESC: A goopy little Slickster Larva.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster Larva</link>

OILFLOATER.DESC: Slicksters are slimy critters that consume <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and exude <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link>.
OILFLOATER.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster</link>

BABY.DESC: A snuggly little Longhair Larva.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult Slickster morph, the <link=\"OILFLOATERDECOR\">Longhair Slickster</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATERDECOR\">Longhair Larva</link>

VARIANT_DECOR.DESC: Longhair Slicksters are friendly critters that consume <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> and thrive in close contact with Duplicant companions.\n\nLonghairs have extremely beautiful and luxurious coats.
VARIANT_DECOR.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATERDECOR\">Longhair Slickster</link>

BABY.DESC: A goopy little Molten Larva.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult Slickster morph, the <link=\"OILFLOATERHIGHTEMP\">Molten Slickster</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATERHIGHTEMP\">Molten Larva</link>

VARIANT_HIGHTEMP.DESC: Molten Slicksters are slimy critters that consume <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and exude <link=\"PETROLEUM\">Petroleum</link>.
VARIANT_HIGHTEMP.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATERHIGHTEMP\">Molten Slickster</link>

OILSPOUT.DESC: A rocky vent that spouts <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link>.
OILSPOUT.NAME: <link=\"OILSPOUT\">Oil Spout</link>

OIL_WELL.DESC: Oil Reservoirs are rock formations with <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link> deposits beneath their surface.\n\nOil can be extracted from a reservoir with sufficient pressure.
OIL_WELL.NAME: <link=\"OILWELL\">Oil Reservoir</link>

OXYFERN.DESC: Oxyferns absorb <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide Gas</link> and exude breathable <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>.
OXYFERN.NAME: <link=\"OXYFERN\">Oxyfern</link>

BABY.DESC: A wriggly little Pacu Fry.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"PACU\">Pacu</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PACU\">Pacu Fry</link>

PACU.DESC: Pacus are aquatic creatures that can live in any liquid, such as <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> or <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>.\n\nEvery organism in the known universe finds the Pacu extremely delicious.
PACU.NAME: <link=\"PACU\">Pacu</link>

BABY.DESC: A wriggly little Gulp Fry.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"PACUCLEANER\">Gulp Fish</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PACUCLEANER\">Gulp Fry</link>

VARIANT_CLEANER.DESC: Gulp Fishes are aquatic critters who inhabit cold liquid pools.\n\nTheir gills filter <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link> into <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.
VARIANT_CLEANER.NAME: <link=\"PACUCLEANER\">Gulp Fish</link>

BABY.DESC: A wriggly little Tropical Fry.\n\nIn time it will mature into an adult Pacu morph, the <link=\"PACUTROPICAL\">Tropical Pacu</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PACUTROPICAL\">Tropical Fry</link>

VARIANT_TROPICAL.DESC: Tropical Pacus are aquatic critters who inhabit warm liquid pools.\n\nTheir vibrant colors provide a significant <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> boost to their environment.
VARIANT_TROPICAL.NAME: <link=\"PACUTROPICAL\">Tropical Pacu</link>

PACUEGG.DESC: A tiny Pacu is nestled inside.\n\nIt is not yet ready for the world.
PACUEGG.NAME: <link=\"PACUEGG\">Pacu Egg</link>

PINKROCK.CODEX: Lumen quartz is a naturally occurring object found in the <link=\"BIOMECARROTQUARRY\">Cool Pool</link> biome.
PINKROCK.DESC: Lumen quartz emits a soft glowing <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> that makes everything look and feel a little rosier.\n\nIt's even brighter and more beautiful once it's been carved.
PINKROCK.NAME: <link=\"PINKROCK\">Lumen Quartz</link>

PINKROCKCARVED.DESC: A Duplicant has carved this Lumen quartz in a way that really maximizes its <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> value and <link=\"LIGHT\">brightness</link>.
PINKROCKCARVED.NAME: <link=\"PINKROCK\">Carved Lumen Quartz</link>

BABY.DESC: A grumpy little Jawbo fry.\n\nIn time, it will grow into a toothy <link=\"PREHISTORICPACU\">Jawbo</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PREHISTORICPACU\">Jawbo Fry</link>

PREHISTORICPACU.DESC: Jawbos are carnivorous aquatic critters that feed on <link=\"PACU\">Pacus</link> and produce <link=\"RUST\">Rust</link>.\n\nThey pose no danger to Duplicants.
PREHISTORICPACU.NAME: <link=\"PREHISTORICPACU\">Jawbo</link>

PRICKLEFLOWER.DESC: Bristle Blossoms produce <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link>, a prickly edible bud.
PRICKLEFLOWER.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant produces edible <link=\"BRISTLE BERRY\">Bristle Berries</link>.
PRICKLEFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Bristle Blossom</link>

PRICKLEGRASS.DESC: Bluff Briars exude pheromones causing critters to view them as especially beautiful.
PRICKLEGRASS.NAME: <link=\"PRICKLEGRASS\">Bluff Briar</link>

PROPANESPOUT.DESC: A rocky vent that spouts <link=\"PROPANE\">Propane Gas</link>.
PROPANESPOUT.NAME: <link=\"GEYSERS\">Propane Spout</link>

BABY.DESC: A gassy little Puftlet.\n\nIn time it will grow into an adult <link=\"PUFT\">Puft</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PUFT\">Puftlet</link>

PUFT.DESC: Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of <link=\"SLIMEMOLD\">Slime</link> with each breath.
PUFT.NAME: <link=\"PUFT\">Puft</link>

BABY.DESC:
A gassy little Puftlet Prince.

One day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link="PUFTALPHA">Puft Prince</link>.

It seems a bit snobby...
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PUFTALPHA\">Puftlet Prince</link>

VARIANT_ALPHA.DESC: The Puft Prince is a lazy critter that excretes little <link=\"SOLID\">Solid</link> lumps of whatever it has been breathing.
VARIANT_ALPHA.NAME: <link=\"PUFTALPHA\">Puft Prince</link>

BABY.DESC: A frazzled little Squeaky Puftlet.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link=\"PUFTBLEACHSTONE\">Squeaky Puft</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PUFTBLEACHSTONE\">Squeaky Puftlet</link>

VARIANT_BLEACHSTONE.DESC: Squeaky Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete lumps of <link=\"BLEACHSTONE\">Bleachstone</link> with each breath.
VARIANT_BLEACHSTONE.NAME: <link=\"PUFTBLEACHSTONE\">Squeaky Puft</link>

BABY.DESC: A stocky little Dense Puftlet.\n\nOne day it will grow into an adult Puft morph, the <link=\"PUFTOXYLITE\">Dense Puft</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"PUFTOXYLITE\">Dense Puftlet</link>

VARIANT_OXYLITE.DESC: Dense Pufts are non-aggressive critters that excrete condensed <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> with each breath.
VARIANT_OXYLITE.NAME: <link=\"PUFTOXYLITE\">Dense Puft</link>

BABY.DESC: A feathery little Rhex fledgling.\n\nOne day, it will grow into a fearsome <link=\"RAPTOR\">Rhex</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"RAPTOR\">Rhex Baby</link>

RAPTOR.DESC: Rhexes are carnivorous critters that feed on smaller <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link> and produce <link=\"BRINEICE\">Brine Ice</link>.\n\nTheir tailfeathers can be shorn for <link=\"FEATHERFABRIC\">Feather Fiber</link>.
RAPTOR.NAME: <link=\"RAPTOR\">Rhex</link>

SALTPLANT.DESC: Dasha Saltvines consume small amounts of <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link> and form sodium deposits as they grow, producing harvestable <link=\"SALT\">Salt</link>.
SALTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"SALTPLANT\">Dasha Saltvine</link>

SAPTREE.DESC: A <link=\"RESIN\">Sap</link>-producing cybernetic tree that shows signs of sentience.\n\nIt is rooted firmly in place, and is waiting for some brave soul to bring it food.
SAPTREE.NAME: <link=\"SAPTREE\">Experiment 52B</link>

BABY.DESC: A wobbly little Spigot Pup.\n\nIn time, it will mature into an adult <link=\"SEAL\">Spigot Seal</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"SEAL\">Spigot Pup</link>

SEAL.DESC: Spigot Seals are charismatic creatures who produce <link=\"ETHANOL\">Ethanol</link>.\n\nThey eat <link=\"SUCROSE\">Sucrose</link>, and drink <link=\"SUGARWATER\">Nectar</link> straight from the <link=\"SPACETREE\">Bonbon Tree</link>.
SEAL.NAME: <link=\"SEAL\">Spigot Seal</link>

SEALETTUCE.DESC: Waterweeds thrive in salty water and can be harvested for fresh, edible <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link>.
SEALETTUCE.NAME: <link=\"SEALETTUCE\">Waterweed</link>

BASICFABRICMATERIALPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"BASICFABRICPLANT\">Thimble Reed</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Thimble Reed Seed.
BASICFABRICMATERIALPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BASICFABRICPLANT\">Thimble Reed Seed</link>

BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT\">Mealwood</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mealwood Seed.
BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BASICSINGLEHARVESTPLANT\">Mealwood Seed</link>

BEAN_PLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"BEANPLANT\">Nosh Sprout</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Nosh Bean.
BEAN_PLANT.NAME: <link=\"BEANPLANT\">Nosh Bean</link>

BLUE_GRASS.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"BLUEGRASS\">Alveo Vera</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover an Alveo Vera Seed.
BLUE_GRASS.NAME: <link=\"BLUEGRASS\">Alveo Vera Seed</link>

BULBPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"BULBPLANT\">Buddy Bud</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Buddy Bud Seed.
BULBPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BULBPLANT\">Buddy Bud Seed</link>

BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.DESC:
An inedible <link="PLANTS">Seed</link> of a <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimika Bud</link> plant.

It can be sown to cultivate more plants, or processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover Mimillet.
BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.NAME: <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED\">Mimillet</link>

CACTUSPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"CACTUSPLANT\">Jumping Joya</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Joya Seed.
CACTUSPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CACTUSPLANT\">Joya Seed</link>

CARROTPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"CARROTPLANT\">Plume Squash Plant</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Plume Squash Seed.
CARROTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CARROTPLANT\">Plume Squash Seed</link>

COLDBREATHER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"COLDBREATHER\">Wheezewort</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Wort Seed.
COLDBREATHER.NAME: <link=\"COLDBREATHER\">Wort Seed</link>

COLDWHEAT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"COLDWHEAT\">Sleet Wheat</link> plant.\n\nGrain can be sown to cultivate more Sleet Wheat, or processed into <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
COLDWHEAT.NAME: <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>

CRITTERTRAPPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"CRITTERTRAPPLANT\">Saturn Critter Trap</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Saturn Critter Trap Seed.
CRITTERTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"CRITTERTRAPPLANT\">Saturn Critter Trap Seed</link>

CYLINDRICA.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"CYLINDRICA\">Bliss Burst</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bliss Burst Seed.
CYLINDRICA.NAME: <link=\"CYLINDRICA\">Bliss Burst Seed</link>

EVILFLOWER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechid</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechid Seed</link>.
EVILFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechid Seed</link>

FILTERPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"FILTERPLANT\">Hydrocactus</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Hydrocactus Seed.
FILTERPLANT.NAME: <link=\"FILTERPLANT\">Hydrocactus Seed</link>

FLYTRAPPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"FLYTRAPPLANT\">Lura Plant</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Lura Seed.
FLYTRAPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"FLYTRAPPLANT\">Lura Seed</link>

GARDENDECORPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"GARDENDECORPLANT\">Ring Rosebush</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Rosebush Seed.
GARDENDECORPLANT.NAME: <link=\"GARDENDECORPLANT\">Rosebush Seed</link>

GARDENFOODPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANT\">Sweatcorn Stalk</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Sweatcorn Seed.
GARDENFOODPLANT.NAME: <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANT\">Sweatcorn Seed</link>

HARDSKINBERRYPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"HARDSKINBERRYPLANT\">Pikeapple Bush</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Pikeapple Bush Seed.
HARDSKINBERRYPLANT.NAME: <link=\"HARDSKINBERRYPLANT\">Pikeapple Bush Seed</link>

ICEFLOWER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of an <link=\"ICEFLOWER\">Idylla Flower</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover an Idylla Seed.
ICEFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"ICEFLOWER\">Idylla Seed</link>

KELPPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"KELPPLANT\">Seakomb</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Seakomb Seed.
KELPPLANT.NAME: <link=\"KELPPLANT\">Seakomb Seed</link>

LEAFYPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"LEAFYPLANT\">Mirth Leaf</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mirth Leaf Seed.
LEAFYPLANT.NAME: <link=\"LEAFYPLANT\">Mirth Leaf Seed</link>

MUSHROOMPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"MUSHROOMPLANT\">Dusk Cap</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Fungal Spore.
MUSHROOMPLANT.NAME: <link=\"MUSHROOMPLANT\">Fungal Spore</link>

OILEATER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"INK BLOOM\">Plant</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover an Ink Bloom Seed.
OILEATER.NAME: <link=\"OILEATER\">Ink Bloom Seed</link>

PRICKLEFLOWER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Bristle Blossom</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Blossom Seed.
PRICKLEFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Blossom Seed</link>

PRICKLEGRASS.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"PRICKLEGRASS\">Bluff Briar</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Briar Seed.
PRICKLEGRASS.NAME: <link=\"PRICKLEGRASS\">Briar Seed</link>

SALTPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SALTPLANT\">Dasha Saltvine</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Dasha Saltvine Seed.
SALTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"SALTPLANT\">Dasha Saltvine Seed</link>

SEALETTUCE.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SEALETTUCE\">Waterweed</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Waterweed Seed.
SEALETTUCE.NAME: <link=\"SEALETTUCE\">Waterweed Seed</link>

SPACETREE.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SPACETREE\">Bonbon Tree</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bonbon Tree Seed.
SPACETREE.NAME: <link=\"SPACETREE\">Bonbon Tree Seed</link>

SPICE_VINE.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SPICEVINE\">Pincha Pepperplant</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Pincha Pepper Seed.
SPICE_VINE.NAME: <link=\"SPICEVINE\">Pincha Pepper Seed</link>

SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SWAMPHARVESTPLANT\">Bog Bucket</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Bog Bucket Seed.
SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPHARVESTPLANT\">Bog Bucket Seed</link>

SWAMPLILY.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"SWAMPLILY\">Balm Lily</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Balm Lily Seed.
SWAMPLILY.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPLILY\">Balm Lily Seed</link>

TOEPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"TOEPLANT\">Tranquil Toes</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Tranquil Toe Seed.
TOEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"TOEPLANT\">Tranquil Toe Seed</link>

VINEMOTHER.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Node</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover an Ovagro Node Seed.
VINEMOTHER.NAME: <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Node Seed</link>

WINECUPS.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"WINECUPS\">Mellow Mallow</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mallow Seed.
WINECUPS.NAME: <link=\"WINECUPS\">Mallow Seed</link>

WOOD_TREE.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of an <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover an Arbor Acorn.
WOOD_TREE.NAME: <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Acorn</link>

WORMPLANT.DESC: The <link=\"PLANTS\">Seed</link> of a <link=\"WORMPLANT\">Spindly Grubfruit Plant</link>.\n\nDigging up Buried Objects may uncover a Grubfruit Seed.
WORMPLANT.NAME: <link=\"WORMPLANT\">Grubfruit Seed</link>

SHOCKWORM.DESC: Shockworms are exceptionally aggressive and discharge electrical shocks to stun their prey.
SHOCKWORM.NAME: <link=\"SHOCKWORM\">Shockworm</link>

SPACETREE.DESC:
Bonbon Tree branches synthesize <link="LIGHT">Light</link> to produce <link="SUGARWATER">Nectar</link>.

Branches can be harvested for <link="WOOD">Wood</link>.

Bonbon Trees can shed most environmental debris, and rarely become entombed.
SPACETREE.NAME: <link=\"SPACETREE\">Bonbon Tree</link>

SPICE_VINE.DESC: Pincha Pepperplants produce flavorful <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link> for spicing <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
SPICE_VINE.NAME: <link=\"SPICEVINE\">Pincha Pepperplant</link>

BABY.DESC: A little purring Pipsqueak.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Pip</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Pipsqueak</link>

SQUIRREL.DESC: Pips are pesky, nonhostile critters that subsist on <link=\"BASICFABRICPLANT\">Thimble Reeds</link> and <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree</link> branches.\n\nThey are known to bury <link=\"PLANTS\">Seeds</link> in the ground whenever they can find a suitable area with enough space.
SQUIRREL.NAME: <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Pip</link>

BABY.DESC: A fuzzy little Cuddle Pipsqueak.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Cuddle Pip</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Cuddle Pipsqueak</link>

VARIANT_HUG.DESC: Cuddle Pips are fluffy, affectionate critters who exhibit a strong snuggling instinct towards all types of eggs.\n\nThis is temporarily amplified when they are hugged by a passing Duplicant.
VARIANT_HUG.NAME: <link=\"SQUIRREL\">Cuddle Pip</link>

BABY.DESC: A chubby little Plug Sluglet.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Plug Slug</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Plug Sluglet</link>

STATERPILLAR.DESC: Plug Slugs are dynamic creatures that generate electrical <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> during the night.\n\nTheir power can be harnessed by leaving an exposed wire near areas where they like to sleep.
STATERPILLAR.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Plug Slug</link>

BABY.DESC: A tubby little Smog Sluglet.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Smog Slug</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Smog Sluglet</link>

VARIANT_GAS.DESC: Smog Slugs are porous creatures that draw in unbreathable <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gases</link> during the day.\n\nAt night, they sleep near exposed <link=\"GASCONDUIT\">Gas Pipes,</link> where they deposit their cache.
VARIANT_GAS.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Smog Slug</link>

BABY.DESC: A chonky little Sponge Sluglet.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Sponge Slug</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Sponge Sluglet</link>

VARIANT_LIQUID.DESC: Sponge Slugs are thirsty creatures that soak up <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link> during the day.\n\nThey deposit their stored <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link> into the exposed <link=\"LIQUIDCONDUIT\">Liquid Pipes</link> they sleep next to at night.
VARIANT_LIQUID.NAME: <link=\"STATERPILLAR\">Sponge Slug</link>

BABY.DESC: A heavy-footed little Lumb baby.\n\nIn time, it will grow into a stompy <link=\"STEGO\">Lumb</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"STEGO\">Lumblet</link>

STEGO.DESC: Lumbs are non-hostile critters that subsist on <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro</link> vines.\n\nWhen they stomp heavily near <link=\"PLANTS\">plants</link>, the commotion causes harvestable items to fall to the ground.
STEGO.NAME: <link=\"STEGO\">Lumb</link>

SUPERWORMPLANT.DESC: A Grubfruit Plant that has flourished after being tended by a <link=\"DIVERGENTSPECIES\">Divergent</link> critter.\n\nIt will produce high quality <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruits</link>.
SUPERWORMPLANT.NAME: <link=\"WORMPLANT\">Grubfruit Plant</link>

SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.DESC: Swamp Chards are incapable of propagating but can be harvested for a single low quality and calorie dense <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> serving.
SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTED.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTED\">Swamp Chard</link>

SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.DESC: Bog Buckets produce juicy, sweet <link=\"SWAMPFRUIT\">Bog Jellies</link> for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
SWAMPHARVESTPLANT.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPHARVESTPLANT\">Bog Bucket</link>

SWAMPLILY.DESC: Balm Lilies produce <link=\"SWAMPLILYFLOWER\">Balm Lily Flower</link>, a lovely bloom with medicinal properties.
SWAMPLILY.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant produces medicinal <link=\"SWAMPLILYFLOWER\">Balm Lily Flower</link>.
SWAMPLILY.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPLILY\">Balm Lily</link>

TOEPLANT.DESC: Tranquil Toes improve <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> by giving their surroundings the visual equivalent of a foot rub.
TOEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"TOEPLANT\">Tranquil Toes</link>

VINEBRANCH.DESC: Ovagro Vines are plants that produce edible <link=\"VINEFRUIT\">Ovagro Fig</link>.\n\nIf a vine is cut off from its <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Node</link>, it will perish.
VINEBRANCH.NAME: <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Vine</link>

VINEMOTHER.DESC: Ovagro Nodes are trellis plants that spread onto nearby available surfaces.\n\nA single <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Node</link> can support several <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Vines</link> without any increase in its <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> requirements.
VINEMOTHER.NAME: <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Node</link>

WINECUPS.DESC: Mellow Mallows heighten <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> and alleviate <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> with their calming color and cradle shape.
WINECUPS.NAME: <link=\"WINECUPS\">Mellow Mallow</link>

BABY.DESC: A little yipping Flox Fawn.\n\nIn time it will mature into a fully grown <link=\"WOODDEER\">Flox</link>.
BABY.NAME: <link=\"WOODDEER\">Flox Fawn</link>

WOODDEER.DESC: Floxes are nonhostile critters that graze on <link=\"PRICKLEFLOWER\">Bristle Blossoms</link> and <link=\"HARDSKINBERRY\">Pikeapples</link>.\n\nWhen Flox antlers are fully grown, they harden into shearable <link=\"WOOD\">Wood</link>.
WOODDEER.NAME: <link=\"WOODDEER\">Flox</link>

WOOD_TREE.DESC: Arbor Trees grow <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree Branches</link> and can be harvested for <link=\"WOOD\">Wood</link>.
WOOD_TREE.DOMESTICATEDDESC: This plant produces <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree Branches</link> that can be harvested for <link=\"WOOD\">Wood</link>.
WOOD_TREE.NAME: <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree</link>

WOOD_TREE_BRANCH.DESC: Arbor Trees Branches can be harvested for <link=\"WOOD\">Wood</link>.
WOOD_TREE_BRANCH.NAME: <link=\"FORESTTREE\">Arbor Tree Branch</link>

WORMPLANT.DESC: Spindly Grubfruit Plants produce <link=\"WORMBASICFRUIT\">Spindly Grubfruit</link> for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nIf it is tended by a <link=\"DIVERGENTSPECIES\">Divergent</link> critter, it will produce high quality fruits instead.
WORMPLANT.NAME: <link=\"WORMPLANT\">Spindly Grubfruit Plant</link>

AGE.NAME: Age
AGE.TOOLTIP: This critter will die when its <style=\"KKeyword\">Age</style> reaches its species' maximum lifespan

AIRPRESSURE.NAME: Air Pressure
AIRPRESSURE.TOOLTIP: The average <style=\"KKeyword\">Gas</style> density of the air surrounding this plant

BECKONING.NAME: Accu-moo-lation
BECKONING.TOOLTIP: At 100% <style=\"KKeyword\">Accu-moo-lation</style>, this critter will call a friend to join them on this asteroid\n\nOnce the newcomer has landed, <style=\"KKeyword\">Accu-moo-lation</style> is rolled back to 0%

CRITTERTEMPERATURE.NAME: Body Temperature
CRITTERTEMPERATURE.TOOLTIP: This critter's comfortable Body Temperature range is between {0} and {1}\n\nIts livable External Temperature range is between {2} and {3}

DOMESTICATION.NAME: Domestication
DOMESTICATION.TOOLTIP: Fully Tame critters produce more materials than wild ones, and may even provide psychological benefits to my colony\n\nThis critter is {0} domesticated

ELEMENTGROWTH.NAME: Quill Growth
ELEMENTGROWTH.TOOLTIP: The amount of time required for this critter to regrow its <style=\"KKeyword\">Tonic Root</style>

FERTILITY.NAME: Reproduction
FERTILITY.TOOLTIP: At 100% <style=\"KKeyword\">Reproduction</style>, critters will reach the end of their reproduction cycle and lay a new <style=\"KKeyword\">Egg</style>\n\nAfter an <style=\"KKeyword\">Egg</style> is laid, <style=\"KKeyword\">Reproduction</style> is rolled back to 0%

HAPPINESS.NAME: Happiness
HAPPINESS.TOOLTIP: High <style=\"KKeyword\">Happiness</style> increases a critter's productivity and indirectly improves their <style=\"KKeyword\">Egg</style> laying rates\n\nIt also provides the satisfaction in knowing they're living a good little critter life

INCUBATION.NAME: Incubation
INCUBATION.TOOLTIP: Eggs hatch into brand new <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link> at the end of their incubation period

MATURITY.NAME: Growth Progress
MATURITY.TOOLTIP_GROWING_CROP: Predicted Maturation Time: {0}\nNext harvest occurs in approximately {1}
MATURITY.TOOLTIP_GROWN: Growth paused while plant awaits harvest
MATURITY.TOOLTIP_STALLED: Poor conditions have halted this plant's growth

MILKPRODUCTION.NAME: Brackene Supply
MILKPRODUCTION.TOOLTIP: The amount of time required for this critter to replenish its natural reserves of <style=\"KKeyword\">{0}</style>

ROT.NAME: Freshness
ROT.TOOLTIP: Food items become stale at fifty percent <style=\"KKeyword\">Freshness</style>, and rot at zero percent

SCALEGROWTH.NAME: Scale Growth
SCALEGROWTH.TOOLTIP: When growth reaches 100%, this critter can be shorn for {0}

THERMALCONDUCTIVITYBARRIER.NAME: Thermal Conductivity Barrier
THERMALCONDUCTIVITYBARRIER.TOOLTIP: Thick <style=\"KKeyword\">Conductivity Barriers</style> increase the time it takes an object to heat up or cool down

VIABILITY.NAME: Viability
VIABILITY.TOOLTIP: Eggs will lose <style=\"KKeyword\">Viability</style> over time when exposed to poor environmental conditions\n\nAt 0% <style=\"KKeyword\">Viability</style> a critter egg will crack and produce a <link=\"RAWEGG\">Raw Egg</link> and <link=\"EGGSHELL\">Egg Shell</link>

WILDNESS.NAME: Wildness
WILDNESS.TOOLTIP: At 0% <style=\"KKeyword\">Wildness</style> a critter becomes <style=\"KKeyword\">Tame</style>, increasing its <style=\"KKeyword\">Metabolism</style> and requiring regular care from Duplicants\n\nDuplicants must possess the <style=\"KKeyword\">Critter Ranching</style> skill to care for critters

INTERACTING.NAME: Getting Cozy
INTERACTING.TOOLTIP: This critter is nesting in an airborne critter condo\n\nIt's like a mini vacation!

MOVINGTO.NAME: Heading for Airborne Critter Condo
MOVINGTO.TOOLTIP: This critter is making its way to an unoccupied airborne critter condo

AQUATICCREATURESUFFOCATING.NAME: Suffocating

QUALITYOFLIFE.DESC:
A Duplicant's <style="KKeyword">Morale</style> must exceed their <style="KKeyword">Morale Need</style>, or they'll begin to accumulate <style="KKeyword">Stress</style>.

<style="KKeyword">Morale</style> can be increased by providing Duplicants higher quality <style="KKeyword">Food</style>, allotting more <style="KKeyword">Downtime</style> in
the colony schedule, or building better <style="KKeyword">Bathrooms</style> and <style="KKeyword">Bedrooms</style> for them to live in.

POLLENGERMS.DESC: Floral Scent allergens trigger excessive sneezing fits in Duplicants who possess the Allergies trait.

PUTRIDODOUR.DESCRIPTION: \nThe pungent odor wafting off this Duplicant is nauseating to their peers
PUTRIDODOUR.NAME: <link=\"PUTRIDODOUR\">Trench Stench</link>

RADIATIONPOISONING.DESC: Items tainted with Radioactive Contaminants emit low levels of <link=\"RADIATION\">Radiation</link> that can cause <link=\"RADIATIONSICKNESS\">Radiation Sickness</link>. They are unaffected by pressure or temperature, but do degrade over time.
RADIATIONPOISONING.NAME: <link=\"RADIATIONPOISONING\">Radioactive Contamination</link>

RADIATIONSICKNESS.DESC: Items tainted with Radioactive Contaminants emit low levels of <link=\"RADIATION\">Radiation</link> that can cause <link=\"RADIATIONSICKNESS\">Radiation Sickness</link>. They are unaffected by pressure or temperature, but do degrade over time.
RADIATIONSICKNESS.DESCRIPTION: This Duplicant is leaving a trail of <style=\"KKeyword\">Radiation</style> behind them.
RADIATIONSICKNESS.DESCRIPTIVE_SYMPTOMS: Extremely lethal. This Duplicant is not expected to survive.
RADIATIONSICKNESS.NAME: <link=\"RADIATIONSICKNESS\">Radioactive Contaminants</link>

SLIMELUNG.DESC: Slimelung germs are found in <link=\"SLIMEMOLD\">Slime</link> and <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link>. Inhaling these germs can cause Duplicants to cough and struggle to breathe.
SLIMELUNG.NAME: <link=\"SLIMELUNG\">Slimelung</link>

SLIMESICKNESS.COUGH_SYMPTOM_TOOLTIP: Duplicants periodically cough up <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link>, producing additional <style=\"KKeyword\">Germs</style>

SLIMESICKNESS.DESCRIPTIVE_SYMPTOMS: Lethal without medical treatment. Duplicants experience coughing and shortness of breath.

SLIMESICKNESS.NAME: <link=\"SLIMESICKNESS\">Slimelung</link>

STATUS_ITEM_TOOLTIP.BEDREST: Sick Bay assignment will allow faster recovery\n

SUNBURNSICKNESS.DESCRIPTION: Extreme sun exposure has given this Duplicant a nasty burn.

ZOMBIESICKNESS.DESCRIPTION: Fungal spores have infiltrated the Duplicant's head and are sending unnatural electrical impulses to their brain
ZOMBIESICKNESS.DESCRIPTIVE_SYMPTOMS: Duplicants lose much of their motor control and experience extreme discomfort.

ZOMBIESPORES.DESC: Zombie Spores are a parasitic brain fungus released by <link=\"EVILFLOWER\">Sporechids</link>. Duplicants who touch or inhale the spores risk becoming infected and temporarily losing motor control.
ZOMBIESPORES.NAME: <link=\"ZOMBIESPORES\">Zombie Spores</link>

BIONIC.DESC: Bionic Duplicants run on <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Power Banks</link>, <link=\"LUBRICATINGOIL\">Gear Oil</link> and unbridled enthusiasm.\n\nThey should not be permitted to use standard <link=\"MISCELLANEOUSTIPS\">Toilets</link>.

REMOTEWORKER.DESC: A remotely operated work robot.\n\nIt performs chores as instructed by a <link=\"REMOTEWORKTERMINAL\">Remote Controller</link> on the same planetoid.

STANDARD.DESC: Standard Duplicants are hard workers who enjoy good <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>, fresh <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> and creative colony-building.\n\nThey will complete errands in order of <link=\"PRIORITY\">Priority</link>.

MEDICINE_BASICRADPILL.TOOLTIP: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.

MEDICINE_GENERICPILL.NAME: Placebo
MEDICINE_GENERICPILL.TOOLTIP: A general, all-purpose <link=\"MEDICINE\">Medicine</link>.\n\nThe less one knows about it, the better it works.

MEDICINE_INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.NAME: <link=\"INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER\">Immuno Booster</link>
MEDICINE_INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.TOOLTIP: Significantly reduces the chance of becoming sick.

MEDICINE_INTERMEDIATERADPILL.NAME: <link=\"INTERMEDIATERADPILL\">Intermediate Rad Pill</link>
MEDICINE_INTERMEDIATERADPILL.TOOLTIP: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.

MEGABRAINTANKBONUS.NAME: Maximum Aptitude
MEGABRAINTANKBONUS.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is smarter and stronger than usual thanks to the <style=\"KKeyword\">Somnium Synthesizer</style>

MESSTABLESALT.NAME: Salted Food
MESSTABLESALT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant had the luxury of using <style=\"KKeyword\"><link=\"IDTABLESALT\">Table Salt</link></style> with their last meal at a <link=\"DININGTABLE\">Mess Table</link>

METABOLISM_CALORIE_MODIFIER.NAME: Metabolism
METABOLISM_CALORIE_MODIFIER.TOOLTIP: <style=\"KKeyword\">Metabolism</style> determines how quickly a critter burns <style=\"KKeyword\">Calories</style>

MINORIRRITATION.CAUSE: Obtained by exposure to a harsh liquid or gas
MINORIRRITATION.NAME: Minor Eye Irritation
MINORIRRITATION.TOOLTIP: A gas or liquid made this Duplicant's eyes sting a little

MODERATEWOUNDS.NAME: Moderate Wounds
MODERATEWOUNDS.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant sustained injuries that are affecting their ability to work

MODERATEWOUNDSCRITTER.NAME: Moderate Wounds
MODERATEWOUNDSCRITTER.TOOLTIP: This Critter sustained injuries that are really affecting their health

MOURNING.NAME: Mourning
MOURNING.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is grieving the loss of a friend

NARCOLEPTICSLEEP.NAME: Narcoleptic Nap
NARCOLEPTICSLEEP.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant just needs to rest their eyes for a second

NEWCREWARRIVAL.NAME: New Friend
NEWCREWARRIVAL.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is happy to see a new face in the colony

NIGHTMARES.NAME: Nightmares
NIGHTMARES.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant was visited by something in the night

NOFUNALLOWED.NAME: Fun Interrupted
NOFUNALLOWED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is upset a party was rejected

NOISEMAJOR.NAME: Cacophony!
NOISEMAJOR.TOOLTIP: It's very, very loud in here!

NOISEMINOR.NAME: Loud Noises
NOISEMINOR.TOOLTIP: This area is a bit too loud for comfort

NOISEPEACEFUL.NAME: Peace and Quiet
NOISEPEACEFUL.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant has found a quiet place to concentrate

NOLUBRICATIONMAJOR.NAME: Grinding Gears

NOLUBRICATIONMINOR.NAME: Grinding Gears (Reduced)

NOOXYGEN.NAME: No Oxygen
NOOXYGEN.TOOLTIP: There is no breathable air in this area

PASSEDOUTSLEEP.NAME: Exhausted
PASSEDOUTSLEEP.TOOLTIP: Lack of rest depleted this Duplicant's <style=\"KKeyword\">Stamina</style>\n\nThey passed out from the fatigue

PEACEFULSLEEP.NAME: Well Rested
PEACEFULSLEEP.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant had a blissfully quiet sleep last night

PEOPLETOOCLOSEWHILESLEEPING.CAUSE: This Duplicant got so good at their job that they stopped being comfortable sleeping near other people
PEOPLETOOCLOSEWHILESLEEPING.NAME: Personal Bubble Burst
PEOPLETOOCLOSEWHILESLEEPING.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant had to sleep too close to others and it was awkward for them

PLAYEDARCADE.NAME: Played Video Games
PLAYEDARCADE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently played video games and is feeling like a champ

POPPEDEARDRUMS.NAME: Popped Eardrums
POPPEDEARDRUMS.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant was exposed to an over-pressurized area that popped their eardrums

POSTDISEASERECOVERY.ADDITIONAL_EFFECTS: This Duplicant has temporary immunity to diseases from having beaten an infection
POSTDISEASERECOVERY.NAME: Feeling better

POWERTINKER.NAME: Engie's Tune-Up

PRICKLEFRUITDAMAGE.NAME: Ouch!
PRICKLEFRUITDAMAGE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant ate a raw <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link> and it gave their mouth ouchies

RADIATIONEXPOSUREDEADLY.NAME: Deadly Radiation Sickness

RADIATIONEXPOSUREEXTREME.NAME: Extreme Radiation Sickness

RADIATIONEXPOSUREMINOR.NAME: Minor Radiation Sickness

RECENTLYPARTIED.NAME: Partied Hard
RECENTLYPARTIED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently attended a great party!

REDALERT.NAME: Red Alert!
REDALERT.TOOLTIP: The <style=\"KKeyword\">Red Alert</style> is stressing this Duplicant out

RESTFULSLEEP.NAME: Sleeping Peacefully

RESTLESS.CAUSE: This Duplicant got so good at their job that they forgot how to be comfortable doing anything else

RESTLESS.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant went a few minutes without working and is now completely awash with guilt

ROOMBANQUETHALL.NAME: Banquet Hall

ROOMBARRACKS.NAME: Barracks

ROOMBATHROOM.NAME: Washroom
ROOMBATHROOM.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant used a <link=\"FLUSHTOILET\">Lavatory</link> in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Washroom</style>

ROOMBEDROOM.NAME: Luxury Barracks
ROOMBEDROOM.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant slept in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Luxury Barracks</style> last night and feels extra refreshed

ROOMGREATHALL.NAME: Great Hall
ROOMGREATHALL.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's most recent meal was eaten in a fancy <style=\"KKeyword\">Great Hall</style>

ROOMLATRINE.NAME: Latrine
ROOMLATRINE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant used an <link=\"OUTHOUSE\">Outhouse</link> in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Latrine</style>

ROOMMESSHALL.NAME: Mess Hall
ROOMMESSHALL.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's most recent meal was eaten in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Mess Hall</style>

ROOMNATURERESERVE.NAME: Nature Reserve
ROOMNATURERESERVE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently passed through a splendid Nature Reserve\n\nWow, nature sure is neat!

ROOMPARK.NAME: Park
ROOMPARK.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently passed through a Park\n\nWow, nature sure is neat!

ROOMPRIVATEBEDROOM.NAME: Private Bedroom
ROOMPRIVATEBEDROOM.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant slept in a <style=\"KKeyword\">Private Bedroom</style> last night and feels super refreshed

SANDBOXMORALEADJUSTMENT.NAME: Sandbox Morale Adjustment
SANDBOXMORALEADJUSTMENT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant has had their <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale</style> temporarily adjusted using the Sandbox tools

SAUNA.NAME: Steam Powered
SAUNA.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant just had a relaxing time in a sauna\n\nLeisure activities increase Duplicants' <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale</style>

SAUNARELAXING.NAME: Relaxing
SAUNARELAXING.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is relaxing in a sauna

SAWROBODANCER.NAME: Hyped
SAWROBODANCER.TOOLTIP: A Flash Mobber's dance moves wowed this Duplicant\n\nThis Duplicant feels amped up now!

SAWSPARKLESTREAKER.NAME: Sparkle Flattered
SAWSPARKLESTREAKER.TOOLTIP: A Sparkle Streaker's sparkles dazzled this Duplicant\n\nThis Duplicant has a spring in their step now!

SEAFOODRADIATIONRESISTANCE.CAUSE: Obtained by eating sea-grown foods like fish or lettuce

SEVEREWOUNDS.NAME: Severe Wounds
SEVEREWOUNDS.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant sustained serious injuries that are impacting their work and well-being

SEVEREWOUNDSCRITTER.NAME: Severe Wounds
SEVEREWOUNDSCRITTER.TOOLTIP: This Critter sustained serious injuries that could prove life-threatening

SHOWERED.NAME: Showered
SHOWERED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently had a shower and feels squeaky clean!

SLEEPCLINIC.NAME: Nodding Off
SLEEPCLINIC.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant is losing <style=\"KKeyword\">Stamina</style> because of their <style=\"KKeyword\">Pajamas</style>

SLIMESICKNESSRECOVERY.NAME: Slimelung Antibodies
SLIMESICKNESSRECOVERY.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently recovered from <link=\"SLIMESICKNESS\">Slimelung</link> and is temporarily immune to the <style=\"KKeyword\">Disease</style>

SLIPPED.NAME: Slipped
SLIPPED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant recently lost their footing on a slippery floor and feels embarrassed

SMELLEDFLOWERS.NAME: Smelled Flowers
SMELLEDFLOWERS.TOOLTIP: A pleasant <link=\"POLLENGERMS\">Floral Scent</link> wafted over this Duplicant and brightened their day

SMELLEDPUTRIDODOUR.NAME: Smelled a putrid odor
SMELLEDPUTRIDODOUR.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant got a whiff of something unspeakably foul

SMELLEDSTINKY.NAME: Smelled Stinky
SMELLEDSTINKY.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant got a whiff of a certain somebody

SOAKINGWET.NAME: Sopping Wet
SOAKINGWET.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant was recently submerged in <style=\"KKeyword\">Liquid</style>

SOCIALIZED.NAME: Socialized
SOCIALIZED.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant had some free time to hang out with buddies

SODAFOUNTAIN.NAME: Soda Filled
SODAFOUNTAIN.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant just enjoyed a bubbly beverage\n\nLeisure activities increase Duplicants' <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale</style>

SOILEDSUIT.CAUSE: Obtained when a Duplicant wears a suit filled with... \"fluids\"

SOILEDSUIT.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant's suit needs to be emptied of waste\n\n(Preferably soon)

SOREBACK.CAUSE: Obtained by sleeping on the ground
