OXYGEN_TANK.EFFECT: Allows Duplicants to breathe in hazardous environments.\n\nDoes not work when submerged in <style=\"liquid\">Liquid</style>.
OXYGEN_TANK.NAME: <link=\"OXYGENTANK\">Oxygen Tank</link>
OXYGEN_TANK.RECIPE_DESC: Allows Duplicants to breathe in hazardous environments.\n\nDoes not work when submerged in <style=\"liquid\">Liquid</style>

OXYGEN_TANK_UNDERWATER.EFFECT: Allows Duplicants to breathe while submerged in <style=\"liquid\">Liquid</style>.\n\nDoes not work outside of liquid.
OXYGEN_TANK_UNDERWATER.NAME: Oxygen Rebreather
OXYGEN_TANK_UNDERWATER.RECIPE_DESC: Allows Duplicants to breathe while submerged in <style=\"liquid\">Liquid</style>.\n\nDoes not work outside of liquid

SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS.DESC: A soft, fleecy ticket to dreamland.
SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS.EFFECT: Helps Duplicants fall asleep by reducing <link=\"HEALTH\">Stamina</link>.\n\nEnables the wearer to dream and produce Dream Journals.
SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS.NAME: <link=\"SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS\">Pajamas</link>

TEMPERATURE_SUIT.DESC: Keeps my Duplicants cool in case things heat up.
TEMPERATURE_SUIT.EFFECT: Provides insulation in regions with extreme <style=\"heat\">Temperatures</style>.\n\nMust be powered at a Thermo Suit Dock when depleted.
TEMPERATURE_SUIT.NAME: <link=\"TEMPERATURESUIT\">Thermo Suit</link>
TEMPERATURE_SUIT.RECIPE_DESC: Provides insulation in regions with extreme <style=\"heat\">Temperatures</style>.
TEMPERATURE_SUIT.WORN_DESC: A worn out <link=\"TEMPERATURESUIT\">Thermo Suit</link>.\n\nSuits can be repaired at a <link=\"CRAFTINGTABLE\">Crafting Station</link>.

WARM_VEST.EFFECT: Protects the wearer from <style=\"heat\">Cold</style> by increasing insulation.
WARM_VEST.NAME: <link=\"WARMVEST\">Warm Coat</link>
WARM_VEST.RECIPE_DESC: Protects the wearer from <style=\"heat\">Cold</style> by increasing insulation

BONUSALGAE.DESCRIPTION: {dupe}'s recent proximity to an Algae Terrarium has left them feeling refreshed and exuberant and is correlated to an increase in their physical attributes. It is unclear whether these physical improvements came from the excess of oxygen or the invigorating smell of algae.\n\nIt's curious that I find myself nostalgic for the smell of algae growing in a lab. But how could this be...?
BONUSALGAE.NAME: Fresh Algae Smell

BONUSBUILDER.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} has been hard at work building many structures crucial to the future of the colony. It seems this activity has improved this Duplicant's budding construction and mechanical skills beyond what my models predicted.\n\nWhether this increase in ability is due to them learning new skills or simply gaining self-confidence I cannot say, but this unexpected development is a welcome surprise development.
BONUSBUILDER.NAME: Accomplished Builder

BONUSDIGGING1.DESCRIPTION:
Some interesting data has revealed that {dupe} has had a marked increase in physical abilities, an increase that cannot entirely be attributed to the usual improvements that occur after regular physical activity.

Based on previous observations this Duplicant's positive associations with digging appear to account for this additional physical boost.

This would mean the personal preferences of my Duplicants are directly correlated to how hard they work. How interesting...
BONUSDIGGING1.NAME: Hot Diggity!

BONUSDOOR.DESCRIPTION: The act of closing a door has apparently lead to a decrease in the <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> levels of {dupe}, as well as decreased the exposure of this Duplicant to harmful <link=\"GERMS\">Germs</link>.\n\nWhile it may be more efficient to group all my Duplicants together in common sleeping quarters, it's important to remember the mental benefits to privacy and space to express their individuality.
BONUSDOOR.NAME: Open and Shut

BONUSDREAM1.CHAIN_TOOLTIP: Improving the living conditions of {dupe} will lead to more good dreams.
BONUSDREAM1.DESCRIPTION: I've observed many improvements to {dupe}'s demeanor today. Analysis indicates unusually high amounts of dopamine in their system. There's a good chance this is due to an exceptionally good dream and analysis indicates that current sleeping conditions may have contributed to this occurrence.\n\nFurther improvements to sleeping conditions may have additional positive effects to the <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> of {dupe} and other Duplicants.
BONUSDREAM1.NAME: Good Dream

BONUSDREAM2.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} had another really good dream and the resulting release of dopamine has made this Duplicant energetic and full of possibilities! This is an encouraging byproduct of improving the living conditions of the colony.\n\nBased on these observations, building a better sleeping area for my Duplicants will have a similar effect on their <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.
BONUSDREAM2.NAME: Really Good Dream

BONUSDREAM3.DESCRIPTION: I have detected a distinct spring in {dupe}'s step today. There is a good chance that this Duplicant had another great dream last night. Such incidents are further indications that working on the care and comfort of the colony is not a waste of time.\n\nI do wonder though: What do Duplicants dream of?
BONUSDREAM3.NAME: Great Dream

BONUSDREAM4.DESCRIPTION: {dupe}'s dream last night must have been simply amazing! Their dopamine levels are at an all time high. Based on these results, it can be safely assumed that improving the living conditions of my Duplicants will reduce <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> and have similar positive effects on their well-being.\n\nObservations such as this are an integral and enjoyable part of science. When I see my Duplicants happy, I can't help but share in some of their joy.
BONUSDREAM4.NAME: Amazing Dream

BONUSGENERATOR.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} ran in a Manual Generator and the physical activity appears to have given this Duplicant increased strength and sense of well-being.\n\nWhile not the primary reason for building Manual Generators, I am very pleased to see my Duplicants reaping the <link=\"STRESS\">Stress</link> relieving benefits to physical activity.
BONUSGENERATOR.NAME: Exercised

BONUSHITTHEBOOKS.DESCRIPTION: {dupe}'s recent Research errand has resulted in a significant increase to this Duplicant's brain activity. The discovery of newly found knowledge has given {dupe} an invigorating jolt of excitement.\n\nI am all too familiar with this feeling.
BONUSHITTHEBOOKS.NAME: Hit the Books

BONUSLITWORKSPACE.DESCRIPTION: {dupe}'s recent time in a well-lit area has greatly improved this Duplicant's ability to work with, and on, machinery.\n\nThis supports the prevailing theory that a well-lit workspace has many benefits beyond just improving my Duplicant's ability to see.
BONUSLITWORKSPACE.NAME: Lit-erally Great

BONUSOXYGEN.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} is experiencing a sudden unexpected improvement to their physical prowess which appears to be a result of exposure to elevated levels of oxygen from passing by an Oxygen Diffuser.\n\nObservations such as this are important in documenting just how beneficial having access to oxygen is to my colony.
BONUSOXYGEN.NAME: Fresh Air

BONUSRESEARCH.DESCRIPTION: Analysis indicates that the appearance of a <style=\"KKeyword\">Research Station</style> has inspired {dupe} and heightened their brain activity on a cellular level.\n\nBrain stimulation is important if my Duplicants are going to adapt and innovate in their increasingly harsh environment.
BONUSRESEARCH.NAME: Inspired Learner

BONUSSTORAGE.DESCRIPTION: Data indicates that {dupe}'s activity in storing something in a Storage Bin has led to an increase in this Duplicant's physical strength as well as an overall improvement to their general demeanor.\n\nThere have been many studies connecting organization with an increase in well-being. It is possible this explains {dupe}'s <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> improvements.
BONUSSTORAGE.NAME: Something in Store

BONUSTALKER.DESCRIPTION: {dupe}'s recent conversation with another Duplicant shows a correlation to improved serotonin and <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> levels in this Duplicant. It is very possible that small talk with a co-worker, however short and seemingly insignificant, will make my Duplicant's feel connected to the colony as a whole.\n\nAs the colony gets bigger and more sophisticated, I must ensure that the opportunity for such connections continue, for the good of my Duplicants' mental well being.
BONUSTALKER.NAME: Big Small Talker

BONUSTOILET1.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} recently visited an Outhouse and appears to have appreciated the small comforts based on the marked increase to their <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nHigh <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> has been linked to a better work ethic and greater enthusiasm for complex jobs, which are essential in building a successful new colony.
BONUSTOILET1.NAME: Small Comforts

BONUSTOILET2.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} used a Lavatory and analysis shows a decided improvement to this Duplicant's <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nAs my colony grows and expands, it's important not to ignore the benefits of giving my Duplicants a pleasant place to relieve themselves.
BONUSTOILET2.NAME: Greater Comforts

BONUSTOILET3.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} visited a Latrine and experienced luxury unlike they anything this Duplicant had previously experienced as analysis has revealed yet another boost to their <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>.\n\nIt is unclear whether this development is a result of increased hygiene or whether there is something else inherently about working plumbing which would improve <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> in this way. Further analysis is needed.
BONUSTOILET3.NAME: Small Luxury

BONUSTOILET4.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} visited a Washroom and the experience has left this Duplicant with significantly improved <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>. Analysis indicates this improvement should continue for many cycles.\n\nThe relationship of my Duplicants and their surroundings is an interesting aspect of colony life. I should continue to watch future developments in this department closely.
BONUSTOILET4.NAME: Greater Luxury

GAMEPLAY_EVENTS.CHAIN_EVENT_TOOLTIP: This event is a chain event

ARTIFACT_REVEAL.DESCRIPTION: An artifact from a past civilization was analyzed.\n\n{desc}
ARTIFACT_REVEAL.NAME: New Event: Artifact Analyzed

CREATURE_SPAWN.DESCRIPTION: There was a massive influx of destructive critters
CREATURE_SPAWN.NAME: Critter Infestation

CRYOFRIEND.DESCRIPTION: {dupe} has made an amazing discovery! A barely working <link=\"CRYOTANK\">Cryotank 3000</link> has been uncovered containing a {friend} inside in a frozen state.\n\n{dupe} was successful in thawing {friend} and this encounter has filled both Duplicants with a sense of hope, something they will desperately need to keep their <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link> up when facing the dangers ahead.
CRYOFRIEND.NAME: New Event: A Frozen Friend

ECLIPSE.DESCRIPTION: A celestial object has obscured the sunlight
ECLIPSE.NAME: Eclipse

FOOD_FIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Duplicants will throw food at each other for recreation\n\nIt may be wasteful, but everyone who participates will benefit from a major stress reduction.
FOOD_FIGHT.NAME: Food Fight
FOOD_FIGHT.UNDERWAY_TOOLTIP: There is a food fight happening now

PARTY.ACCEPT_OPTION_INVALID_TOOLTIP: A cake must be built for this event to take place.
PARTY.CANCELED_NO_ROOM_DESCRIPTION: The party was canceled because no Recreation Room was available.
PARTY.DESCRIPTION:
THIS EVENT IS NOT WORKING
{host} is throwing a birthday party for {dupe}. Make sure there is an available Recreation Room for the party.

Social events are good for Duplicant morale. Rejecting this party will hurt {host} and {dupe}'s fragile ego.
PARTY.NAME: Party

PLANT_BLIGHT.DESCRIPTION: Our {plant} crops have been afflicted by a fungal sickness!\n\nI must get the Duplicants to uproot and compost the sick plants to save our farms.
PLANT_BLIGHT.NAME: Plant Blight: {plant}
PLANT_BLIGHT.SUCCESS_TOOLTIP: All the blighted {plant} plants have been dealt with, halting the infection.

SATELLITE_CRASH.DESCRIPTION: Mysterious space junk has crashed into the surface.\n\nIt may contain useful resources or information, but it may also be dangerous. Approach with caution.
SATELLITE_CRASH.NAME: Satellite Crash

SOLAR_FLARE.DESCRIPTION: A solar flare is headed this way
SOLAR_FLARE.NAME: Solar Storm

WARPWORLDREVEAL.DESCRIPTION:
I've discovered a functioning teleportation device with a pre-programmed destination.

It appears to go to another Planetoid, and I'm fairly certain there's a return device on the other end.

I could send a Duplicant through safely if I desired.
WARPWORLDREVEAL.NAME: New Event: Personnel Teleporter

DEBUG.DEBUGDUMPSCENEPARITIONERLEAKDATA: Debug Dump Scene Paritioner Leak Data
DEBUG.DEBUGSPAWNMINIONATMOSUIT: Debug Spawn Minion with Atmo Suit
DEBUG.NAME: Debug

BOOSTER_ART1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant flawless decorating skills.
BOOSTER_ART1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERART1\">Masterworks Art Booster</link>

BOOSTER_CARRY1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant increased carrying capacity and athletic prowess.
BOOSTER_CARRY1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERCARRY1\">Strength Booster</link>

BOOSTER_CONSTRUCT1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the ability to build fast, and demolish buildings that others cannot.
BOOSTER_CONSTRUCT1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERCONSTRUCT1\">Construction Booster</link>

BOOSTER_COOK1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant deliciously professional culinary skills.
BOOSTER_COOK1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERCOOK1\">Grilling Booster</link>

BOOSTER_DIG1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skill required to dig hard things.
BOOSTER_DIG1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERDIG1\">Digging Booster</link>

BOOSTER_DIG2.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the digging skill required to get through anything.
BOOSTER_DIG2.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERDIG2\">Extreme Digging Booster</link>

BOOSTER_FARM1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant unparalleled farming and botanical analysis skills.
BOOSTER_FARM1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERFARM1\">Crop Tending Booster</link>

BOOSTER_MEDICINE1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the ability to perform all doctoring errands.
BOOSTER_MEDICINE1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERMEDICINE1\">Advanced Medical Booster</link>

BOOSTER_OP1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skills requried to tinker and solder to their heart's content.
BOOSTER_OP1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTEROP1\">Electrical Engineering Booster</link>

BOOSTER_OP2.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant complete mastery of engineering skills.
BOOSTER_OP2.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTEROP2\">Mechatronics Engineering Booster</link>

BOOSTER_PILOT1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to explore the skies in person.
BOOSTER_PILOT1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERPILOT1\">Piloting Booster</link>

BOOSTER_PILOTVANILLA1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to command a rocket.
BOOSTER_PILOTVANILLA1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERPILOTVANILLA1\">Rocketry Booster</link>

BOOSTER_RANCH1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the skills required to care for <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link> in every way.
BOOSTER_RANCH1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERRANCH1\">Ranching Booster</link>

BOOSTER_RESEARCH1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the expertise required to study <link=\"GEYSERS\">geysers</link> and other advanced topics.
BOOSTER_RESEARCH1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERRESEARCH1\">Researching Booster</link>

BOOSTER_RESEARCH2.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant a keen grasp of science and usage of space-research buildings.
BOOSTER_RESEARCH2.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERRESEARCH2\">Astronomy Booster</link>

BOOSTER_RESEARCH3.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant a deeply pragmatic approach to scientific research.
BOOSTER_RESEARCH3.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERRESEARCH3\">Applied Sciences Booster</link>

BOOSTER_SUITS1.DESC: Enables a Bionic Duplicant to maximize durability of equipped <link=\"EQUIPMENT\">Exosuits</link> and maintain their runspeed.
BOOSTER_SUITS1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERSUITS1\">Suit Training Booster</link>

BOOSTER_TIDY1.DESC: Grants a Bionic Duplicant the full range of tidying skills, including blasting unwanted meteors out of the sky.
BOOSTER_TIDY1.NAME: <link=\"BOOSTERTIDY1\">Tidying Booster</link>

BIONIC_BOOSTERS.FABRICATION_SOURCE: This booster can be manufactured at the {0}.

CARGO_CAPSULE.DESC: A delivery system for recently printed resources.\n\nIt will dematerialize shortly.
CARGO_CAPSULE.NAME: Care Package

DEBRISPAYLOAD.DESC: Whatever is left over from a Rocket Self-Destruct can be recovered once it has crash-landed.
DEBRISPAYLOAD.NAME: Rocket Debris

DEHYDRATEDFOODPACKAGE.DESC: A package of non-perishable dehydrated food.\n\nIt requires no refrigeration, but must be rehydrated before consumption.
DEHYDRATEDFOODPACKAGE.NAME: Dry Ration

DREAMJOURNAL.DESC: A hand-scrawled account of <link=\"SLEEPCLINICPAJAMAS\">Pajama</link>-induced dreams.\n\nCan be analyzed using a <link=\"MEGABRAINTANK\">Somnium Synthesizer</link>.
DREAMJOURNAL.NAME: <link=\"STORYTRAITMEGABRAINTANK\">Dream Journal</link>

BASICFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit with an upsettingly bland aftertaste.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link="BASICFORAGEPLANT">Muckroot</link>.
BASICFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"BASICFORAGEPLANT\">Muckroot</link>

BASICPLANTBAR.DESC: <link=\"BASICPLANTFOOD\">Meal Lice</link> compacted into a dense, immobile loaf.
BASICPLANTBAR.NAME: <link=\"BASICPLANTBAR\">Liceloaf</link>
BASICPLANTBAR.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"BASICPLANTFOOD\">Meal Lice</link> compacted into a dense, immobile loaf.

BASICPLANTFOOD.DESC: A flavorless grain that almost never wiggles on its own.
BASICPLANTFOOD.NAME: <link=\"BASICPLANTFOOD\">Meal Lice</link>

BEAN.DESC: The crisp bean of a <link=\"BEANPLANT\">Nosh Sprout</link>.\n\nEach bite tastes refreshingly natural and wholesome.
BEAN.NAME: <link=\"BEAN\">Nosh Bean</link>

BEANPLANTSEED.DESC: An inedible bean that can be processed into delicious foods.
BEANPLANTSEED.NAME: <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Bean</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"BERRYPIE\">Mixed Berry Pie</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"BERRYPIE\">Dried Berry Pie</link>

BERRYPIE.DESC: A pie made primarily of <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link> and <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Gristle Berries</link>.\n\nThe mixture of berries creates a fragrant, colorful filling that packs a sweet punch.
BERRYPIE.NAME: <link=\"BERRYPIE\">Mixed Berry Pie</link>
BERRYPIE.RECIPEDESC: A pie made primarily of <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link> and <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Gristle Berries</link>.

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"BURGER\">Frost Burger</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"BURGER\">Dried Frost Burger</link>

BURGER.DESC: <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link> and <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link> on a chilled <link=\"COLDWHEATBREAD\">Frost Bun</link>.\n\nIt's the only burger best served cold.
BURGER.NAME: <link=\"BURGER\">Frost Burger</link>

BUTTERFLYFOOD.DESC: A lightly toasted <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED\">Mimillet</link>.\n\nIt makes the tummy feel a bit fluttery.
BUTTERFLYFOOD.NAME: <link=\"BUTTERFLYFOOD\">Toasted Mimillet</link>

BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.DESC:
An inedible seed from a <link="BUTTERFLYPLANT">Mimika Bud</link>.

It can be sown to cultivate more plants, or processed into <link="FOOD">Food</link>.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a Mimillet Seed.
BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED.NAME: <link=\"BUTTERFLYPLANTSEED\">Mimillet</link>

CARROT.DESC: An edible tuber with an earthy, elegant flavor.
CARROT.NAME: <link=\"CARROT\">Plume Squash</link>

COLDWHEATBREAD.DESC: A simple bun baked from <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.\n\nEach bite leaves a mild cooling sensation in one's mouth, even when the bun itself is warm.
COLDWHEATBREAD.NAME: <link=\"COLDWHEATBREAD\">Frost Bun</link>
COLDWHEATBREAD.RECIPEDESC: A simple bun baked from <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.

COLDWHEATSEED.DESC: An edible grain that leaves a cool taste on the tongue.
COLDWHEATSEED.NAME: <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>

COOKEDEGG.DESC: Fluffed and folded Egg innards.\n\nIt turns out you do, in fact, have to break a few eggs to make it.
COOKEDEGG.NAME: <link=\"COOKEDEGG\">Omelette</link>

COOKEDFISH.DESC: A cooked piece of freshly caught aquatic critter.\n\nUnsurprisingly, it tastes a bit fishy.
COOKEDFISH.NAME: <link=\"COOKEDFISH\">Cooked Seafood</link>
COOKEDFISH.RECIPEDESC: A cooked piece of freshly caught aquatic critter.

COOKEDMEAT.DESC: The cooked meat of a defeated critter.\n\nIt has a delightful smoky aftertaste.
COOKEDMEAT.NAME: <link=\"COOKEDMEAT\">Barbeque</link>
COOKEDMEAT.RECIPEDESC: The cooked meat of a defeated critter.

COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.DESC: Grilling a <link=\"HARDSKINBERRY\">Pikeapple</link> softens its spikes, making it slighly less awkward to eat.\n\nIt does not diminish the smell.
COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.NAME: <link=\"COOKEDPIKEAPPLE\">Pikeapple Skewer</link>
COOKEDPIKEAPPLE.RECIPEDESC: A grilled dish made with a fruiting <link=\"HARDSKINBERRY\">Pikeapple</link>.

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"CURRY\">Curried Beans</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"CURRY\">Dried Curried Beans</link>

CURRY.DESC: Chewy <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link> simmered with chunks of <link=\"GINGERCONFIG\">Tonic Root</link>.\n\nIt's so spicy!
CURRY.NAME: <link=\"CURRY\">Curried Beans</link>
CURRY.RECIPEDESC: Chewy <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link> simmered with chunks of <link=\"GINGERCONFIG\">Tonic Root</link>.

DEEPFRIEDFISH.DESC: Deep-fried fish cradled in a crunchy fin.
DEEPFRIEDFISH.NAME: <link=\"DEEPFRIEDFISH\">Fish Taco</link>
DEEPFRIEDFISH.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"FISHMEAT\">Pacu Fillet</link> lightly battered and deep-fried in <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link>.

DEEPFRIEDMEAT.DESC: A juicy slab of meat with a crunchy deep-fried upper layer.
DEEPFRIEDMEAT.NAME: <link=\"DEEPFRIEDMEAT\">Deep Fried Steak</link>
DEEPFRIEDMEAT.RECIPEDESC: A juicy slab of <link=\"MEAT\">Raw Meat</link> deep-fried in <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link>.

DEEPFRIEDNOSH.DESC: A snackable handful of crunchy beans.
DEEPFRIEDNOSH.NAME: <link=\"DEEPFRIEDNOSH\">Nosh Noms</link>
DEEPFRIEDNOSH.RECIPEDESC: A crunchy stack of <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link> deep-fried in <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link>.

DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH.NAME: <link=\"DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH\">Shellfish Tempura</link>
DEEPFRIEDSHELLFISH.RECIPEDESC: A tender chunk of battered <link=\"SHELLFISHMEAT\">Raw Shellfish</link> deep-fried in <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link>.

DINOSAURMEAT.DESC: Uncooked meat from a very dead critter.\n\nIt's inedible until cooked in the <link=\"SMOKER\">Smoker</link>.
DINOSAURMEAT.NAME: <link=\"DINOSAURMEAT\">Tough Meat</link>

DRECKOEGG.DESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecko</link>.\n\nIf incubated, it will hatch into a new <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecklet</link>.
DRECKOEGG.NAME: <link=\"DRECKO\">Drecko Egg</link>

FERNFOOD.DESC: An ancient grain that can be processed into <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
FERNFOOD.NAME: <link=\"FERNFOOD\">Megafrond Grain</link>

FIELDRATION.DESC: A nourishing nutrient paste, sandwiched between thin wafer layers.
FIELDRATION.NAME: <link=\"FIELDRATION\">Nutrient Bar</link>

FISHMEAT.DESC: An uncooked fillet from a very dead <link=\"PACU\">Pacu</link>. Yum!
FISHMEAT.NAME: <link=\"FISHMEAT\">Pacu Fillet</link>

FOODSPLAT.DESC: Food smeared on the wall from a recent Food Fight
FOODSPLAT.NAME: Food Splatter

FORESTFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit with an unusual rubbery texture.

It cannot be replanted.

Hexalent fruit is much more calorie dense than Muckroot fruit.
FORESTFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"FORESTFORAGEPLANT\">Hexalent Fruit</link>

FRIEDMUSHBAR.DESC: Pan-fried, solidified mudslop.\n\nThe inside is almost completely uncooked, despite the crunch on the outside.
FRIEDMUSHBAR.NAME: <link=\"FRIEDMUSHBAR\">Mush Fry</link>

FRIEDMUSHROOM.DESC: A pan-fried dish made with a fruiting <link=\"MUSHROOM\">Dusk Cap</link>.\n\nIt has a thick, savory flavor with subtle earthy undertones.
FRIEDMUSHROOM.NAME: <link=\"FRIEDMUSHROOM\">Fried Mushroom</link>
FRIEDMUSHROOM.RECIPEDESC: A pan-fried dish made with a fruiting <link=\"MUSHROOM\">Dusk Cap</link>.

FRIESCARROT.NAME: <link=\"FRIESCARROT\">Squash Fries</link>
FRIESCARROT.RECIPEDESC: Crunchy sticks of <link=\"CARROT\">Plume Squash</link> deep-fried in <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link>.

FRUITCAKE.DESC: A mashed up <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link> sludge with an exceptionally long shelf life.\n\nIts aggressive, overbearing sweetness can leave the tongue feeling temporarily numb.
FRUITCAKE.NAME: <link=\"FRUITCAKE\">Berry Sludge</link>
FRUITCAKE.RECIPEDESC: A mashed up <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link> sludge with an exceptionally long shelf life.

GAMMAMUSH.DESC: A disturbingly delicious mixture of irradiated dirt and water.
GAMMAMUSH.NAME: <link=\"GAMMAMUSH\">Gamma Mush</link>
GAMMAMUSH.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"FRIEDMUSHBAR\">Mush Fry</link> reheated in a <link=\"GAMMARAYOVEN\">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.

GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD.DESC: The sugary vegetable produced by <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANT\">Sweatcorn Stalks</link>.\n\nIt tastes a lot better deep-fried.
GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD.NAME: <link=\"GARDENFOODPLANTFOOD\">Sweatcorn</link>

GARDENFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit that loses its flavor long before it is fully chewed.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANT">Snac Fruit</link>.
GARDENFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"GARDENFORAGEPLANT\">Snac Fruit</link>

GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.DESC: The grilled bud of a <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link>.\n\nHeat unlocked an exquisite taste in the fruit, though the burnt spines leave something to be desired.
GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT\">Gristle Berry</link>
GRILLEDPRICKLEFRUIT.RECIPEDESC: The grilled bud of a <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link>.

HARDSKINBERRY.DESC: An edible fruit encased in a thorny husk.
HARDSKINBERRY.NAME: <link=\"HARDSKINBERRY\">Pikeapple</link>

HATCHEGG.DESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"HATCH\">Hatch</link>.\n\nIf incubated, it will hatch into a <link=\"HATCH\">Hatchling</link>.
HATCHEGG.NAME: <link=\"HATCH\">Hatch Egg</link>

ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT.DESC: A cold seedless fruit that triggers mild brain freeze.\n\nIt cannot be replanted.
ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"ICECAVESFORAGEPLANT\">Sherberry</link>

LETTUCE.DESC: Crunchy, slightly salty leaves from a <link=\"SEALETTUCE\">Waterweed</link> plant.
LETTUCE.NAME: <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link>

LIGHTBUGEGG.DESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Bug</link>.\n\nIf incubated, it will hatch into a <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Nymph</link>.
LIGHTBUGEGG.NAME: <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Bug Egg</link>
LIGHTBUGEGG.RECIPEDESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"LIGHTBUG\">Shine Bug</link>.

MEAT.DESC: Uncooked meat from a very dead critter. Yum!
MEAT.NAME: <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link>

MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.DESC: <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link> scrumptiously wilted in the <link=\"GAMMARAYOVEN\">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.
MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.NAME: <link=\"MICROWAVEDLETTUCE\">Microwaved Lettuce</link>
MICROWAVEDLETTUCE.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link> scrumptiously wilted in the <link=\"GAMMARAYOVEN\">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.

MUSHBAR.DESC: An edible, putrefied mudslop.\n\nMush Bars are preferable to starvation, but only just barely.
MUSHBAR.NAME: <link=\"MUSHBAR\">Mush Bar</link>
MUSHBAR.RECIPEDESC: An edible, putrefied mudslop.\n\n<link=\"MUSHBAR\">Mush Bar</link>s are preferable to starvation, but only just barely.

MUSHROOM.DESC: An edible, flavorless fungus that grew in the dark.
MUSHROOM.NAME: <link=\"MUSHROOM\">Mushroom</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"MUSHROOMWRAP\">Mushroom Wrap</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"MUSHROOMWRAP\">Dried Mushroom Wrap</link>

MUSHROOMWRAP.DESC: Flavorful <link=\"MUSHROOM\">Mushrooms</link> wrapped in <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link>.\n\nIt has an earthy flavor punctuated by a refreshing crunch.
MUSHROOMWRAP.NAME: <link=\"MUSHROOMWRAP\">Mushroom Wrap</link>

OILFLOATEREGG.DESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster</link>.\n\nIf incubated, it will hatch into a <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster Larva</link>.
OILFLOATEREGG.NAME: <link=\"OILFLOATER\">Slickster Egg</link>

PANCAKES.DESC: Sweet discs made from <link=\"RAWEGG\">Raw Egg</link> and <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.\n\nThey're so thick!
PANCAKES.NAME: <link=\"PANCAKES\">Soufflé Pancakes</link>
PANCAKES.RECIPEDESC: Sweet discs made from <link=\"RAWEGG\">Raw Egg</link> and <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link>.

PASTA.DESC: pasta made from egg and wheat
PASTA.NAME: <link=\"PASTA\">Pasta</link>
PASTA.RECIPEDESC: pasta made from egg and wheat

PEMMICAN.DESC: <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link> and <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link> pounded into a calorie-dense brick with an exceptionally long shelf life.\n\nSurvival never tasted so good.
PEMMICAN.NAME: <link=\"PEMMICAN\">Pemmican</link>
PEMMICAN.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link> and <link=\"TALLOW\">Tallow</link> pounded into a nutrient-dense brick with an exceptionally long shelf life.

PICKLEDMEAL.DESC: Meal Lice preserved in vinegar.\n\nIt's a rarely acquired taste.
PICKLEDMEAL.NAME: <link=\"PICKLEDMEAL\">Pickled Meal</link>

PLANTMEAT.DESC: Planty plant meat from a plant. How nice!
PLANTMEAT.NAME: <link=\"PLANTMEAT\">Plant Meat</link>

POPCORN.DESC: <link=\"COLDWHEATSEED\">Sleet Wheat Grain</link> popped in a <link=\"GAMMARAYOVEN\">Gamma Ray Oven</link>.\n\nCompletely devoid of any fancy flavorings.
POPCORN.NAME: <link=\"POPCORN\">Popcorn</link>

PREHISTORICPACUFILLET.DESC: An uncooked fillet from a very dead <link=\"PREHISTORICPACU\">Jawbo</link>. It has a silky texture.
PREHISTORICPACUFILLET.NAME: <link=\"PREHISTORICPACUFILLET\">Jawbo Fillet</link>

PRICKLEFRUIT.DESC: A sweet, mostly pleasant-tasting fruit covered in prickly barbs.
PRICKLEFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link>

PUFTEGG.DESC: An egg laid by a <link=\"PUFT\">Puft</link>.\n\nIf incubated, it will hatch into a <link=\"PUFT\">Puftlet</link>.
PUFTEGG.NAME: <link=\"PUFT\">Puft Egg</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"QUICHE\">Mushroom Quiche</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"QUICHE\">Dried Mushroom Quiche</link>

QUICHE.DESC: Omelette, Fried Mushroom and Lettuce piled onto a yummy crust.\n\nSomehow, it's both soggy and crispy.
QUICHE.NAME: <link=\"QUICHE\">Mushroom Quiche</link>
QUICHE.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"COOKEDEGG\">Omelette</link>, <link=\"FRIEDMUSHROOM\">Fried Mushroom</link> and <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link> piled onto a yummy crust.

RAWEGG.DESC: A raw Egg that has been cracked open for use in <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> preparation.\n\nIt will never hatch.
RAWEGG.NAME: <link=\"RAWEGG\">Raw Egg</link>
RAWEGG.RECIPEDESC: A raw egg that has been cracked open for use in <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> preparation.

ROTPILE.DESC: An inedible glop of former foodstuff.\n\n<link=\"COMPOST\">Rot Pile</link>s break down into <link=\"TOXICSAND\">Polluted Dirt</link> over time.
ROTPILE.NAME: <link=\"COMPOST\">Rot Pile</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"SALSA\">Stuffed Berry</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"SALSA\">Dried Stuffed Berry</link>

SALSA.DESC: A baked <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link> stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.
SALSA.NAME: <link=\"SALSA\">Stuffed Berry</link>
SALSA.RECIPEDESC: A baked <link=\"PRICKLEFRUIT\">Bristle Berry</link> stuffed with delectable spices and vibrantly flavored.

SHELLFISHMEAT.DESC: An uncooked chunk of very dead <link=\"CRABFRESHWATER\">Sanishell</link>. Yum!
SHELLFISHMEAT.NAME: <link=\"SHELLFISHMEAT\">Raw Shellfish</link>

SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.DESC: A cooked stack of tough meat that's been marinated and slow-smoked to tender perfection.
SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.NAME: <link=\"SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT\">Tender Brisket</link>
SMOKEDDINOSAURMEAT.RECIPEDESC: A stack of tender, slow-smoked meat.

SMOKEDFISH.DESC: A buttery smoked fish fillet.\n\nIt flakes nicely when pulled apart with a fork.
SMOKEDFISH.NAME: <link=\"SMOKEDFISH\">Smoked Fish</link>

SMOKEDVEGETABLES.DESC: Crisp vegetables stuffed with herbs and smoked for hours.
SMOKEDVEGETABLES.NAME: <link=\"SMOKEDVEGETABLES\">Veggie Poppers</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"SPICEBREAD\">Pepper Bread</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"SPICEBREAD\">Dried Pepper Bread</link>

SPICEBREAD.DESC: A loaf of bread, lightly spiced with <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link> for a mild bite.\n\nThere's a simple joy to be had in pulling it apart in one's fingers.
SPICEBREAD.NAME: <link=\"SPICEBREAD\">Pepper Bread</link>
SPICEBREAD.RECIPEDESC: A loaf of bread, lightly spiced with <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link> for a mild bite.

SPICENUT.DESC: The flavorful nut of a <link=\"SPICEVINE\">Pincha Pepperplant</link>.\n\nThe bitter outer rind hides a rich, peppery core that is useful in cooking.
SPICENUT.NAME: <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link>

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"SPICYTOFU\">Spicy Tofu</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"SPICYTOFU\">Dried Spicy Tofu</link>

SPICYTOFU.DESC: <link=\"TOFU\">Tofu</link> marinated in a flavorful <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link> sauce.\n\nIt packs a delightful punch.
SPICYTOFU.NAME: <link=\"SPICYTOFU\">Spicy Tofu</link>
SPICYTOFU.RECIPEDESC: <link=\"TOFU\">Tofu</link> marinated in a flavorful <link=\"SPICENUT\">Pincha Peppernut</link> sauce.

DEHYDRATED.DESC: A dehydrated <link=\"SURFANDTURF\">Surf'n'Turf</link> ration. It must be rehydrated in order to be considered <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.\n\nDry rations have no expiry date.
DEHYDRATED.NAME: <link=\"SURFANDTURF\">Dried Surf'n'Turf</link>

SURFANDTURF.DESC: A bit of <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link> from the land and <link=\"COOKEDFISH\">Cooked Seafood</link> from the sea.\n\nIt's hearty and satisfying.
SURFANDTURF.NAME: <link=\"SURFANDTURF\">Surf'n'Turf</link>
SURFANDTURF.RECIPEDESC: A bit of <link=\"MEAT\">Meat</link> from the land and <link=\"COOKEDFISH\">Cooked Seafood</link> from the sea.

SUSHI.DESC: Raw <link=\"FISHMEAT\">Pacu Fillet</link> wrapped with fresh <link=\"LETTUCE\">Lettuce</link>.\n\nWhile the salt of the lettuce may initially overpower the flavor, a keen palate can discern the subtle sweetness of the fillet beneath.
SUSHI.NAME: <link=\"SUSHI\">Sushi</link>

SWAMPDELIGHTS.DESC: Dried gelatinous cubes from a <link=\"SWAMPFRUIT\">Bog Jelly</link>.\n\nEach cube has a wonderfully chewy texture and is lightly coated in a delicate powder.
SWAMPDELIGHTS.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPDELIGHTS\">Swampy Delights</link>
SWAMPDELIGHTS.RECIPEDESC: Dried gelatinous cubes from a <link=\"SWAMPFRUIT\">Bog Jelly</link>.

SWAMPFORAGEPLANT.DESC: A seedless plant with a squishy, juicy center and an awful smell.\n\nIt cannot be replanted.
SWAMPFORAGEPLANT.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPFORAGEPLANT\">Swamp Chard Heart</link>

SWAMPFRUIT.DESC: A fruit with an outer film that contains chewy gelatinous cubes.
SWAMPFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPFRUIT\">Bog Jelly</link>

TOFU.DESC: A bland curd made from <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link>.\n\nIt has an unusual but pleasant consistency.
TOFU.NAME: <link=\"TOFU\">Tofu</link>
TOFU.RECIPEDESC: A bland curd made from <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Beans</link>.

VINEFRUIT.DESC: The fruit from an <link=\"VINEMOTHER\">Ovagro Vine</link>.\n\nIt's fun to squeeze as many as possible into a single mouthful.
VINEFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"VINEFRUIT\">Ovagro Fig</link>

WORMBASICFOOD.DESC: Slow roasted <link=\"WORMBASICFRUIT\">Spindly Grubfruit</link>.\n\nIt has a smoky aroma and tastes of coziness.
WORMBASICFOOD.NAME: <link=\"WORMBASICFOOD\">Roast Grubfruit Nut</link>

WORMBASICFRUIT.DESC: A <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link> that failed to develop properly.\n\nIt is nonetheless edible, and vaguely tasty.
WORMBASICFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"WORMBASICFRUIT\">Spindly Grubfruit</link>

WORMSUPERFOOD.DESC: A long lasting <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link> jam preserved in <link=\"SUCROSE\">Sucrose</link>.\n\nThe thick, goopy jam retains the shape of the jar when poured out, but the sweet taste can't be matched.
WORMSUPERFOOD.NAME: <link=\"WORMSUPERFOOD\">Grubfruit Preserve</link>
WORMSUPERFOOD.RECIPEDESC: A long lasting <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link> jam preserved in <link=\"SUCROSE\">Sucrose</link>.

WORMSUPERFRUIT.DESC: A plump, healthy fruit with a honey-like taste.
WORMSUPERFRUIT.NAME: <link=\"WORMSUPERFRUIT\">Grubfruit</link>

BASIC_FABRIC.DESC: A ball of raw cellulose used in the production of <link=\"EQUIPMENT\">Clothing</link> and textiles.
BASIC_FABRIC.NAME: <link=\"BASICFABRIC\">Reed Fiber</link>

DEWDRIP.DESC: A crystallized blob of <link=\"MILK\">Brackene</link> from the <link=\"DEWDRIPPERPLANT\">Dew Dripper</link>.
DEWDRIP.NAME: <link=\"DEWDRIP\">Dewdrip</link>

ELECTROBANK.DESC:
A rechargeable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Eco Power Banks</link> at the <link="ADVANCEDCRAFTINGTABLE">Soldering Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ELECTROBANK.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Eco Power Bank</link>

ELECTROBANK_EMPTY.DESC: A depleted <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Power Bank</link>.\n\nIt must be recharged at a <link=\"ELECTROBANKCHARGER\">Power Bank Charger</link> before it can be reused.
ELECTROBANK_EMPTY.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Empty Eco Power Bank</link>

ELECTROBANK_GARBAGE.DESC: A <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Power Bank</link> that has reached the end of its lifetime.\n\nIt can be salvaged for <link=\"KATAIRITE\">Abyssalite</link> at the <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Rock Crusher</link>.
ELECTROBANK_GARBAGE.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Power Bank Scrap</link>

ELECTROBANK_METAL_ORE.DESC:
A disposable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="METAL">Metal Ore</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Metal Power Banks</link> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ELECTROBANK_METAL_ORE.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANKMETALORE\">Metal Power Bank</link>

ELECTROBANK_SELFCHARGING.DESC:
A self-charging <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Its low <link="POWER">wattage</link> and high <link="RADIATION">Radioactivity</link> make it unsuitable for Bionic Duplicant use.
ELECTROBANK_SELFCHARGING.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANKSELFCHARGING\">Atomic Power Bank</link>

ELECTROBANK_URANIUM_ORE.DESC:
A disposable <link="ELECTROBANK">Power Bank</link> made with <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link>.

It can power buildings via <link="LARGEELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Large Dischargers</link> or <link="SMALLELECTROBANKDISCHARGER">Compact Dischargers</link>.

Duplicants can produce new <link="ELECTROBANK">Uranium Ore Power Banks</link> at the <link="CRAFTINGTABLE">Crafting Station</link>.

Must be kept dry.
ELECTROBANK_URANIUM_ORE.NAME: <link=\"ELECTROBANKURANIUMORE\">Uranium Ore Power Bank</link>

FARM_STATION_TOOLS.DESC: Specialized <link=\"FERTILIZER\">Fertilizer</link> mixed by a Duplicant with the <link=\"FARMING2\">Crop Tending</link> Skill.\n\nIncreases the <style=\"KKeyword\">Growth Rate</style> of one <link=\"PLANTS\">Plant</link>.
FARM_STATION_TOOLS.NAME: <link=\"FARMSTATIONTOOLS\">Micronutrient Fertilizer</link>

FEATHER_FABRIC.DESC: A stalk of raw keratin used in the production of <link=\"EQUIPMENT\">Clothing</link> and textiles.
FEATHER_FABRIC.NAME: <link=\"FEATHERFABRIC\">Feather Fiber</link>

FUEL_BRICK.DESC: A densely compressed brick of combustible material.\n\nIt can be burned to produce a one-time burst of <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.
FUEL_BRICK.NAME: Fuel Brick

GENE_SHUFFLER_RECHARGE.DESC: Replenishes one charge to a depleted Neural Vacillator.
GENE_SHUFFLER_RECHARGE.NAME: Vacillator Recharge

GOLD_BELLY_CROWN.DESC: Can be crushed to produce <link=\"GOLDAMALGAM\">Gold Amalgam</link>.
GOLD_BELLY_CROWN.NAME: <link=\"GOLDBELLYCROWN\">Regal Bammoth Crest</link>

ICE_BELLY_POOP.DESC: A little treat left behind by a very large critter.\n\nIt can be crushed to extract <link=\"PHOSPHORITE\">Phosphorite</link> and <link=\"CLAY\">Clay</link>.
ICE_BELLY_POOP.NAME: <link=\"ICEBELLYPOOP\">Bammoth Patty</link>

MACHINE_PARTS.DESC: Specialized Parts crafted by a professional engineer.\n\n<style=\"KKeyword\">Jerry Rig</style> machine buildings to increase their efficiency.
MACHINE_PARTS.NAME: Custom Parts
MACHINE_PARTS.TINKER_EFFECT_TOOLTIP: Can be used to Jerry Rig upgrades to a machine building, increasing its {0} by {1}.
MACHINE_PARTS.TINKER_REQUIREMENT_TOOLTIP: Can only be used by a Duplicant with <link=\"ENGINEERING1\">Mechatronics Engineering</link> to apply a <style=\"KKeyword\">Jerry Rig</style>.

ORBITAL_RESEARCH_DATABANK.DESC: Raw Data that can be processed into <link=\"RESEARCHDLC1\">Data Analysis Research</link> points.
ORBITAL_RESEARCH_DATABANK.NAME: <link=\"DATABANK\">Data Bank</link>
ORBITAL_RESEARCH_DATABANK.RECIPE_DESC: Data Banks of raw data generated from exploring, either by exploring new areas with Duplicants, or by using an <link=\"ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER\">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>.\n\nUsed by the <link=\"DLC1COSMICRESEARCHCENTER\">Virtual Planetarium</link> to conduct research.

PLANT_FIBER.DESC: A bundle of dried plant matter.\n\nIt can be eaten by <link=\"MOOSPECIES\">Moos</link>, or processed into <link=\"POWER\">fuel</link> or <link=\"BUILDINGMATERIALCLASSES\">building materials</link>.
PLANT_FIBER.NAME: <link=\"PLANTFIBER\">Plant Husk</link>

POWER_STATION_TOOLS.DESC:
A specialized <link="POWERSTATIONTOOLS">Microchip</link> created by a professional engineer.

Tunes up <link="REQUIREMENTCLASSGENERATORTYPE">Generators</link> to increase their <link="POWER">Power</link> output.

Also used in the production of <link="BOOSTER">Boosters</link> for Bionic Duplicants.
POWER_STATION_TOOLS.NAME: <link=\"POWERSTATIONTOOLS\">Microchip</link>
POWER_STATION_TOOLS.TINKER_EFFECT_TOOLTIP: Can be used to Tune Up a generator, increasing its {0} by {1}.
POWER_STATION_TOOLS.TINKER_REQUIREMENT_TOOLTIP: Can only be used by a Duplicant with <link=\"TECHNICALS2\">Electrical Engineering</link> to apply a <style=\"KKeyword\">Tune Up</style>.

REFINED_SUGAR.DESC: A seasoning that Duplicants can add to their Food to boost Morale. Duplicants will automatically use Refined Sugar while sitting at a Mess Table during mealtime. Only the finest grains are chosen.
REFINED_SUGAR.NAME: Refined Sugar

RESEARCH_DATABANK.DESC: Raw data that can be processed into <link=\"RESEARCH\">Interstellar Research</link> points.
RESEARCH_DATABANK.NAME: <link=\"DATABANK\">Data Bank</link>

TABLE_SALT.DESC: A seasoning that Duplicants can add to their Food to boost Morale. Duplicants will automatically use Table Salt while sitting at a Mess Table during mealtime. Only the finest grains are chosen.
TABLE_SALT.NAME: <link=\"IDTABLESALT\">Table Salt</link>

TRAP_PARTS.DESC: These components can be assembled into a <link=\"CREATURETRAP\">Critter Trap</link> and used to catch <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link>.
TRAP_PARTS.NAME: Trap Components

WOOD.DESC: Natural resource harvested from certain <link=\"CREATURES\">Critters</link> and <link=\"PLANTS\">Plants</link>.\n\nUsed in construction or <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> production.
WOOD.NAME: <link=\"WOOD\">Wood</link>

GINGER.DESC: A chewy, fibrous rhizome with a fiery aftertaste.
GINGER.NAME: <link=\"GINGERCONFIG\">Tonic Root</link>

KELP.DESC: The leaf of a <link=\"KELPPLANT\">Seakomb</link>.\n\nIt can be processed into <link=\"PHYTOOIL\">Phyto Oil</link> or used as an ingredient in <link=\"ANTIHISTAMINE\">Allergy Medication</link>.
KELP.NAME: <link=\"KELP\">Seakomb Leaf</link>

SWAMPLILYFLOWER.DESC: A medicinal flower that soothes most minor maladies.\n\nIt is exceptionally fragrant.
SWAMPLILYFLOWER.NAME: <link=\"SWAMPLILYFLOWER\">Balm Lily Flower</link>

LUBRICATIONSTICK.DESC: Provides a small amount of lubricating <link=\"LUBRICATINGOIL\">Gear Oil</link>.\n\nCan be produced at the <link=\"APOTHECARY\">Apothecary</link>.
LUBRICATIONSTICK.NAME: <link=\"LUBRICATIONSTICK\">Gear Balm</link>
LUBRICATIONSTICK.RECIPEDESC: A self-administered mechanical lubricant for Duplicants with bionic parts.

MISSILE_BASIC.DESC: An explosive projectile designed to defend against meteor showers.\n\nMust be launched by a <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Meteor Blaster</link>.
MISSILE_BASIC.NAME: <link=\"MISSILEBASIC\">Blastshot</link>

MISSILE_LONGRANGE.DESC: A long-range explosive projectile that defends against distant space objects.\n\nMust be launched by <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Meteor Blaster</link>.
MISSILE_LONGRANGE.NAME: <link=\"MISSILELONGRANGE\">Intracosmic Blastshot</link>

MISSILE_LONGRANGE_VANILLADLC4.DESC: A long-range explosive projectile that defends against distant space objects.\n\nMust be launched by <link=\"MISSILELAUNCHER\">Meteor Blaster</link>.
MISSILE_LONGRANGE_VANILLADLC4.NAME: <link=\"MISSILELONGRANGEVANILLADLC4\">Intracosmic Blastshot</link>

ADVANCEDCURE.DESC: A doctor-administered cure for severe ailments.
ADVANCEDCURE.NAME: <link=\"ADVANCEDCURE\">Serum Vial</link>
ADVANCEDCURE.RECIPEDESC: An extremely powerful medication created to treat severe <link=\"DISEASE\">Diseases</link>. <link=\"ADVANCEDCURE\">Serum Vial</link> is very effective against <link=\"ZOMBIESPORES\">Zombie Spores</link>.\n\nMust be administered by a Duplicant with the <link=\"MEDICINE3\">Advanced Medical Care</link> Skill.

ANTIHISTAMINE.NAME: <link=\"ANTIHISTAMINE\">Allergy Medication</link>
ANTIHISTAMINE.RECIPEDESC: A strong antihistamine Duplicants can take to halt an allergic reaction. <link=\"ANTIHISTAMINE\">Allergy Medication</link> will also prevent further reactions from occurring for a short time after ingestion.

BASICBOOSTER.DESC: Minorly reduces the chance of becoming sick.
BASICBOOSTER.NAME: <link=\"BASICBOOSTER\">Vitamin Chews</link>
BASICBOOSTER.RECIPEDESC: A supplement that minorly reduces the chance of contracting a <style=\"KKeyword\">Germ</style>-based <link=\"DISEASE\">Disease</link>.\n\nMust be taken daily.

BASICCURE.DESC: A simple, easy-to-take remedy for minor germ-based diseases.
BASICCURE.NAME: <link=\"BASICCURE\">Curative Tablet</link>
BASICCURE.RECIPEDESC: Duplicants can take this to cure themselves of minor <style=\"KKeyword\">Germ</style>-based <link=\"DISEASE\">Diseases</link>.\n\nCurative Tablets are very effective against <link=\"FOODPOISONING\">Food Poisoning</link>.

BASICRADPILL.DESC: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.
BASICRADPILL.NAME: <link=\"BASICRADPILL\">Basic Rad Pill</link>
BASICRADPILL.RECIPEDESC: A supplement that speeds up the rate at which a Duplicant body absorbs radiation, allowing them to manage increased radiation exposure.\n\nMust be taken daily.

INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.DESC: Significantly reduces the chance of becoming sick.
INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.NAME: <link=\"INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER\">Immuno Booster</link>
INTERMEDIATEBOOSTER.RECIPEDESC: A supplement that significantly reduces the chance of contracting a <style=\"KKeyword\">Germ</style>-based <link=\"DISEASE\">Disease</link>.\n\nMust be taken daily.

INTERMEDIATECURE.DESC: A doctor-administered cure for moderate ailments.
INTERMEDIATECURE.NAME: <link=\"INTERMEDIATECURE\">Medical Pack</link>
INTERMEDIATECURE.RECIPEDESC: A doctor-administered cure for moderate <link=\"DISEASE\">Diseases</link>. <link=\"INTERMEDIATECURE\">Medical Pack</link>s are very effective against <link=\"SLIMESICKNESS\">Slimelung</link>.\n\nMust be administered by a Duplicant with the <link=\"MEDICINE2\">Bedside Manner</link> Skill.

INTERMEDIATERADPILL.DESC: Increases a Duplicant's natural radiation absorption rate.
INTERMEDIATERADPILL.NAME: <link=\"INTERMEDIATERADPILL\">Intermediate Rad Pill</link>
INTERMEDIATERADPILL.RECIPEDESC: A supplement that speeds up the rate at which a Duplicant body absorbs radiation, allowing them to manage increased radiation exposure.\n\nMust be taken daily.

PLACEBO.DESC: A general, all-purpose <link=\"MEDICINE\">Medicine</link>.\n\nThe less one knows about it, the better it works.
PLACEBO.NAME: Placebo

HIGHENERGYPARITCLE.DESC: A concentrated field of <style=\"KKeyword\">Radbolts</style> that can be largely redirected using a <link=\"HIGHENERGYPARTICLEREDIRECTOR\">Radbolt Reflector</link>.
HIGHENERGYPARITCLE.NAME: Radbolts

RAILGUNPAYLOAD.DESC: Contains resources packed for interstellar shipping.\n\nCan be launched by a <link=\"RAILGUN\">Interplanetary Launcher</link> or unpacked with a <link=\"RAILGUNPAYLOADOPENER\">Payload Opener</link>.
RAILGUNPAYLOAD.NAME: <link=\"RAILGUNPAYLOAD\">Interplanetary Payload</link>

PILOTING_SPICE.DESC: Provides a boost to piloting abilities.
PILOTING_SPICE.NAME: <link=\"PILOTINGSPICE\">Rocketeer Spice</link>

PRESERVING_SPICE.DESC: Slows the decomposition of perishable foods.
PRESERVING_SPICE.NAME: <link=\"PRESERVINGSPICE\">Freshener Spice</link>

STRENGTH_SPICE.DESC: Strengthens even the weakest of muscles.
STRENGTH_SPICE.NAME: <link=\"STRENGTHSPICE\">Brawny Spice</link>

TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.DESC: Provides a small amount of extra-silky lubricating <link=\"LUBRICATINGOIL\">Gear Oil</link>.\n\nCan be produced at the <link=\"APOTHECARY\">Apothecary</link>.
TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.NAME: <link=\"TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK\">Tallow Gear Balm</link>
TALLOWLUBRICATIONSTICK.RECIPEDESC: An advanced self-administered mechanical lubricant for Duplicants with bionic parts.

Desk.ENTRY:
TO: JSTERN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
FROM: EJONES@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Preliminary Calculations

Director,

Even with dramatic optimization we can't make the sheer volume of resources required to sustain a colony seed fit for even a small interplanetary travel duration. We'll need to consider serious changes if this is going to work.

E Jones
Information and Statistics Department
The Gravitas Facility

GeneShuffler.ENTRY: "--fascinating that memories are not already inherent in our subjects; however, none as of yet have shown signs of recognition when introduced to familiar stimuli." "Refer to Experiment 7D." "Refer to Experiment 7F." "Memories must be embedded within the physical brainmaps of our subjects. The only question that remains is--"

PropLocker.ENTRY:
To all employees;

The facility is pleased to announced that starting this week, all Fridays will now be Casual Fridays!

Please enjoy the clinically proven destressing benefits of casual attire by wearing your favorite shirt to the lab.

NOTE: Any personnel found on facility premises without regulation fullbody protection will be put on immediate notice.

Thank-you and have fun!
-Admin

SET_LOCKER1.ENTRY:
FIRST LAW
Energy can neither be created or destroyed, only change forms.

SECOND LAW
Entropy in an isolated system that is not in equilibrium tends to increase over time, approaching the maximum value at equilibrium.

THIRD LAW
Entropy in a system approaches a constant minimum as temperature approaches absolute zero.

ZEROTH LAW
If two thermodynamic systems are in thermal equilibrium with a third, then they are in thermal equilibrium with each other.

SET_LOCKER2.ENTRY: A powerful stench emanates from this locker.

BODY.CONTAINER1: Reminder to All Personnel! From: Admin TO: All ------------------ To all employees; The Gravitas Facility does not officially host a "Bring Your Child To Work Day" office event. We ask that personnel please do not bring children into top secret research departments, and especially that they do not let said children play with the high velocity particle accelerators. We thank you for your understanding.

VendingMachine.ENTRY:
TO: ALL
FROM: ADMIN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Unattended Cultures

For the health and safety of your fellow Facility employees, please do not store unlabeled bacterial cultures in the cafeteria fridge.
Similarly, be advised that the cafeteria dishwasher is incapable of handling petri "dishes", despite the nomenclature.

We thank you for your consideration.
-The Gravitas Facility

MONUMENT_COMPLETE.DESC: A feat of artistic vision and expert engineering that will doubtless inspire Duplicants for thousands of cycles to come
MONUMENT_COMPLETE.NAME: Great Monument

ALLOCATED.NAME: Resource allocated
ALLOCATED.TOOLTIP: These resources are reserved for a planned building:

BADROCKETPATH.NAME: Flight Path Obstructed
BADROCKETPATH.TOOLTIP: A rocket's flight path has been interrupted by a new astronomical discovery.\nOpen the <style=\"KKeyword\">Starmap Screen</style> {Hotkey/ManageStarmap} to reassign rocket paths

BASICCONTROLS.MESSAGEBODY:
• I can use {Hotkey/PanLeft} and {Hotkey/PanRight} to pan my view left and right, and {Hotkey/PanUp} and {Hotkey/PanDown} to pan up and down.

• {Hotkey/ZoomIn} lets me zoom in, and {Hotkey/ZoomOut} zooms out.

• {Hotkey/CameraHome} returns my view to the Printing Pod.

• I can speed or slow my perception of time using the top left corner buttons, or by pressing {Hotkey/SpeedUp} or {Hotkey/SlowDown}. Pressing {Hotkey/TogglePause} will pause the flow of time entirely.

• I'll keep records of everything I discover in my personal DATABASE {Hotkey/ManageDatabase} to refer back to if I forget anything important.
BASICCONTROLS.MESSAGEBODYALT:
• I can use {Hotkey/AnalogCamera} to pan my view.

• {Hotkey/ZoomIn} lets me zoom in, and {Hotkey/ZoomOut} zooms out.

• I can speed or slow my perception of time using the top left corner buttons, or by pressing {Hotkey/CycleSpeed}. Pressing {Hotkey/TogglePause} will pause the flow of time entirely.

• I'll keep records of everything I discover in my personal DATABASE {Hotkey/ManageDatabase} to refer back to if I forget anything important.
BASICCONTROLS.NAME: Tutorial: Basic Controls

BEING_INFECTED.MESSAGEBODY: When Duplicants come into contact with various Germs, they'll need to expend points of Immunity to resist them and remain healthy. If repeated exposes causes their Immunity to drop to 0%, they'll be unable to resist germs and will contract the next disease they encounter.\n\nDoors with Access Permissions can be built from the BASE TAB [1] of the Build menu to block Duplicants from entering biohazardous areas while they recover their spent immunity points.
BEING_INFECTED.NAME: Tutorial: Immune Systems
BEING_INFECTED.TOOLTIP: Notes on keeping Duplicants in peak health

BIONICBATTERY.MESSAGEBODY: Bionic Duplicants require <link=\"ELECTROBANK\">Power Banks</link> to function. Bionic Duplicants who run out of <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> will become incapacitated and require another Duplicant to reboot them.\n\nBasic power banks can be made at the <link=\"CRAFTINGTABLE\">Crafting Station</link>.
BIONICBATTERY.NAME: Tutorial: Powering Bionics
BIONICBATTERY.TOOLTIP: Notes on Duplicant power bank needs

BIONICLIQUIDDAMAGE.NAME: Liquid Damage
BIONICLIQUIDDAMAGE.TOOLTIP: This Duplicant stepped in liquid and damaged their bionic systems!

BIONICOIL.MESSAGEBODY: Bionic Duplicants with insufficient Gear Oil will slow down significantly to avoid grinding their gears.\n\nI can keep them running smoothly by supplying Gear Balm, or by building a Lubrication Station from the Medicine Tab {Hotkey/Plan8}.
BIONICOIL.NAME: Tutorial: Oiling Bionics
BIONICOIL.TOOLTIP: Notes on keeping Bionics working efficiently

BIONICRESEARCHUNLOCK.NAME: Research Discovered

BROKENMACHINE.NAME: Building broken
BROKENMACHINE.TOOLTIP: These buildings have taken significant damage and are nonfunctional:

BUILDINGOVERHEATED.NAME: Damage: Overheated
BUILDINGOVERHEATED.TOOLTIP: Extreme heat is damaging these buildings:

BUILDING_MELTED.NAME: Building melted
BUILDING_MELTED.TOOLTIP: Extreme heat has melted these buildings:

CIRCUIT_OVERLOADED.NAME: Circuit Overloaded
CIRCUIT_OVERLOADED.TOOLTIP: These <link=\"WIRE\">Wire</link>s melted due to excessive current demands on their circuits

CODEXUNLOCK.MESSAGEBODY: I've added a new log entry to my Database
CODEXUNLOCK.NAME: New Log Entry
CODEXUNLOCK.TOOLTIP: I've added a new log entry to my Database

COLONYLOST.NAME: Colony Lost
COLONYLOST.TOOLTIP: All Duplicants are dead or incapacitated

COLONY_ACHIEVEMENT_EARNED.NAME: Colony Achievement earned
COLONY_ACHIEVEMENT_EARNED.TOOLTIP: The colony has earned a new achievement.

DEATH_DISEASE.NAME: Duplicants have succumbed to disease
DEATH_DISEASE.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants died from an untreated <link=\"DISEASE\">Disease</link>:

DEATH_ENTOUMBED.NAME: Duplicants have been entombed
DEATH_ENTOUMBED.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants are trapped and need assistance:

DEATH_FELL.NAME: Duplicants splattered
DEATH_FELL.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants fell to their deaths:

DEATH_FROZENSOLID.NAME: Duplicants have frozen
DEATH_FROZENSOLID.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants died from extremely low <style=\"KKeyword\">Temperatures</style>:

DIGGING.MESSAGEBODY: Everything a colony needs to get going is found in the ground. Instructing Duplicants to dig out areas means we can find food, mine resources to build infrastructure, and clear space for the colony to grow. I can access the Dig Tool with {Hotkey/Dig}, which allows me to select the area where I want my Duplicants to dig.\n\nDuplicants will need to gain the Superhard Digging skill to mine Abyssalite and the Superduperhard Digging skill to mine Diamond and Obsidian. Without the proper skills, these materials will be undiggable.
DIGGING.NAME: Video: Digging for Resources

DISCOVERED_SPACE.NAME: ALERT - Surface Breach
DISCOVERED_SPACE.TOOLTIP:
Amazing!

My Duplicants have managed to breach the surface of our rocky prison.

I should be careful; the region is extremely inhospitable and I could easily lose resources to the vacuum of space.

DISEASE_COOKING.MESSAGEBODY: The Food my Duplicants cook will only ever be as clean as the ingredients used to make it. Storing food in sterile or Refrigerated environments will keep food free of Germs, while carefully placed hygiene stations like Wash Basin or Shower will prevent the cooks from infecting the food by handling it.\n\nDangerously contaminated food can be sent to compost by (ClickType/clicking) the Compost button on the selected item.
DISEASE_COOKING.NAME: Tutorial: Food Safety

DTU.MESSAGEBODY: My Duplicants measure heat energy in Duplicant Thermal Units or DTU.\n\n1 DTU = 1055.06 J
DTU.NAME: Tutorial: Duplicant Thermal Units

DUPLICANTABSORBED.MESSAGEBODY: The Printing Pod is no longer available for printing.\nCountdown to the next production has been rebooted.

DUPLICANT_CRASH_LANDED.NAME: Duplicant Crash Landed!
DUPLICANT_CRASH_LANDED.TOOLTIP: A Duplicant has successfully crashed an Escape Pod onto the surface of a nearby Planetoid.

FABRICATOREMPTY.TOOLTIP: These fabricators have no recipes queued:

FETCHINGWATERMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Fetching Water

FOODLOW.TOOLTIP: The colony's Food reserves are low: • {0} are currently available • {1} is being consumed per cycle Microbe Mushers can be built from the Food Tab {Hotkey/Plan4}

GUNKEDTOILET.MESSAGEBODY: Bionic Duplicants can dump built-up Gunk into Toilets if no other options are available. This invariably clogs the plumbing, however, and must be removed before facilities can be used by other Duplicants.\n\nBuilding a Gunk Extractor from the Plumbing Tab {Hotkey/Plan5} will ensure that Bionic Duplicants can dispose of their waste appropriately.
GUNKEDTOILET.NAME: Tutorial: Gunked Toilets

INCREASEDEXPECTATIONS.TOOLTIP: Duplicants require better amenities over time.\nThese Duplicants have increased their expectations:

INSUFFICIENTOXYGENLASTCYCLE.NAME: Insufficient Oxygen generation

INSULATION.MESSAGEBODY: The temperature of an environment can have positive or negative effects on the well-being of my Duplicants, as well as the plants and critters in my colony. Selecting {Hotkey/Overlay3} will open the Temperature Overlay where I can check for any hot or cold spots.\n\nI can use a Utility building like an Ice-E Fan or a Space Heater to make an area colder or warmer. However, I will have limited success changing the temperature of a room unless I build the area with insulating tiles to prevent cold or warm air from escaping.
INSULATION.NAME: Video: Insulation

INVALIDCONSTRUCTIONLOCATION.NAME: Invalid construction location
INVALIDCONSTRUCTIONLOCATION.TOOLTIP: These buildings cannot be constructed in the planned areas:

LARGE_IMPACTOR_GEYSER_ERUPTION.NAME: Geyser triggered
LARGE_IMPACTOR_GEYSER_ERUPTION.TOOLTIP: Demolior's impact has triggered the eruption of a natural vent on this world

LARGE_IMPACTOR_KEEPSAKE.NAME: Artifact found
LARGE_IMPACTOR_KEEPSAKE.TOOLTIP: An artifact has been found in Demolior's rubble

LOCOMOTIONMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY: Duplicants have limited jumping and climbing abilities. They can only climb two tiles high and cannot fit into spaces shorter than two tiles, or cross gaps wider than one tile. I should keep this in mind while placing errands.\n\nTo check if an errand I've placed is accessible, I can select a Duplicant and (ClickType/click) Show Navigation to view all areas within their reach.
LOCOMOTIONMESSAGE.NAME: Video: Duplicant Movement

LOGIC_CIRCUIT_OVERLOADED.NAME: Logic Circuit Overloaded
LOGIC_CIRCUIT_OVERLOADED.TOOLTIP: These <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>s melted due to more bits of data being sent over them than they can support

LOTS_OF_GERMS.MESSAGEBODY: Germs such as Food Poisoning and Slimelung can cause Disease in my Duplicants. I can use the Germ Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay9} to view all germ concentrations in my colony, and even detect the sources spawning them. Building Wash Basins from the Medicine Tab {Hotkey/Plan8} near colony toilets will tell my Duplicants they need to wash up. Related Video: Plumbing and Ventilation
LOTS_OF_GERMS.NAME: Tutorial: Germs and Disease

MOPPINGMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY: Polluted Water slowly emits Polluted Oxygen which accelerates the spread of Disease.\n\nDuplicants will also be Stressed by walking through Polluted Water, so I should have my Duplicants clean up spills by (ClickType/clicking) and dragging the Mop Tool {Hotkey/Mop}
MOPPINGMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Polluted Water

MORALE.MESSAGEBODY:
Food, Rooms, Decor, and Recreation all have an effect on Duplicant Morale. Good experiences improve their Morale, while poor experiences lower it. When a Duplicant's Morale is below their Expectations, they will become Stressed.

Duplicants' Expectations will get higher as they are given new Skills, and the colony will have to be improved to keep up their Morale. An overview of Morale and Stress can be viewed on the Vitals screen.

Related <link="MISCELLANEOUSTIPS">Tutorial: Stress Management</link>
MORALE.NAME: Video: Duplicant Morale

NEARLYDRY.NAME: Nearly dry
NEARLYDRY.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants will dry off soon:

NEEDENERGYSOURCE.NAME: Colony requires a <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> source
NEEDENERGYSOURCE.TOOLTIP: <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> is required to operate electrical buildings\n\n<link=\"MANUALGENERATOR\">Manual Generators</link> and <link=\"WIRE\">Wire</link> can be built from the <link=\"[3]\">Power Tab</link>

NEEDFOOD.NAME: Colony requires a food source
NEEDFOOD.TOOLTIP: The colony will exhaust their supplies without a new Food source\n\nMicrobe Mushers can be built from the Food Tab {Hotkey/Plan4}

NEEDSLEEP.NAME: No <link=\"BED\">Cots</link> built
NEEDSLEEP.TOOLTIP: My Duplicants would appreciate a place to sleep\n\nCots can be built from the Furniture Tab {Hotkey/Plan9}

NEEDTOILET.NAME: No <link=\"OUTHOUSE\">Outhouse</link> built

NEWMUTANTSEED.NAME: New Mutant Seed Discovered
NEWMUTANTSEED.TOOLTIP: A new mutant variety of the {Plant} has been found. Analyze it at the <link=\"GENETICANALYSISSTATION\">Botanical Analyzer</link> to learn more!

NEW_AUTOMATION_WARNING.NAME: New Automation Port
NEW_AUTOMATION_WARNING.TOOLTIP: This building has a new automation port and is unintentionally connected to an existing <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>

NO_MEDICAL_COTS.NAME: No <link=\"DOCTORSTATION\">Sick Bay</link> built
NO_MEDICAL_COTS.TOOLTIP: There is nowhere for sick Duplicants receive medical care\n\nSick Bays can be built from the Medicine Tab {Hotkey/Plan8}

NO_OXYGEN_GENERATOR.NAME: No <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen Generator</link> built
NO_OXYGEN_GENERATOR.TOOLTIP: My colony is not producing any new Oxygen\n\nOxygen Diffusers can be built from the Oxygen Tab {Hotkey/Plan2}

OUTPUTBLOCKED.NAME: Output blocked
OUTPUTBLOCKED.TOOLTIP: Blocked <style=\"KKeyword\">Pipes</style> have stopped these systems from functioning:

PLUMBING.MESSAGEBODY:
When connecting pipes for plumbing, it is useful to have the Plumbing Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay6} selected. Each building which requires plumbing must have their Building Intake connected to the Output Pipe from a source such as a Liquid Pump. Liquid Pumps must be submerged in liquid and attached to a power source to function.

Buildings often output contaminated water which must flow out of the building through piping from the Output Pipe. The water can then be expelled through a Liquid Vent, or filtered through a Water Sieve for reuse.

Ventilation applies the same principles to gases. Select the Ventilation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay7} to see how gases are being moved around the colony.
PLUMBING.NAME: Video: Plumbing and Ventilation
PLUMBING.TOOLTIP: Notes on connecting buildings with pipes

POIRESEARCHUNLOCKCOMPLETE.NAME: Portal Unlocked!

POIRESEARCHUNLOCKCOMPLETE_NOLORE.MESSAGEBODY:
Eureka! We've decrypted the Research Portal's final transmission. New buildings have become available:
  {0}
POIRESEARCHUNLOCKCOMPLETE_NOLORE.NAME: Portal Unlocked!

POWER.MESSAGEBODY:
Generators are considered "Producers" of Power, while the various buildings and machines in the colony are considered "Consumers". Each Consumer will pull a certain wattage from the power circuit it is connected to, which can be checked at any time by (ClickType/clicking) the building and going to the Energy Tab.

I can use the Power Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay2} to quickly check the status of all my circuits. If the Consumers are taking more wattage than the Generators are creating, the Batteries will drain and there will be brownouts.

Additionally, if the Consumers are pulling more wattage through the Wires than the Wires can handle, they will overload and burn out. To correct both these situations, I will need to reorganize my Consumers onto separate circuits.
POWER.NAME: Video: Power Circuits

PRIORITIESMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY: Duplicants will choose where to work based on the priority of the errands that I give them. I can open the Priorities Screen {Hotkey/ManagePriorities} to set their Duplicant Priorities, and the Priority Tool {Hotkey/Prioritize} to fine tune Building Priority. Many buildings will also let me change their Priority level when I select them.
PRIORITIESMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Errand Priorities

RADIATION.MESSAGEBODY: Objects such as Uranium Ore and Beeta Hives emit a Radioactive energy that can be toxic to my Duplicants.\n\nI can use the Radiation Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay15} to check the scope of the Radiation field. Building thick walls around radiation emitters will dampen the field and protect my Duplicants from getting Radiation Sickness.
RADIATION.NAME: Tutorial: Radiation

REACTORMELTDOWN.NAME: Reactor Meltdown
REACTORMELTDOWN.TOOLTIP: A Research Reactor has overheated and is melting down! Extreme radiation is flooding the area

REDALERT.NAME: Red Alert
REDALERT.TOOLTIP: The colony is prioritizing work over their individual well-being

RESEARCHCOMPLETE.NAME: Research Complete

RESETSKILL.NAME: Skills reset
RESETSKILL.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants have had their <style=\"KKeyword\">Skill Points</style> refunded:

SCHEDULEMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY: My Duplicants will only eat, sleep, work, or bathe during the times I allot for such activities.\n\nTo make the best use of their time, I can open the Schedule Tab {Hotkey/ManageSchedule} to adjust the colony's schedule and plan how they should utilize their day.
SCHEDULEMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Scheduling
SCHEDULEMESSAGE.TOOLTIP: Notes on scheduling my Duplicants' time

SKILL_POINT_EARNED.MESSAGEBODY: These Duplicants have Skill Points that can be spent on new abilities:\n{0}
SKILL_POINT_EARNED.NAME: {Duplicant} earned a skill point!
SKILL_POINT_EARNED.TOOLTIP: {Duplicant} has been working hard and is ready to learn a new skill

SLIPPERYSURFACE.MESSAGEBODY: My Duplicants may slip and fall on wet surfaces, and Duplicants with bionic systems can experience disruptive glitching.\n\nI can help my colony avoid undue Stress and potential injury by using the Mop Tool {Hotkey/Mop} to clean up spills. Building Toilets and Gunk Extractors can help minimize the incidence of spills.
SLIPPERYSURFACE.NAME: Tutorial: Wet Surfaces

SPACETRAVEL.MESSAGEBODY: Building a rocket first requires constructing a <link=\"LAUNCHPAD\">Rocket Platform</link> and adding modules from the menu. All components of the Rocket Checklist will need to be complete before being capable of launching.\n\nA <link=\"CLUSTERTELESCOPE\">Telescope</link> needs to be built on the surface of a Planetoid in order to use the <style=\"KKeyword\">Starmap Screen</style> {Hotkey/ManageStarmap} to see and set course for new destinations.
SPACETRAVEL.NAME: Tutorial: Space Travel

STRESSMANAGEMENTMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY:
At 100% <link="STRESS">Stress</link>, a Duplicant will have a nervous breakdown and be unable to work.

Breakdowns can manifest in different colony-threatening ways, such as the destruction of buildings or the binge eating of food.

I can help my Duplicants manage stressful situations by giving them access to good <link="FOOD">Food</link>, fancy <link="DECOR">Decor</link> and comfort items which boost their <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.

I can select a Duplicant and mouse over <link="STRESS">Stress</link> or <link="MORALE">Morale</link> in their CONDITION TAB to view current statuses, and hopefully manage things before they become a problem.

Related <link="VIDEOS13">Video: Duplicant Morale</link>
STRESSMANAGEMENTMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Stress Management
STRESSMANAGEMENTMESSAGE.TOOLTIP: Notes on keeping Duplicants happy and productive

STRUCTURALDAMAGE.NAME: Structural damage
STRUCTURALDAMAGE.TOOLTIP: These buildings' structural integrity has been compromised

SUITS.MESSAGEBODY: <link=\"ATMOSUIT\">Atmo Suits</link> can be equipped to protect my Duplicants from environmental hazards like extreme <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link>, airborne <link=\"DISEASE\">Germs</link>, or unbreathable <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gas</link>. In order to utilize these suits, I'll need to hook up an <link=\"SUITLOCKER\">Atmo Suit Dock</link> to an <link=\"SUITMARKER\">Atmo Suit Checkpoint</link> , then store one of the suits inside.\n\nDuplicants will equip a suit when they walk past the checkpoint in the chosen direction, and will unequip their suit when walking back the opposite way.
SUITS.NAME: Tutorial: Atmo Suits

SUIT_DROPPED.NAME: No Docks available
SUIT_DROPPED.TOOLTIP: An exosuit was dropped because there were no empty docks available

TASKPRIORITIESMESSAGE.MESSAGEBODY: Duplicants always perform errands in order of highest to lowest priority. They will harvest Food before they build, for example, or always build new structures before they mine materials.\n\nI can open the Priorities Screen {Hotkey/ManagePriorities} to set which Errand Types Duplicants may or may not perform, or to specialize skilled Duplicants for particular Errand Types.
TASKPRIORITIESMESSAGE.NAME: Tutorial: Priority

THERMALCOMFORT.MESSAGEBODY: Environments that are extremely Hot or Cold affect my Duplicants' internal body temperature and cause undue Stress or unscheduled naps. Opening the Temperature Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay3} and checking the Thermal Tolerance box allows me to view all areas where my Duplicants will feel discomfort and be unable to regulate their internal body temperature. Related Video: Insulation
THERMALCOMFORT.NAME: Tutorial: Duplicant Temperature
THERMALCOMFORT.TOOLTIP: Notes on helping Duplicants keep their cool

TILECOLLAPSE.NAME: Ceiling Collapse!
TILECOLLAPSE.TOOLTIP: Falling material fell on these Duplicants and displaced them:

TUTORIAL_OVERHEATING.MESSAGEBODY: When constructing buildings, I should always take note of their Overheat Temperature and plan their locations accordingly. Maintaining low ambient temperatures and good ventilation in the colony will also help keep building temperatures down. The Relative Temperature slider tool in the Temperature Overlay {Hotkey/Overlay3} allows me to change adjust the overlay's color-coding in order to highlight specific temperature ranges. If I allow buildings to exceed their Overheat Temperature they will begin to take damage, and if left unattended, they will break down and be unusable until repaired.
TUTORIAL_OVERHEATING.NAME: Tutorial: Building Temperature
TUTORIAL_OVERHEATING.TOOLTIP: Notes on preventing building from breaking
