TAGS.BUILDABLERAW_DESC: Raw minerals are the unrefined forms of organic solids. Almost all raw minerals can be processed in the <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Rock Crusher</link>, although a handful require the use of the <link=\"SUPERMATERIALREFINERY\">Molecular Forge</link>.
TAGS.BUILDINGFIBER_DESC: Fibers are organically sourced polymers which are both sturdy and sensorially pleasant, making them suitable in the construction of <link=\"MORALE\">Morale</link>-boosting buildings.
TAGS.BUILDINGWOOD_DESC: Wood is a renewable building material which can also be used as a valuable source of fuel and electricity when refined at the <link=\"WOODGASGENERATOR\">Wood Burner</link> or the <link=\"ETHANOLDISTILLERY\">Ethanol Distiller</link>.
TAGS.COMBUSTIBLEGAS_DESC: Combustible Gases can be burned as fuel to be used in the production of <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> and <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link>.
TAGS.COMBUSTIBLELIQUID_DESC: Combustible Liquids can be burned as fuels to be used in energy production, such as in a <link=\"PETROLEUMGENERATOR\">Petroleum Generator</link> or a <link=\"KEROSENEENGINECLUSTER\">Petroleum Engine</link>.\n\nThough these liquids have other uses, such as fertilizer for growing a <link=\"BEANPLANTSEED\">Nosh Bean</link>, their primary usefulness lies in their ability to be burned for <link=\"POWER\">Power</link>.
TAGS.COMBUSTIBLESOLID_DESC: Combustible Solids can be burned as fuel to be used in <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> production.
TAGS.COMPOSTABLE_DESC:
Compostables are biological materials which can be put into a <link="COMPOST">Compost</link> to generate clean <link="DIRT">Dirt</link>.

Composting also generates a small amount of <link="HEAT">Heat</link>.

Once it starts to rot, consumable food should be composted to prevent <link="FOODPOISONING">Food Poisoning</link>.
TAGS.FARMABLE_DESC: Cultivable soil is a fundamental building block of basic agricultural systems and can also be useful in the production of clean <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>.
TAGS.FILTER_DESC: Filtration mediums are materials used to separate purified <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">gases</link> or <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">liquids</link> from their polluted forms.\n\nThey are consumables that will be transformed by the filtering process. For example, <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link> that has been used to filter <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link> will become <link=\"TOXICSAND\">Polluted Dirt</link>.
TAGS.FOSSILS_DESC: Fossil is a category of composite rocks and minerals that contain traces of petrified lifeforms.\n\nThey have varied uses as basic building materials, sculpting blocks, or raw ingredients in the production of higher-grade materials.
TAGS.ICEORE_DESC:
Ice is a class of materials made up mostly (if not completely) of <link="WATER">Water</link> in a frozen or partially frozen form.

As a material in a frigid solid or semi-solid state, these elements are very useful as a low-cost way to cool the environment around them.

When heated, ice will melt into its original liquified form (ie.<link="BRINEICE">Brine Ice</link> will liquify into <link="BRINE">Brine</link>). Each ice element has a different freezing and melting point based upon its composition and state.
TAGS.INSULATOR_DESC: Insulators have low thermal conductivity, and effectively reduce the speed at which <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> is transferred through them.
TAGS.LUBRICATINGOIL_DESC: Gear oils are lubricating fluids useful in the maintenance of complex machinery, protecting gear systems from damage and minimizing friction between moving parts to support optimal performance.
TAGS.METAL_DESC:
Metal ore is the raw form of metal, and has a wide variety of practical applications in electronics and general construction.

Metal ore is typically processed into <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> using the <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link> or the <link="METALREFINERY">Metal Refinery</link>.

Some rare metal ores can also be refined in the <link="SUPERMATERIALREFINERY">Molecular Forge</link>.
TAGS.ORGANICS_DESC: Organic materials are useful ingredients gathered from the environment, harvested from <link=\"PLANTS\">plants</link> or derived from <link=\"CREATURES\">critters</link>.\n\nSome, not all, require additional processing before they can be used.
TAGS.PLASTIC_DESC: Plastics are synthetic <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">Solids</link> that are pliable and minimize the transfer of <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link>. They typically have a low melting point, although more advanced plastics have been developed to circumvent this issue.
TAGS.PLASTIFIABLELIQUID_DESC: Plastic monomers are organic compounds that can be processed into <link=\"PLASTIC\">Plastics</link> that have valuable applications as advanced building materials.\n\nPlastics derived from these monomers can also be used as packaging materials for <link=\"FOOD\">Food</link> preservation.
TAGS.PRECIOUSROCK_DESC: Precious rocks are raw minerals. Their extreme hardness produces durable <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link>.\n\nSome precious rocks are inherently attractive even in their natural, unfinished form.
TAGS.REFINEDMETAL_DESC: Refined metals are purified forms of metal often used in higher-tier electronics due to their tendency to be able to withstand higher temperatures when they are made into wires. Other benefits include the increased decor value for some metals which can greatly improve the well-being of a colony.\n\nMetal ore can be refined in either the <link=\"ROCKCRUSHER\">Rock Crusher</link> or the <link=\"METALREFINERY\">Metal Refinery</link>.
TAGS.REMOTEOPERABLE_DESC: These buildings can be operated from a distance by a <link=\"REMOTEWORKTERMINAL\">Remote Controller</link> so long as they are built within range of a <link=\"REMOTEWORKERDOCK\">Remote Worker Dock</link>.
TAGS.SLIPPERY_DESC: Some <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">liquids</link> and <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">solids</link> have a remarkably low coefficient of friction. These present a safety hazard if left on the ground, as Duplicants may slip and fall when traveling across them.
TAGS.SUBLIMATING_DESC: Sublimators are a class of <link=\"ELEMENTSSOLID\">Solid</link> elements that passively convert to a <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gaseous</link> state. When off-gassing is complete, no trace of the original solid remains.\n\nThis passive conversion persists when the element is left in storage.
TAGS.TRANSPARENT_DESC: Transparent materials allow <link=\"LIGHT\">Light</link> to pass through. Illumination boosts Duplicant productivity during working hours, but undermines sleep quality.\n\nTransparency is also important for buildings that require a clear line of sight in order to function correctly, such as the <link=\"COMETDETECTOR\">Space Scanner</link>.
TAGS.UNREFINEDOIL_DESC: Oils in their raw, minimally processed forms. They can be used as industrial lubricants or refined for other applications at designated buildings.

EPITAPHS.ALL_GOOD_THINGS: All good things must come to an end.
EPITAPHS.ASHES_TO_ASHES_STARDUST_TO_STARDUST: Ashes to ashes, stardust to stardust.
EPITAPHS.FREE_FROM_THE_CLUTCHES_OF_TIME: Free from the clutches of time.
EPITAPHS.NEVER_ANOTHER_LIKE_THEM_UNTIL_WE_PRINT_A: Never another like them. Until we print another like them.
EPITAPHS.NOW_WELL_NEVER_KNOW_WHERE_THEY_BURIED_TH: Now we'll never know where they buried the treasure.
EPITAPHS.TAKE_ALL_THEIR_STUFF_ITS_WHAT_THEY_WOULD: Take all their stuff. It's what they would have wanted.
EPITAPHS.THANK_GOODNESS_THEY_WERE_STARTING_TO_SME: Thank goodness. They were starting to smell.
EPITAPHS.THEY_DIED_DOING_WHAT_THEY_LOVED: They died doing what they loved.
EPITAPHS.TO_DIG_TO_MUSH_NO_MORE: To dig, to mush, no more.
EPITAPHS.WHERE_ONE_ADVENTURE_ENDS_ANOTHER_BEGINS: Where one adventure ends, another begins.

PETITAPHS.FARM: Gone to the farm in the sky.

INTERIORDECOR.DESC: <link=\"DECOR\">Decor</link> boosting items to counteract the gloom of underground living.

JETPACKS.DESC: Give Duplicants the gift of a walk-free commute.

JOBS.DESC: Exchange the skill points earned by Duplicants for new traits and abilities.
JOBS.NAME: <link=\"JOBS\">Employment</link>

LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION.DESC: Advanced fittings ensure that <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link> resources get where they need to go.
LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION.NAME: <link=\"LIQUIDDISTRIBUTION\">Liquid Distribution</link>

LIQUIDFILTERING.DESC: Use pumped <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link> to filter out unwanted elements.
LIQUIDFILTERING.NAME: <link=\"LIQUIDFILTERING\">Liquid-Based Refinement Processes</link>

LIQUIDTEMPERATURE.DESC: Easily manipulate <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquid</link> <link=\"TEMPERATURES\">Heat</link> with these temperature regulating technologies.
LIQUIDTEMPERATURE.NAME: <link=\"LIQUIDTEMPERATURE\">Liquid Tuning</link>

LOGICCIRCUITS.DESC: The only limit to colony automation is my own imagination.

LOGICCONTROL.DESC: Switches that grant full control of building operations within the colony.
LOGICCONTROL.NAME: <link=\"LOGICCONTROL\">Smart Home</link>

MEDICINEI.DESC: Compound natural cures to fight the most common <link=\"SICKNESSES\">Sicknesses</link> that plague Duplicants.

MEDICINEII.DESC: The basic necessities doctors need to facilitate patient care.

MEDICINEIII.DESC: Stop Germs at the source using special medical automation technology.
MEDICINEIII.NAME: <link=\"MEDICINEIII\">Pathogen Diagnostics</link>

MEDICINEIV.DESC: State of the art equipment to conquer the most stubborn of illnesses.
MEDICINEIV.NAME: <link=\"MEDICINEIV\">Micro-Targeted Medicine</link>

MISSILES.DESC: Craft explosives and fire them into outer space.
MISSILES.NAME: <link=\"MISSILES\">Missiles</link>

MULTIPLEXING.DESC: More choices for Automation signal distribution.

NOTIFICATIONSYSTEMS.DESC: Get all the news you need to know about your complex colony.

NUCLEARPROPULSION.DESC: Radical technology to get you to the stars.
NUCLEARPROPULSION.NAME: <link=\"NUCLEARPROPULSION\">Radbolt Propulsion</link>

NUCLEARRESEARCH.DESC: Harness sub-atomic particles to study the properties of matter.

NUCLEARSTORAGE.DESC: Build a quality cache of radbolts.

PARALLELAUTOMATION.DESC: Multi-wire automation at a fraction of the space.

PLASTICS.DESC: Stable, lightweight, durable. Plastics are useful for a wide array of applications.

PORTABLEGASSES.DESC: Unlock technologies to easily move gases around your colony.

POWERREGULATION.DESC: Prevent wasted <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> with improved electrical tools.

PRECISIONPLUMBING.DESC: Let Duplicants relax after a long day of subterranean digging with a shot of warm beanjuice.

PRESSUREMANAGEMENT.DESC: Unlock technologies to manage colony pressure and atmosphere.

PRETTYGOODCONDUCTORS.DESC: Pure-core wires that can handle more <link=\"POWER\">Electrical</link> current without overloading.

RADIATIONPROTECTION.DESC: Shield Duplicants from dangerous amounts of radiation.

RANCHING.DESC: Tame and care for wild critters.

REFINEDOBJECTS.DESC: Improve base infrastructure with new objects crafted from <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metals</link>.

REFRACTIVEDECOR.DESC: New methods for working with extremely high quality art materials.

RENAISSANCEART.DESC: The kind of art that culture legacies are made of.
RENAISSANCEART.NAME: <link=\"RENAISSANCEART\">Renaissance Art</link>

RENEWABLEENERGY.DESC: Clean, sustainable <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> production that produces little to no waste.
RENEWABLEENERGY.NAME: <link=\"RENEWABLEENERGY\">Renewable Energy</link>

ROBOTICTOOLS.DESC: The goal of every great civilization is to one day make itself obsolete.
ROBOTICTOOLS.NAME: <link=\"ROBOTICTOOLS\">Robotic Tools</link>

SANITATIONSCIENCES.DESC: Make daily ablutions less of a hassle.
SANITATIONSCIENCES.NAME: <link=\"SANITATIONSCIENCES\">Sanitation</link>

SCREENS.DESC: High tech displays with lots of pretty colors.
SCREENS.NAME: <link=\"SCREENS\">New Media</link>

SKYDETECTORS.DESC: Turn Duplicants' eyes to the skies and discover what undiscovered wonders await out there.
SKYDETECTORS.NAME: <link=\"SKYDETECTORS\">Celestial Detection</link>

SMARTSTORAGE.DESC: Completely automate the storage of solid resources.

SMELTING.DESC: High temperatures facilitate the production of purer, special use metal resources.

SOLIDTRANSPORT.DESC: Free Duplicants from the drudgery of day-to-day material deliveries with new methods of automation.

SPACEPROGRAM.DESC: The first steps in getting a Duplicant to space.
SPACEPROGRAM.NAME: <link=\"SPACEPROGRAM\">Space Program</link>

SUITS.DESC: Vital gear for surviving in extreme conditions and environments.

TEMPERATUREMODULATION.DESC: Precise <link=\"HEAT\">Temperature</link> altering technologies to keep my colony at the perfect Kelvin.

TRAVELTUBES.DESC: A wholly futuristic way to move Duplicants around the base.
TRAVELTUBES.NAME: <link=\"TRAVELTUBES\">Transit Tubes</link>

VALVEMINIATURIZATION.DESC: Smaller, more efficient pumps for those low-throughput situations.
VALVEMINIATURIZATION.NAME: <link=\"VALVEMINIATURIZATION\">Valve Miniaturization</link>

ALPHA.DESC: <link=\"RESEARCH\">Novice Research</link> is required to unlock basic technologies.\nIt can be conducted at a <link=\"RESEARCHCENTER\">Research Station</link>.
ALPHA.NAME: Novice Research

BETA.DESC: <link=\"RESEARCH\">Advanced Research</link> is required to unlock improved technologies.\nIt can be conducted at a <link=\"ADVANCEDRESEARCHCENTER\">Super Computer</link>.
BETA.NAME: Advanced Research

DELTA.DESC: <link=\"RESEARCH\">Applied Sciences Research</link> is required to unlock materials science technologies.\nIt can be conducted at a <link=\"NUCLEARRESEARCHCENTER\">Materials Study Terminal</link>.
DELTA.NAME: Applied Sciences Research

GAMMA.DESC: <link=\"RESEARCH\">Interstellar Research</link> is required to unlock space technologies.\nIt can be conducted at a <link=\"COSMICRESEARCHCENTER\">Virtual Planetarium</link>.
GAMMA.NAME: Interstellar Research

ORBITAL.DESC: <link=\"RESEARCH\">Data Analysis Research</link> is required to unlock Data Analysis technologies.\nIt can be conducted at a <link=\"ORBITALRESEARCHCENTER\">Orbital Data Collection Lab</link>.

WILDPLANTS.DESCRIPTION: Requires four or more wild plants

BANQUETHALL.DESCRIPTION: An exquisite place for communal dining.\n\nEating in a Banquet Hall will dramatically improve Duplicants' Morale.
BANQUETHALL.NAME: Banquet Hall
BANQUETHALL.TOOLTIP: Eating in a Banquet Hall will dramatically improve Duplicants' Morale

BARRACKS.DESCRIPTION: A basic communal sleeping area for up-and-coming colonies.\n\nSleeping in Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale.
BARRACKS.NAME: Barracks
BARRACKS.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale

BEDROOM.DESCRIPTION: An upscale communal sleeping area full of things that greatly enhance quality of rest for occupants.\n\nSleeping in a Luxury Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale.
BEDROOM.NAME: Luxury Barracks
BEDROOM.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in a Luxury Barracks will improve Duplicants' Morale

CREATUREPEN.DESCRIPTION:
Critters don't mind it here, as long as things don't get too crowded.

Stabled critters can be tended to in order to improve their happiness, hasten their domestication and increase their production.

Enables the use of Grooming Stations, Shearing Stations, Critter Condos, Critter Fountains and Milking Stations.
CREATUREPEN.NAME: Stable
CREATUREPEN.TOOLTIP: A stable enables Grooming Station, Critter Condo, Critter Fountain, Shearing Station and Milking Station use

FARM.DESCRIPTION: An enclosed agricultural space best utilized by Duplicants with Crop Tending skills.\n\nCrops grown within a Greenhouse can be tended with Farm Station fertilizer to increase their growth speed.
FARM.NAME: Greenhouse
FARM.TOOLTIP: Crops grown within a Greenhouse can be tended with Farm Station fertilizer to increase their growth speed

GREATHALL.DESCRIPTION: A great place to eat, with great decor. Great!\n\nEating in a Great Hall will improve Duplicants' Morale.
GREATHALL.NAME: Great Hall
GREATHALL.TOOLTIP: Eating in a Great Hall will significantly improve Duplicants' Morale

HOSPITAL.DESCRIPTION: A dedicated medical facility that helps minimize recovery time.\n\nSick Duplicants assigned to medical buildings located within a Hospital are also less likely to spread Disease.
HOSPITAL.NAME: Hospital
HOSPITAL.TOOLTIP: Sick Duplicants assigned to medical buildings located within a Hospital are less likely to spread Disease

KITCHEN.DESCRIPTION: A cooking area equipped to take meals to the next level.\n\nAdding ingredients from a Spice Grinder to foods cooked on an Electric Grill or Gas Range provides a variety of positive benefits.
KITCHEN.NAME: Kitchen
KITCHEN.TOOLTIP: Using a Spice Grinder in a Kitchen adds benefits to foods cooked on Electric Grill or Gas Range

LABORATORY.DESCRIPTION:
Where wild hypotheses meet rigorous scientific experimentation.

Science stations built in a Laboratory function more efficiently.

A Laboratory enables the use of the Geotuner and the Mission Control Station.
LABORATORY.NAME: Laboratory
LABORATORY.TOOLTIP: Science buildings built in a Laboratory function more efficiently\n\nA Laboratory enables Geotuner and Mission Control Station use

LATRINE.DESCRIPTION: It's a step up from doing one's business in full view of the rest of the colony.\n\nUsing a toilet in an enclosed room will improve Duplicants' Morale.
LATRINE.NAME: Latrine
LATRINE.TOOLTIP: Using a toilet in an enclosed room will improve Duplicants' Morale

MACHINE_SHOP.DESCRIPTION: It smells like elbow grease.\n\nDuplicants working in a Machine Shop can maintain buildings and increase their production speed.
MACHINE_SHOP.NAME: Machine Shop
MACHINE_SHOP.TOOLTIP: Duplicants working in a Machine Shop can maintain buildings and increase their production speed

MASSAGE_CLINIC.DESCRIPTION: A soothing space with a very relaxing ambience, especially when well-decorated.\n\nReceiving massages at a Massage Clinic will significantly improve Stress reduction.
MASSAGE_CLINIC.NAME: Massage Clinic
MASSAGE_CLINIC.TOOLTIP: Receiving massages at a Massage Clinic will significantly improve Stress reduction

MESSHALL.DESCRIPTION: A simple dining room setup that's easy to improve upon.\n\nEating at a mess table in a Mess Hall will increase Duplicants' Morale.
MESSHALL.NAME: Mess Hall
MESSHALL.TOOLTIP: Eating at a Mess Table in a Mess Hall will improve Duplicants' Morale

NATURERESERVE.DESCRIPTION: A lot of greenery goes an even longer way.\n\nPassing through a Nature Reserve will grant higher Morale bonuses to Duplicants than a Park.
NATURERESERVE.NAME: Nature Reserve
NATURERESERVE.TOOLTIP: A Nature Reserve will grant higher Morale bonuses to Duplicants than a Park

NEUTRAL.DESCRIPTION: An enclosed space with plenty of potential and no dedicated use.
NEUTRAL.NAME: Miscellaneous Room
NEUTRAL.TOOLTIP: This area has walls and doors but no dedicated use

PARK.DESCRIPTION: A little greenery goes a long way.\n\nPassing through natural spaces throughout the day will raise the Morale of Duplicants.
PARK.NAME: Park
PARK.TOOLTIP: Passing through natural spaces throughout the day will raise the Morale of Duplicants

PLUMBEDBATHROOM.DESCRIPTION: A sanctuary of personal hygiene.\n\nUsing a fully plumbed Washroom will improve Duplicants' Morale.
PLUMBEDBATHROOM.NAME: Washroom
PLUMBEDBATHROOM.TOOLTIP: Using a fully plumbed Washroom will improve Duplicants' Morale

POWER_PLANT.DESCRIPTION: The perfect place for Duplicants to flex their Electrical Engineering skills.\n\nHeavy-duty generators built within a Power Plant can be tuned up using microchips from power control stations to improve their <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> production.
POWER_PLANT.NAME: Power Plant
POWER_PLANT.TOOLTIP: Heavy-duty generators built in a Power Plant can be tuned up using microchips from Power Control Stations to improve their Power production

PRIVATE_BATHROOM.DESCRIPTION: Finally, a place to truly be alone with one's thoughts.\n\nDuplicants relieve even more Stress when using the toilet in a Private Bathroom than in a Latrine.
PRIVATE_BATHROOM.NAME: Private Bathroom
PRIVATE_BATHROOM.TOOLTIP: Duplicants relieve even more stress when using the toilet in a Private Bathroom than in a Latrine

PRIVATE_BEDROOM.DESCRIPTION: A comfortable, roommate-free retreat where tired Duplicants can get uninterrupted rest.\n\nSleeping in a Private Bedroom will greatly improve Duplicants' Morale.
PRIVATE_BEDROOM.NAME: Private Bedroom
PRIVATE_BEDROOM.TOOLTIP: Sleeping in a Private Bedroom will greatly improve Duplicants' Morale

REC_ROOM.DESCRIPTION: Where Duplicants go to mingle with off-duty peers and indulge in a little R&R.\n\nScheduled Downtime will further improve Morale for Duplicants visiting a Recreation Room.
REC_ROOM.NAME: Recreation Room
REC_ROOM.TOOLTIP: Scheduled Downtime will further improve Morale for Duplicants visiting a Recreation Room

SEARCH_TERMS.ATMOSUIT: Atmo Suit, Atmosuit, Jet Suit, Jetsuit

AQUATIC.DESC: The Aquatic Biome is flush with a huge deposit of precious <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.
AQUATIC.NAME: Aquatic Biome
AQUATIC.UTILITY: Initially there is very little solid ground in this biome to establish a temporary base, but once a transportation network can be established to send the <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> of the Aquatic Biome to the rest of the colony, the other elements will be easier to reach.\n\n<link=\"SANDSTONE\">Sandstone</link>, <link=\"MAFICROCK\">Mafic Rock</link>, <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link> and <link=\"SEDIMENTARYROCK\">Sedimentary Rock</link> provide readily available construction materials for setting up elementary infrastructure. The presence of <link=\"OXYROCK\">Oxylite</link> provides invaluable <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> which, through careful planning, should be able to sustain any Duplicants working in the area for a limited amount of time.

BARREN.DESC: Initial scans of this biome yield no signs of either <link=\"PLANTS\">plant life</link> or <link=\"CREATURES\">critters</link>. It is a land devoid of <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">liquids</link> and minuscule <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">gas</link> deposits. These dry, dusty plains can be mined for building materials but there is little in the way of life sustaining resources here for a colony.
BARREN.NAME: Barren Biome
BARREN.UTILITY:
The layers of sedimentary rock are predominantly made up of <link="GRANITE">Granite</link> deposits, although <link="OBSIDIAN">Obsidian</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> are also present. This suggests a history of volcanic activity, though no volcanoes exist here currently.

Veins of <link="IRON">Iron Ore</link> deposits are evident from initial scans, as are deposits of <link="CARBON">Coal</link>. Both are useful in setting up a colony's power infrastructure.

Though it lacks the crucial resources necessary to sustain a colony, there is nothing inherently dangerous here to harm my Duplicants. It should be safe enough to explore.

CARROTQUARRY.DESC: The Cool Pool Biome's chilly landscape features plentiful <link=\"ETHANOL\">Ethanol</link> lakes, making it an excellent destination for a colony eager to gather fuel resources.
CARROTQUARRY.NAME: Cool Pool Biome
CARROTQUARRY.UTILITY:
<link="CARROTPLANT">Plume Squash</link> is a calorie-dense crop that thrives in <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>, <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> and <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link> environments.

They make up the <link="BELLYSPECIES">Bammoths'</link> entire diet. These gentle giants are a joy to ranch, <link="MEAT">Meat</link>, <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link>, <link="CINNABARORE">Cinnabar Ore</link> and <link="BASICFABRIC">Reed Fiber</link>.

The latter is of particular importance, as my Duplicants will need to wear warmly insulated clothing if they are to survive these low temperatures.

Initial investigations also reveal an abundance of <link="IRONORE">Iron Ore</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> in this <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>-rich environment, ideal for industrial projects.

FOREST.DESC: Temperate and filled with unique <link=\"PLANTS\">Plant</link> life, this biome contains all the necessities for life support, although not in quantities sufficient to sustain a long term colony. Exploration into neighboring biomes should be a priority.
FOREST.NAME: Forest Biome
FOREST.UTILITY:
Small pockets of <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and <link="WATER">Water</link> are present in the Forest Biome, but calculations reveal they will only sustain the colony for a limited time.

Analysis shows two native plants which should be prioritized for cultivation: The <link="OXYFERN">Oxyfern</link>, which releases <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> but requires <link="WATER">Water</link>; and the <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link> which provides <link="WOOD">Wood</link> as a fuel source.

A symbiotic relationship exists with the <link="FORESTTREE">Arbor Tree</link> and the native <link="SQUIRRELSPECIES">Pips</link> which appear to be the only critter that can find the elusive <link="PLANTS">Arbor Acorns</link>.

This biome is really quite beautiful. I've noted that <link="LIGHTBUGSPECIES">Shine Bugs</link> and <link="LEAFYPLANT">Mirth Leaf</link> both evoke feelings of serenity in my Duplicants.

FROZEN.DESC: The sub-zero temperatures of the Tundra Biome provide rare frozen deposits of <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link> and <link=\"SNOW\">Snow</link>, necessary for a colony's <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> regulation needs.
FROZEN.NAME: Tundra Biome
FROZEN.UTILITY:
Far from devoid of life, this biome contains some much needed plant life, ripe for cultivation. <link="COLDWHEAT">Sleet Wheat</link> provides a nutrient rich ingredient for creating complex foods, though the plants do require sub-zero temperatures to thrive.

Fortunately <link="COLDBREATHER">Wheezewort</link> can been planted on farms to lower surrounding temperatures.

Crucially, small deposits of <link="WOLFRAMITE">Wolframite</link> have been detected here. This is an extremely rare metal that should be preserved for <link="TUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link> production.

Though my Duplicants appear more than happy to work in the Tundra Biome for short periods of time, I will need to provide proper <link="EQUIPMENT">equipment</link> for them to avoid adverse affects to their well-being if they are working here for longer periods.

GARDEN.DESC: The Garden biome is a temperate environment with beneficial critters and plants well-suited for <link=\"FARMING\">Farming</link>.
GARDEN.NAME: Garden Biome
GARDEN.UTILITY:
This biome is home to <link="STEGOSPECIES">Lumbs</link>, which assist in harvesting edible plants, and pollinator <link="BUTTERFLYSPECIES">Mimikas</link> which boost plant growth speeds.

<link="POWER">Power</link> systems built in this biome will benefit from <link="NICKELORE">Nickel Ore</link> and <link="PEAT">Peat</link> deposits, and with plenty of <link="SHALE">Shale</link> available, there is no lack of construction materials.

Colonists can rely on <link="GARDENFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Snactus</link> plants for life-sustaining calories in their early days. <link="VINEMOTHER">Ovagro Nodes</link> become efficient <link="FOOD">Food</link> crops when permitted to grow to their full extent, as their <link="WATER">Water</link> requirements do not increase with the number of <link="VINEFRUIT">Ovagro Fig</link>-bearing vines.

New colonies should be able to survive here with relative ease.

ICECAVES.DESC: The Ice Cave Biome's extremely low temperatures make thermal regulation the top priority.
ICECAVES.NAME: Ice Cave Biome
ICECAVES.UTILITY:
The below-freezing climate in this biome keeps elements frozen solid, but once a colony has established the means necessary to melt the abundant <link="ICE">Ice</link> deposits, it should be able to produce enough <link="WATER">Water</link> to meet its needs. Initial scans reveal the presence of <link="CINNABAR">Cinnabar Ore</link> that can be used in <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.

<link="STABLESNOW">Snow</link> is a readily available construction material. Note that its structural integrity may be undermined if surrounding areas become hot enough to trigger a state change.

<link="HARDSKINBERRY">Pikeapple Bushes</link> feed both Duplicants and the native <link="WOODDEER">Flox</link>, a critter whose <link="WOOD">Wood</link>, antlers offer a renewable source of fuel and attractive temperature-stable construction materials.

Although pockets of <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> allow Duplicants to begin the work of colony-building in this biome, the key to long-term survival is the cultivation of <link="BLUEGRASS">Alveo Vera</link> plants. They produce harvestable <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and their beauty--much like that of the dreamy <link="ICEFLOWER">Idylla Flower</link>--is a wonderful salve for existential dread.

JUNGLE.DESC: Initial investigations of the Jungle Biome reveal an ecosystem filled with unique flora but centered around <link=\"CHLORINE\">Liquid Chlorine</link> and <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link> gas, toxic to Duplicants. When exploring here, it is worth setting up a good system.
JUNGLE.NAME: Jungle Biome
JUNGLE.UTILITY:
The <link="DRECKOSPECIES">Drecko</link> is a relatively benign critter which can be domesticated to aid in textile and food production.

The <link="GLOMSPECIES">Morb</link>'s only function is to produce <link="POLLUTEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> which may be useful when establishing sustainable production loops with other critters.

<link="SWAMPLILY">Balm Lilies</link> would be useful to cultivate for the production of critical medical materials.

<link="SPICEVINE">Pincha Pepperplants</link> greatly improve the nutritional value and quality of a colony's food supply. Because of their unique relationship with gravity, the plants must be orientated upside-down for proper growing. This can be accomplished by using a <link="FARMTILE">Farm Tile</link>.

Given the toxic gases I will have to build a proper <link="BUILDCATEGORYHVAC">Ventilation</link> system to both protect my Duplicants and provide the optimum environments for the native plants and critters.

MAGMA.DESC: Temperatures in the Magma Biome can reach upwards of 1526 degrees, making it a reliable source of extreme heat that can be exploited for the purposes of producing <link=\"POWER\">Power</link> and fuel.
MAGMA.NAME: Magma Biome
MAGMA.UTILITY: <link=\"MAGMA\">Magma</link> is source of extreme <link=\"HEAT\">Heat</link> which can be used to transform <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> in to <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link> or <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link> into <link=\"PETROLEUM\">Petroleum</link>. In order to prevent the extreme temperatures of this biome invading other parts of my base, suitable insulation must be constructed using materials with high melting points like <link=\"CERAMIC\">Ceramic</link> or <link=\"OBSIDIAN\">Obsidian</link>.\n\nThough exosuits such as <link=\"ATMOSUIT\">Atmo Suits</link> and <link=\"JETSUIT\">Jet Suits</link> will provide some protection for my Duplicants, there is still a danger they will overheat if spending an extended amount of time in this Biome. I should ensure that suitable medical facilities have been constructed nearby to take care of any medical emergencies.

MARSH.DESC: <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link> dominates the atmosphere of the Marsh Biome as it escapes from the <link=\"SLIMEMOLD\">Slime</link> this biome is known for.
MARSH.NAME: Marsh Biome
MARSH.UTILITY: Marsh Biomes contain large amounts of <link=\"SLIMEMOLD\">Slime</link> which can be converted into <link=\"ALGAE\">Algae</link> and provide a valuable resource for growing <link=\"MUSHROOMPLANT\">Dusk Caps</link> as well as feeding to <link=\"PACUSPECIES\">Pacus</link> for producing some higher tier <link=\"FOOD\">food</link>.\n\nBecause of the high degree of probability that this biome will infect my Duplicants with <link=\"SLIMELUNG\">Slimelung</link>, it may be prudent to limit access to this area to essential activities only until my Duplicants are able to set up suitable protection.

METALLIC.DESC: A plethora of metals pervade the Metallic Biome making it the go-to destination for a colony ramping up production for technological advancement.
METALLIC.NAME: Metallic Biome
METALLIC.UTILITY:
<link="GOLDAMALGAM">Gold Amalgam</link>, <link="ALUMINUMORE">Aluminum Ore</link> and <link="COBALTITE">Cobalt Ore</link> are in abundant supply throughout this entire biome. Refining these metals with a <link="METALREFINERY">Metal Refinery</link> will make them available for building advanced technologies.

Though <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> and <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen Gas</link> are the prevailing gasses in this biome, <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> exists in rock form and can provide <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> for Duplicants once they uncover it.

<link="DIRT">Dirt</link>, <link="CARBON">Coal</link> and <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> round out the rest of this biome, making it a great deposit of resources for a budding industrialized colony.

MOO.DESC: The Moo Biome is the natural habitat of the charismatic <link=\"MOO\">Gassy Moo</link>, a great source of <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link>.
MOO.NAME: Moo Biome
MOO.UTILITY:
In addition to <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>, the highly toxic <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine</link> is also present in gas form. In fact, Chlorine is present here in <link="ELEMENTSGAS">gas</link>, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">liquid</link>, and <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">solid</link> states, largely due to the presence of <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleach Stone</link>.

<link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> and its denser form, <link="GRANITE">Granite</link>, provide some useful construction materials, but the real star of this biome are the <link="MOO">Gassy Moos</link> who consume <link="GASGRASS">Gas Grass</link> and excrete <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>. While Gassy Moos cannot be bred domestically, Gassy Mooteors regularly fall from space onto this biome, making it the best way to find a reliable source of these elusive creatures.

With no breathable <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> in this biome my Duplicants will need to be properly prepared before they venture too far into its depths.

NIOBIUM.DESC: The Niobium Biome features only two resources yet, because <link=\"NIOBIUM\">Niobium</link> is an extremely rare and valuable element, it is worth making a special visit.
NIOBIUM.NAME: Niobium Biome
NIOBIUM.UTILITY: By itself, <link=\"NIOBIUM\">Niobium</link> is not a particularly useful resource. But if processed through a <link=\"SUPERMETALREFINERY\">Molecular Forge</link>, it produces the extremely thermal conductive <link=\"TEMPCONDUCTORSOLID\">Thermium</link>, which goes a long way in solving many extreme temperature issues in a colony.\n\nThe edges of this biome are filled with <link=\"OBSIDIAN\">Obsidian</link> so a Duplicant with the <link=\"MINING3\">Super-Duperhard Digging</link> skill will be required before my colony can explore here.

OCEAN.DESC: <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link>, <link=\"SALT\">Salt</link> and <link=\"BLEACHSTONE\">Bleachstone</link> abound in this unique <link=\"BRINE\">briny</link> biome.
OCEAN.NAME: Ocean Biome
OCEAN.UTILITY:
<link="CRABSPECIES">Pokeshell</link> molt is an excellent source of <link="LIME">Lime</link> but much care must be taken with domesticating this species as it can get aggressive around its eggs.

Harvesting <link="SEALETTUCE">Waterweed</link> provides <link="LETTUCE">Lettuce</link> for many higher-tier <link="FOOD">foods</link>.

Any <link="WATER">Water</link> will need to be filtered through a <link="DESALINATOR">Desalinator</link> to remove the <link="SALT">Salt</link> in order to make it useful for my Duplicants. Luckily <link="SALT">Table Salt</link> can be produced using a <link="ROCKCRUSHER">Rock Crusher</link> which, when combined with a <link="DININGTABLE">Mess Table</link>, gives my Duplicants a <link="MORALE">Morale</link> boost.

OIL.DESC: Viscous pools of liquid <link=\"CRUDEOIL\">Crude Oil</link> pepper the <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>-rich environment of the Oil Biome.
OIL.NAME: Oily Biome
OIL.UTILITY:
Though <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> is more scarce in this biome, it's the perfect place to cultivate flora and fauna that thrive in CO2, such as <link="OILFLOATERSPECIES">Slicksters</link>. These critters can be domesticated as a renewable source of <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.

<link="DIAMOND">Diamond</link> deposits can occasionally be found in the Oily biome, which will require a Duplicant with the <link="MINING3">Super-Duperhard Digging</link> skill to explore properly.

<link="EVILFLOWER">Sporechids</link> are beautiful, but should only be approached if a Duplicant is properly <link="EQUIPMENT">equipped</link>.

While the dangers of this biome should not be underestimated, the benefits <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> and <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link> will bring to my colony far outweigh the risks.

RADIOACTIVE.DESC: A highly volatile environment containing a highly useful resource, this biome is invaluable when venturing into nuclear technologies.
RADIOACTIVE.NAME: Radioactive Biome
RADIOACTIVE.UTILITY:
<link="LEADSUIT">Lead Suits</link> are imperative if my Duplicants are going to start exploring this biome as <link="RADIATIONSICKNESS">Radioactive Contaminants</link> are a constant danger here.

<link="BEE">Beetas</link> pose a double threat as they are both highly radioactive and very aggressive. If they can be subdued, <link="BEEHIVE">Beeta Hives</link> provide a great service turning <link="URANIUMORE">Uranium Ore</link> into <link="ENRICHEDURANIUM">Enriched Uranium</link>.

While the Radioactive Biome, and the Beetas contained within it, should be avoided at all costs if my Duplicants do not have the correct protection, my colony will need to trek into this dangerous biome if we are going to build any higher-tier nuclear technologies.

RAPTOR.DESC: The chilly <link=\"FEATHERFABRIC\">Feather</link> biome is home to huge, flightless <link=\"RAPTORSPECIES\">Rhexes</link> that can be shorn for <link=\"CLOTHING\">Textile Production</link>.
RAPTOR.NAME: Feather Biome
RAPTOR.UTILITY:
<link="RAPTORSPECIES">Rhexes</link> are carnivorous critters who prey primarily on <link="CHAMELEONSPECIES">Dartles</link>. While both critters can be harvested for <link="FOOD">Food</link>, the <link="RAPTORSPECIES">Rhexes'</link> meat is too tough to be eaten raw.

This biome's flora includes the massive <link="DINOFERN">Megafrond</link> which enjoys a <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine Gas</link> environment, the <link="DEWDRIPPERPLANT">Dew Dripper</link> which can be processed into <link="MILK">Brackene</link>, and the cooling <link="COLDBREATHER">Wheezewort</link>.

Duplicants working and living in this environment will require protective <link="EQUIPMENT">equipment</link>.

REGOLITH.DESC: The Regolith Biome contains a bounty of <link=\"REGOLITH\">Regolith</link> which is very useful as a material for filtration.
REGOLITH.NAME: Regolith Biome
REGOLITH.UTILITY: Lingering within the layers of Regolith are the pernicious <link=\"MOLESPECIES\">Shove Voles</link> which eat valuable resources and excrete them at half the original mass.\n\nFortunately these pests can be wrangled up and used as a good food source for my Duplicants. However, extra care must be taken to contain these critters in pens made from either double thick walls or from <link=\"REFINEDMETAL\">Refined Metal</link> since they are capable of burrowing through most other materials.

RUST.DESC: The orange-brown oasis of the Rust Biome is home to many unusual flora and fauna. It contains the resources for several intermediate technologies.
RUST.NAME: Rust Biome
RUST.UTILITY:
When combined with the <link="RUSTDEOXIDIZER">Rust Deoxidizer</link>, <link="RUST">Rust</link> can produce many of a colony's basic needs.

The <link="PUFTBLEACHSTONE">Squeaky Puft</link>, a frequent resident of the Rust biome, is a renewable source of <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleachstone</link> and can be domesticated for such purposes.

<link="DRECKOS">Dreckos</link> can also sometimes be found in these biomes, which are a great source of <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link> and fibre for making <link="CLOTHING">Textile Production</link>.

Two plants found in this biome, the <link="BEANPLANTSEED">Nosh Bean</link> and the <link="SALTPLANT">Dasha Saltvine</link>, can both produce food that will add significant <link="MORALE">Morale</link> value for my Duplicants.

SANDSTONE.DESC: The Sandstone Biome is a temperate oasis with few inherent dangers. It's the perfect spot to get your colony up and running.
SANDSTONE.NAME: Sandstone Biome
SANDSTONE.UTILITY:
<link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> and <link="BASICFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Buried Muckroot</link> are in sufficient supply to sustain your colony while you gather more resources.

<link="DIRT">Dirt</link>, <link="ALGAE">Algae</link>, <link="COPPER">Copper</link> and, of course, <link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link> provide all the materials to get basic colony essentials built.

Random <link="LIGHTBUGSPECIES">Shine Bugs</link> provide <link="MORALE">Morale</link> boosts for my Duplicants but are not a reliable light source.

<link="HATCHSPECIES">Hatches</link> can be domesticated for food or <link="CARBON">Coal</link>, which will be useful if using a <link="GENERATOR">Coal Generator</link> for power.

All in all, this biome is the perfect starting spot for my colony to establish a base full of essentials, from which they can then venture out and explore.

SPACE.DESC: The Space Biome is located on the scenic surface of an asteroid. Watch for dazzling meteorites to shower elements down from the sky.
SPACE.NAME: Space Biome
SPACE.UTILITY: Setting up <link=\"SOLARPANEL\">Solar Panels</link> on the surface will provide a source of renewable energy. However, much care must be taken to ensure <link=\"ELEMENTSLIQUID\">Liquids</link> or <link=\"ELEMENTSGAS\">Gases</link> are not sucked out into the <link=\"VACUUM\">Vacuum</link> of space. <link=\"MOLE\">Shove Voles</link> are native to this biome, and need to be wrangled or contained or they will infest the colony.

SUGARWOODS.DESC: The <link=\"SNOW\">snow</link>-laden Nectar Biome is home to the massive <link=\"SPACETREE\">Bonbon Tree</link>. This complex plant produces <link=\"SUGARWATER\">Nectar</link>, which can be refined into <link=\"SUCROSE\">Sucrose</link> and <link=\"STEAM\">Steam</link>.
SUGARWOODS.NAME: Nectar Biome
SUGARWOODS.UTILITY:
<link="SEALSPECIES">Spigot Seals</link> consume this sweet liquid and produce <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link> to shore up a colony's fuel supplies. Spigot Seal ranches also yield <link="TALLOW">Tallow</link>, a greasy substance that can be used for  <link="FOOD">Food</link> or refined into <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link> to support local <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.

Beneath the <link="SNOW">Snow</link> and <link="ICE">Ice</link> are generous deposits of solid <link="MERCURY">Mercury</link>, a rare metal that can be liquefied for use in industrial cooling systems.

This biome is truly a sight to behold: in addition to the soft charm of the occasional <link="ICEFLOWER">Idylla Flower</link>, there is something quite heartwarming about the way that the <link="LIGHTBUG">Shine Bugs'</link> glowing lights glitter on the frozen landscape.

SWAMP.DESC: With its abundance of <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link> and lack of clean <style=\"KKeyword\">Water</style> the Swampy Biome presents some challenges for a budding colony. But, with a little hard work, it can also turn into a great starting biome with some valuable resources.
SWAMP.NAME: Swampy Biome
SWAMP.UTILITY:
<link="SWAMPFORAGEPLANTPLANTED">Swamp Chard</link> can provide adequate nutrients for my Duplicants while they establish farms, but it cannot be planted or propogated. <link="SWAMPHARVESTPLANT">Bog Buckets</link>, however, provide a sweet source of nutrients that are fairly easy to farm using <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> and require no extra light to grow.

Fortunately <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link> is abundant in this biome and will require a <link="WATERPURIFIER">Water Sieve</link> to turn into something my Duplicants can drink. Additionally my Duplicants can use a <link="SLUDGEPRESS">Sludge Press</link> to filter clean water from <link="MUD">Mud</link> (NOTE: <link="TOXICMUD">Polluted Mud</link>, however, does not make clean water).

Meanwhile, rudimentary power can be gained from the energy producing <link="STATERPILLAR">Plug Slugs</link> that inhabit this biome.

Shiny <link="COBALTITE">Cobalt Ore</link> can be found here, providing a adequate source of metal.

While much of this biome is dangerous for a new colony with some deliberate research and careful planning my Duplicants can not only survive but thrive here.

WASTELAND.DESC: While the Wasteland Biome does not look particularly interesting, a pragmatic colony can take advantage of its selection of construction resources.
WASTELAND.NAME: Wasteland Biome
WASTELAND.UTILITY:
The prevalance of <link="COPPER">Copper</link>, <link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link>, <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> and its <link="IRON">Iron</link>-rich counterpart <link="MAFICROCK">Mafic Rock</link>, make this a fruitful biome to explore for construction material. <link="SAND">Sand</link> is also in abundance here which is useful as a filtering material.

While the wildlife is not in abundance in the Wasteland Biome, the <link="DIVERGENTBEETLE">Sweetle</link> and <link="DIVERGENTWORM">Grubgrub</link> make interesting creatures to domesticate as they co-exist with the <link="WORMPLANT">Grubfruit Plants</link> to produce a much higher quality food than the <link="WORMPLANT">Spindly Grubfruit Plant</link> found in the wild. Additionally, the <link="SULFUR">Sulfur</link> found here works both as food for the GrubGrubs and fertilizer for the Grubfruit Plants.

The abundance of <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> found in the Wasteland Biome makes for a low-risk area to send my Duplicants into to collect useful resources to continue with their construction projects.

WETLANDS.DESC: This hot, sticky biome features plentiful pools of <link=\"DIRTYWATER\">Polluted Water</link>, as well as raw ingredients useful in establishing industrial systems.
WETLANDS.NAME: Wetlands Biome
WETLANDS.UTILITY: The carnivorous <link=\"FLYTRAPPLANT\">Lura Plant</link> traps airborne critters such as pesky <link=\"MOSQUITOSPECIES\">Gnits</link> and produces <link=\"AMBER\">Amber</link> that can be converted to <link=\"NATURALRESIN\">Resin</link> used for <link=\"POLYPROPYLENE\">Plastic</link> production. Local foliage also includes <link=\"KELPPLANT\">Seakombs</link>, which can be processed into <link=\"PHYTOOIL\">Phyto Oil</link>.\n\nAquatic behemoths called <link=\"PREHISTORICPACUSPECIES\">Jawbos</link> prey on <link=\"PACUSPECIES\">Pacus</link> and excrete hefty chunks of <link=\"RUST\">Rust</link>.

ALLRESOURCESSCREEN.NAME: Resource
ALLRESOURCESSCREEN.PIN_TOOLTIP: Check to pin resource to side panel

ASTEROIDCLOCK.MILESTONE_DESCRIPTION: This colony is about to hit Cycle {0}!

AUTOMATION.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYAUTOMATION\">Automation</link>
AUTOMATION.TOOLTIP: Automate my base with a wide range of sensors. {Hotkey}

BASE.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYBASE\">Base</link>
BASE.TOOLTIP: Maintain the colony's infrastructure with these homebase basics. {Hotkey}

CONVEYANCE.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYCONVEYANCE\">Shipping</link>
CONVEYANCE.TOOLTIP: Transport ore and solid materials around my base. {Hotkey}

EQUIPMENT.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYEQUIPMENT\">Stations</link>
EQUIPMENT.TOOLTIP: Unlock new technologies through the power of science! {Hotkey}

FOOD.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYFOOD\">Food</link>
FOOD.TOOLTIP: Keep my Duplicants' spirits high and their bellies full. {Hotkey}

FURNITURE.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYFURNITURE\">Furniture</link>
FURNITURE.TOOLTIP: Amenities to keep my Duplicants happy, comfy and efficient. {Hotkey}

HVAC.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYHVAC\">Ventilation</link>
HVAC.TOOLTIP: Control the flow of gas in the base. {Hotkey}

MEDICAL.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYMEDICAL\">Medicine</link>
MEDICAL.TOOLTIP: A cure for everything but the common cold. {Hotkey}

MISC.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYMISC\">Decor</link>
MISC.TOOLTIP: Spruce up my colony with some lovely interior decorating. {Hotkey}

OXYGEN.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYOXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>
OXYGEN.TOOLTIP: Everything I need to keep the colony breathing. {Hotkey}

PLUMBING.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYPLUMBING\">Plumbing</link>
PLUMBING.TOOLTIP: Get the colony's water running and its sewage flowing. {Hotkey}

POWER.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYPOWER\">Power</link>
POWER.TOOLTIP: Need to power the colony? Here's how to do it! {Hotkey}

REFINING.NAME: <link=\"BUILDCATEGORYREFINING\">Refinement</link>

GEYSERS.DESC:
Geysers and Fumaroles emit elements at variable intervals. They provide a sustainable source of material, albeit in typically low volumes.

The variable factors of a geyser are:

    • Emission element 
    • Emission temperature 
    • Emission mass 
    • Cycle length 
    • Dormancy duration 
    • Disease emitted

CRASHSCREEN.BODY: Help! A black hole ate my game!
CRASHSCREEN.REPORTEDERROR_FAILURE: Unable to report error. Please contact us using the bug tracker.
CRASHSCREEN.REPORTEDERROR_FAILURE_TOO_LARGE: Unable to report error. Save file is too large. Please contact us using the bug tracker.
CRASHSCREEN.REPORTEDERROR_SUCCESS: Thank you for reporting this error.
CRASHSCREEN.THANKYOU: Thank you!\n\nYou're making our game better, one crash at a time.
CRASHSCREEN.TITLE: \"Whoops! We're sorry, but it seems your game has encountered an error. It's okay though - these errors are how we find and fix problems to make our game more fun for everyone. If you use the box below to submit a crash report to us, we can use this information to get the issue sorted out.\"
CRASHSCREEN.TITLE_MODS: \"Oops-a-daisy! We're sorry, but it seems your game has encountered an error. If you uncheck all of the mods below, we will be able to help the next time this happens. Any mods that could be related to this error have already been unchecked.\"
CRASHSCREEN.UPLOAD_FAILED:
There was an issue in reporting this crash.

Please submit a bug report at:
<u>https://forums.kleientertainment.com/klei-bug-tracker/oni/</u>

DEMOOVERSCREEN.DESCRIPTION: Thank you for playing <color=#F44A47>Oxygen Not Included</color>!

LOADING.BODY:
This game is in the early stages of development which means you're likely to encounter strange, amusing, and occasionally just downright frustrating bugs.

During this time Oxygen Not Included will be receiving regular updates to fix bugs, add features, and introduce additional content, so if you encounter issues or just have suggestions to share, please let us know on our forums: <u>http://forums.kleientertainment.com</u>

A special thanks to those who joined us during our time in Alpha. We value your feedback and thank you for joining us in the development process. We couldn't do this without you.

Enjoy your time in deep space!

- Klei
LOADING.BODY_NOLINKS:
This DLC is currently in active development, which means you're likely to encounter strange, amusing, and occasionally just downright frustrating bugs.

 During this time Spaced Out! will be receiving regular updates to fix bugs, add features, and introduce additional content.

 We've got lots of content old and new to add to this DLC before it's ready, and we're happy to have you along with us. Enjoy your time in deep space!

 - The Team at Klei
LOADING.TITLE: Welcome to Oxygen Not Included!

DLC_BETA.BODY: You're about to opt in to the beta for The Bionic Booster Pack DLC. This free beta is a work in progress, and will be discontinued before the paid DLC is released. Are you sure you want to opt in?
DLC_BETA.TITLE: Welcome to Oxygen Not Included

PREVIOUS_UPDATE.BODY: Whoops! You're about to opt in to the Previous Update branch. That means opting out of all new features, fixes and content from the live branch. This branch is temporary. It will be replaced when the next update is released. It's also completely unsupported: please don't report bugs or issues you find here. Are you sure you want to opt in?
PREVIOUS_UPDATE.TITLE: Welcome to Oxygen Not Included

DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.TESTING_MESSAGE: This game is running a Test version of Oxygen Not Included. This means that some features may be in development or buggier than normal, and require more testing before they can be moved into the Release build.\n\nIf you encounter any bugs or strange behavior, please add a report to the bug forums. We appreciate it!

CLUSTERCATEGORYSELECTSCREEN.CLASSIC_DESC: Scenarios similar to the classic Oxygen Not Included experience. Large starting asteroids with many resources.\nLess emphasis on space travel.
CLUSTERCATEGORYSELECTSCREEN.EVENT_DESC: Alternative gameplay experiences, including experimental scenarios designed for special events.
CLUSTERCATEGORYSELECTSCREEN.SPACEDOUT_DESC: Scenarios designed for the Spaced Out! DLC.\nSmaller starting asteroids with resources distributed across the Starmap. More emphasis on space travel.

SAVETOCLOUD.TOOLTIP_EXTRA: This can be changed later with the colony management options in the load screen, from the main menu.
SAVETOCLOUD.TOOLTIP_LOCAL: This colony will be created in the local saves folder. It will not be a cloud save and will not be synced by the game platform.

FEW.NAME: Stingy
FEW.TOOLTIP: Not zero, but not a lot

LOTS.NAME: Oodles
LOTS.TOOLTIP: Plenty of story traits to go around

NONE.NAME: Zilch
NONE.TOOLTIP: Zero story traits. Zip. Nada. None

STORY_TRAIT_COUNT.NAME: Story Traits
STORY_TRAIT_COUNT.TOOLTIP: Determines the number of story traits spawned

DOOMED.NAME: Frankly Depressing
DOOMED.TOOLTIP: These Duplicants were never taught coping mechanisms... they're devastated by stress as a result

INDOMITABLE.NAME: Cloud Nine
INDOMITABLE.TOOLTIP: A strong emotional support system makes these Duplicants impervious to all stress

OPTIMISTIC.NAME: Chipper
OPTIMISTIC.TOOLTIP: Duplicants gain stress slower than usual

PESSIMISTIC.NAME: Glum
PESSIMISTIC.TOOLTIP: Duplicants gain stress more quickly than usual

STRESS.NAME: Stress
STRESS.TOOLTIP: Affects how quickly Duplicant stress rises

DEFAULT.NAME: Enabled
DEFAULT.TOOLTIP: Checked: Duplicants will wreak havoc when they reach 100% stress (Default)

DISABLED.NAME: Disabled
DISABLED.TOOLTIP: Unchecked: Duplicants will not wreak havoc at maximum stress

STRESS_BREAKS.NAME: Stress Reactions
STRESS_BREAKS.TOOLTIP: Determines whether Duplicants wreak havoc on the colony when they reach maximum stress

DISABLED.NAME: Disabled
DISABLED.TOOLTIP: This biome will not be mixed into any world
DISABLED.TOOLTIP_BASEGAME: This biome will not be mixed in

GUARANTEE_MIXING.NAME: Guaranteed
GUARANTEE_MIXING.TOOLTIP: This biome will be mixed into a world, even if it causes a worldgen failure
GUARANTEE_MIXING.TOOLTIP_BASEGAME: This biome will be mixed in, even if it causes a worldgen failure

TRY_MIXING.NAME: Likely
TRY_MIXING.TOOLTIP: This biome is very likely to be mixed into a world
TRY_MIXING.TOOLTIP_BASEGAME: This biome is very likely to be mixed in

DISABLED.NAME: Disabled
DISABLED.TOOLTIP: Unchecked: No Teleporters will spawn during Worldgen

ENABLED.NAME: Enabled
ENABLED.TOOLTIP: Checked: Teleporters will spawn during Worldgen (Default)

TELEPORTERS.NAME: Teleporters
TELEPORTERS.TOOLTIP: Determines whether teleporters will be spawned during Worldgen

DEMO_OVER_SCREEN.BODY:
Thank you for playing the demo for Oxygen Not Included!

This game is still in development.

Go to kleigames.com/o2 or ask one of us if you'd like more information.
DEMO_OVER_SCREEN.TITLE: Thanks for playing!

DEVTOOLS.TITLE: About Dev Tools
DEVTOOLS.WARNING:
DANGER!!

Dev Tools are intended for developer use only. Using them may result in your save becoming unplayable, unstable, or severely damaged.

These tools are completely unsupported and may contain bugs. Are you sure you want to continue?

FEEDBACK_SCREEN.ALT_DESCRIPTION:
Let us know if you encounter any problems or how we can improve your Oxygen Not Included experience.

When reporting a bug, please include your log and colony save file.

Thank you for being part of the Oxygen Not Included community!
FEEDBACK_SCREEN.DESCRIPTION:
Let us know if you encounter any problems or how we can improve your Oxygen Not Included experience.

When reporting a bug, please include your log and colony save file. The buttons to the right will help you find those files on your local drive.

Thank you for being part of the Oxygen Not Included community!
FEEDBACK_SCREEN.HEADER: We would love to hear from you!

SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES: Oxygen Not Included has had a major update since this save file was created! In addition to the multitude of bug fixes and quality-of-life features, please pay attention to these changes which may affect your existing colony:
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES_AIRFILTER: •Deodorizer now requires 5w Power.\n•Duplicants will get Stinging Eyes from gasses such as chlorine and hydrogen.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES_BUILDINGS: •The Oxygen Mask Station has been added to aid early-game exploration.\n•Use the new Meter Valves for precise control of resources in pipes.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES_FOOD: •Fridges are more effective for early-game food storage\n•Both freezing temperatures and a sterile gas are needed for total food preservation.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES_SIMULATION: •Many simulation bugs have been fixed.\n•This may change the effectiveness of certain contraptions and Steam Turbine setups.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.MERGEDOWNCHANGES_TITLE: BREATH OF FRESH AIR UPDATE CHANGES
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.NEWAUTOMATIONWARNING: The following buildings have acquired new automation ports!\n\nTake a moment to check whether these buildings in your colony are now unintentionally connected to existing <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>s.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SPACESCANNERANDTELESCOPECHANGES_SPACESCA: •<indent=20px>Automation is synced between all Space Scanners targeting the same object.</indent>\n•<indent=20px>Network quality based on the total percentage of sky covered.</indent>\n•<indent=20px>Industrial machinery no longer impacts network quality.</indent>
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SPACESCANNERANDTELESCOPECHANGES_SUMMARY: There have been significant changes to Space Scanners and Telescopes since this save file was created!\n\nMeteor showers have been disabled for 20 cycles to provide time to adapt.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SPACESCANNERANDTELESCOPECHANGES_TELESCOP: •<indent=20px>Telescopes have a symmetrical scanning range.</indent>\n•<indent=20px>Obstructions block visibility from the blocked tile out toward the outer edge of scanning range.</indent>
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SPACESCANNERANDTELESCOPECHANGES_WARNING: Please note these changes which may affect your existing colony:\n\n
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.SUDDENMORALEHELPER:
Welcome to the Expressive Upgrade! This update introduces a new Morale system that replaces Food and Decor Expectations that were found in previous versions of the game.

The game you are trying to load was created before this system was introduced, and will need to be updated. You may either:


1) Enable the new Morale system in this save, removing Food and Decor Expectations. It's possible that when you load your save your old colony won't meet your Duplicants' new Morale needs, so they'll receive a 5 cycle Morale boost to give you time to adjust.

2) Disable Morale in this save. The new Morale mechanics will still be visible, but won't affect your Duplicants' stress. Food and Decor expectations will no longer exist in this save.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHANGES_METER_VALVES: •<indent=20px>Meter valves no longer continuously reset when receiving a green signal.</indent>
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHANGES_MOOD: •<indent=20px>Critter moods have been expanded to include miserable and satisfied states: Miserable stops reproduction. Satisfied gives full metabolism and default reproduction.</indent>
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHANGES_PACU: •<indent=20px>Pacus have received a number of bug fixes and changes affecting their reproduction: Now correctly Confined when flopping or in less than 8 tiles of liquid. Easier to feed due to a rebalanced diet.</indent>
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHANGES_SUITCHECKPOINTS: •<indent=20px>Suit checkpoints now have an automation port to disable them so Duplicants can pass through. Some checkpoints may now be unintentionally connected to existing <link=\"LOGICWIRE\">Automation Wire</link>s.
SAVEUPGRADEWARNINGS.U50_CHANGES_SUMMARY: There have been significant changes to critters since this save file was created! Please check on your ranches.

JOBSSCREEN.HEADER_CHANGE_TOOLTIP: Set the priority for the <style=\"KKeyword\">{Job}</style> Errand Type colonywide\n
JOBSSCREEN.HEADER_TOOLTIP:
<size=16>{Job} Errand Type</size>

{Details}

Duplicants will first choose what <style="KKeyword">Errand Type</style> to perform based on <style="KKeyword">Duplicant Priorities</style>,
then they will choose individual tasks within that type using <style="KKeyword">Building Priorities</style> set by the <link="PRIORITIES">Priority Tool</link> {Hotkey/ManagePriorities}
JOBSSCREEN.NEW_MINION_ITEM_TOOLTIP: The {Job} Errand Type is automatically a {Priority} Priority for Arriving Duplicants
JOBSSCREEN.RESET_SETTINGS_TOOLTIP: Reset Priorities Returns all priorities to their default values. Proximity Enabled: Priorities will be adjusted high-to-low. Proximity Disabled: All priorities will be reset to neutral.
JOBSSCREEN.TITLE: MANAGE DUPLICANT PRIORITIES
JOBSSCREEN.TOGGLE_ADVANCED_MODE_TOOLTIP: Errand Proximity Settings Enabling Proximity settings tells my Duplicants to always choose the closest, most urgent errand to perform. When disabled, Duplicants will choose between two high priority errands based on a hidden priority hierarchy instead. Enabling Proximity helps cut down on travel time in areas with lots of high priority errands, and is useful for large colonies.
JOBSSCREEN.TOOLTIP_TOGGLE_ALL: Set priority of all Errand Types colonywide
JOBSSCREEN.TRAIT_DISABLED: {Name} possesses the {Trait} trait and cannot do {Job} Errands
