WORK.NAME: Work

HYGENE.DESCRIPTION: During Bathtime shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.\n\nOnce they're all caught up on personal hygiene, Duplicants will head back to work.
HYGENE.NAME: Bathtime
HYGENE.NOTIFICATION_TOOLTIP: During <style=\"KKeyword\">Bathtime</style> shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.

RECREATION.DESCRIPTION:
During Downtime my Duplicants they may do as they please.

This may include personal matters like bathroom visits or snacking, or they may choose to engage in leisure activities like socializing with friends.

Downtime increases Duplicant Morale.
RECREATION.NAME: Downtime
RECREATION.NOTIFICATION_TOOLTIP: During <style=\"KKeyword\">Downtime</style> shifts my Duplicants they may do as they please.

SLEEP.DESCRIPTION: My Duplicants use Bedtime shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.\n\nScheduling too few bedtime shifts may prevent my Duplicants from regaining enough Stamina to make it through the following day.
SLEEP.NAME: Bedtime
SLEEP.NOTIFICATION_TOOLTIP: My Duplicants use <style=\"KKeyword\">Bedtime</style> shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.

WORKTIME.DESCRIPTION: During Work shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I have placed for them throughout the colony.\n\nIt's important when scheduling to maintain a good work-life balance for my Duplicants to maintain their health and prevent Morale loss.
WORKTIME.NAME: Work
WORKTIME.NOTIFICATION_TOOLTIP: During <style=\"KKeyword\">Work</style> shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I've placed for them throughout the colony.

SCHEDULESCREEN.ALARM_BUTTON_OFF_TOOLTIP:
Toggle Notifications

No sounds or notifications will play for this schedule.

DISABLED
(ClickType/Click) to enable
SCHEDULESCREEN.ALARM_BUTTON_ON_TOOLTIP:
Toggle Notifications

Sounds and notifications will play when shifts change for this schedule.

ENABLED
(ClickType/Click) to disable
SCHEDULESCREEN.DELETE_SCHEDULE_TIMETABLE: Delete this row\n\nSchedules must have two or more rows in order for one row to be deleted
SCHEDULESCREEN.DELETE_SCHEDULE_TOOLTIP: Remove this schedule and unassign all Duplicants from it
SCHEDULESCREEN.DUPLICANT_EARLYBIRD_TOOLTIP: Early Bird\n• All Attributes +2 in the morning
SCHEDULESCREEN.RESET_SETTINGS_TOOLTIP: Restore this schedule to default shifts
SCHEDULESCREEN.SCHEDULE_DOWNTIME_MORALE: Duplicants will receive {0} Morale from the scheduled Downtime shifts
SCHEDULESCREEN.SHIFT_SCHEDULE_DOWN_TOOLTIP: Swap this row with the one below it
SCHEDULESCREEN.SHIFT_SCHEDULE_UP_TOOLTIP: Swap this row with the one above it

ASSIGNMENT_REQUIREMENTS.EXPECTATION_ALERT_DESC_EXPECTATION: This Duplicant's Morale is too low to handle the rigors of this position, which will cause them Stress over time.

MASTERY.PREVENTED_BY_TRAIT: • This Duplicant possesses the <style=\"KKeyword\">{0}</style> Trait and cannot learn this Skill
MASTERY.SKILL_APTITUDE: {0} is interested in {1} and will receive a <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale</style> bonus for learning it!
MASTERY.SKILL_GRANTED: {0} has been granted {1} by a Trait, but does not have increased <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale Requirements</style> from learning it
MASTERY.STRESS_WARNING_MESSAGE: Learning {0} will put {1} into a <style=\"KKeyword\">Morale</style> deficit and cause unnecessary <style=\"KKeyword\">Stress</style>!

SKILLS_SCREEN.BIONIC_UPGRADE_SLOT_AVAILABLE: No booster installed\n\nAssign a booster from the menu below or craft new boosters at the <link=\"CRAFTINGTABLE\">Crafting Station</link>
SKILLS_SCREEN.BIONIC_UPGRADE_SLOT_LOCKED: This booster slot is unavailable\n\nBooster slots can be unlocked using <style=\"KKeyword\">Skill Points</style>

AMELIASWATCH.ARTIFACT: This watch once belonged to pioneering aviator Amelia Earhart and travelled to space via astronaut Dr. Shannon Walker.\n\nHow it came to be floating in space is a matter of speculation, but perhaps the adventurous spirit of its original stewards became infused within the fabric of this timepiece and compelled the universe to launch it into the great unknown.
AMELIASWATCH.DESCRIPTION: It was discovered in a package labeled \"To be entrusted to Dr. Walker\".
AMELIASWATCH.NAME: Wrist Watch

BIOLUMINESCENTROCK.ARTIFACT: The microscopic organisms within this rock are of a unique variety whose genetic code shows many tell-tale signs of being genetically engineered within a lab.\n\nFurther analysis reveals they share 99.999% of their genetic code with Shine Bugs.
BIOLUMINESCENTROCK.DESCRIPTION: A thriving colony of tiny, microscopic organisms is responsible for giving it its bluish glow.
BIOLUMINESCENTROCK.NAME: Bioluminescent Rock

BLENDER.ARTIFACT: Trace amounts of edible foodstuffs present in this blender indicate that it was probably used to emulsify the ingredients of a mush bar.\n\nIt is also very likely that it was employed at least once in the production of a peanut butter and banana smoothie.
BLENDER.DESCRIPTION: Equipment used to conduct experiments answering the age-old question, \"Could that blend\"?
BLENDER.NAME: Blender

BRICKPHONE.ARTIFACT: This cordless phone once held a direct line to an unknown location in which strange distant voices can be heard but not understood, nor interacted with.\n\nThough Gravitas spent a lot of money and years of study dedicated to discovering its secret, the mystery was never solved.
BRICKPHONE.NAME: Strange Brick

DNAMODEL.ARTIFACT: A physical representation of the building blocks of life.\n\nThis one contains trace amounts of a Genetic Ooze prototype that was once used by Gravitas.
DNAMODEL.DESCRIPTION: An educational model of genetic information.
DNAMODEL.NAME: Double Helix Model

EGGROCK.ARTIFACT: The words \"Happy Farters Day Dad. Love Macy\" appear on the bottom of this rock, written in a childlish scrawl.
EGGROCK.DESCRIPTION: It's unclear whether this is its naturally occurring shape, or if its appearance as been sculpted.
EGGROCK.NAME: Egg-Shaped Rock

FOUNTAINPEN.ARTIFACT: The handcrafted gold nib features a triangular logo with the letters V and I inside.\n\nIts owner was too proud to report it stolen, and would be shocked to learn of its whereabouts.
FOUNTAINPEN.DESCRIPTION: It cuts through red tape better than a sword ever could.
FOUNTAINPEN.NAME: Fountain Pen

GRUBSTATUE.ARTIFACT: It's very likely this statue was placed in a hidden, secluded place in the Gravitas laboratory since the creation of Grubgrubs was a closely held secret that the general public was not privy to.\n\nThis is a shame since the artistic quality of this statue is really quite accomplished.
GRUBSTATUE.DESCRIPTION: A moving tribute to a tiny plant hugger.
GRUBSTATUE.NAME: Grubgrub Statue

HATCHFOSSIL.ARTIFACT: The preservation of this skeleton occurred artificially using a technique called the \"The Ali Method\".\n\nIt should be noted that this fossilization technique was pioneered by one Dr. Ashkan Seyed Ali, an employee of Gravitas.
HATCHFOSSIL.DESCRIPTION: The preserved bones of an early species of Hatch.
HATCHFOSSIL.NAME: Pristine Fossil

HONEYJAR.ARTIFACT: Records from the Genetics and Biology Lab of the Gravitas facility show that several early iterations of a radioactive Bee would continue to produce honey and that this honey was once accidentally stored in the employee kitchen which resulted in several incidents of minor radiation poisoning when it was erroneously labled as a sweetener for tea.\n\nEmployees who used this product reported that it was the \"sweetest honey they'd ever tasted\" and expressed no regret at the mix-up.
HONEYJAR.DESCRIPTION: Sweet golden liquid with just a touch of uranium.
HONEYJAR.NAME: Honey Jar

MAGMALAMP.ARTIFACT: Molten lava and obsidian combined in a way that allows the lava to maintain just enough heat to remain in liquid form.\n\nPlans of this lamp found in the Gravitas archives have been attributed to one Robin Nisbet, PhD.
MAGMALAMP.NAME: Magma Lamp

MODERNART.ARTIFACT: A sculpture of the Neoplastism movement of Modern Art.\n\nGravitas records show that this piece was once used in a presentation called 'Form and Function in Corporate Aesthetic'.
MODERNART.NAME: Modern Art

MOLDAVITE.ARTIFACT: This extremely rare, museum grade moldavite once sat on the desk of Dr. Ren Sato, but it was stolen by some unknown person.\n\nDr. Sato suspected the perpetrator was none other than Director Stern, but was never able to confirm this theory.
MOLDAVITE.DESCRIPTION: A unique green stone formed from the impact of a meteorite.
MOLDAVITE.NAME: Moldavite

MOODRING.ARTIFACT: A wholly unique ring not found anywhere outside of the Gravitas Laboratory.\n\nThough it can't be determined for sure who worked on this extraordinary curiousity it's worth noting that, for his Ph.D. thesis, Dr. Travaldo Farrington wrote a paper entitled \"Novelty Uses for Radiochromatic Dyes\".
MOODRING.NAME: Radiation Mood Ring

MOONMOONMOON.ARTIFACT: In contrast to most moons, this object's glowing properties do not come from reflecting an external source of light, but rather from an internal glow of mysterious origin.\n\nThe glow of this object also grants an extraordinary amount of Decor bonus to nearby Duplicants, almost as if it was designed that way.
MOONMOONMOON.DESCRIPTION: A moon's moon's moon. It's very small.
MOONMOONMOON.NAME: Moonmoonmoon

OBELISK.ARTIFACT: On close inspection this rectangle is actually a stone box built with a covert, almost seamless, lid, housing a tiny key.\n\nIt is still unclear what the key unlocks.
OBELISK.DESCRIPTION: A rectangular stone piece.\n\nIts function is unclear.
OBELISK.NAME: Small Obelisk

OFFICEMUG.ARTIFACT: An office mug with the Gravitas logo on it. Though their office mugs were all emblazoned with the same logo, Gravitas colored their mugs differently to distinguish between their various departments.\n\nThis one is from the AI department.
OFFICEMUG.DESCRIPTION: An intermediary place to store espresso before you move it to your mouth.
OFFICEMUG.NAME: Office Mug

OKAYXRAY.ARTIFACT: The description on this X-ray indicates that it was taken in the Gravitas Medical Facility.\n\nMost likely this X-ray was performed while investigating an injury that occurred within the facility.
OKAYXRAY.DESCRIPTION: Ew, weird. It has five fingers!
OKAYXRAY.NAME: Old X-Ray

ORACLE.ARTIFACT: All of the parts for this contraption are recycled from projects abandoned by the Robotics department.\n\nThe design is very close to one published in an amateur DIY magazine that once sat in the lobby of the 'Employees Only' area of Gravitas' facilities.
ORACLE.NAME: Useless Machine

PACUPERCOLATOR.ARTIFACT: A coffee percolator with the remnants of a blend of coffee that was a personal favorite of Dr. Hassan Aydem.\n\nHe would specifically reserve the consumption of this particular blend for when he was reviewing research papers on Sunday afternoons.
PACUPERCOLATOR.DESCRIPTION: Don't drink from it! There was a pacu... IN the percolator!
PACUPERCOLATOR.NAME: Percolator

PLASMALAMP.ARTIFACT: The bottom of this lamp contains the words 'Property of the Atmospheric Sciences Department'.\n\nIt's worth noting that the Gravitas Atmospheric Sciences Department once simulated an experiment testing the feasibility of survival in an environment filled with noble gasses, similar to the ones contained within this device.
PLASMALAMP.DESCRIPTION: No space colony is complete without one.
PLASMALAMP.NAME: Plasma Lamp

PLASTICFLOWERS.ARTIFACT: Manufactured and sold by a home staging company hired by Gravitas to \"make Space feel more like home.\"\n\nThis bouquet is designed to smell like freshly baked cookies.
PLASTICFLOWERS.DESCRIPTION: Maintenance-free blooms that will outlast us all.
PLASTICFLOWERS.NAME: Plastic Flowers

RAINBOWEGGROCK.ARTIFACT: The words \"Happy Father's Day, Dad. Love you!\" appear on the bottom of this rock, written in very neat handwriting. The words are surrounded by four hearts drawn in what appears to be a pink gel pen.
RAINBOWEGGROCK.DESCRIPTION: It's unclear whether this is its naturally occurring shape, or if its appearance as been sculpted.\n\nThis one is rainbow colored.
RAINBOWEGGROCK.NAME: Egg-Shaped Rock

REACTORMODEL.ARTIFACT: Though this Nuclear Power Plant was never built, this model exists as an artifact to a time early in the life of Gravitas when it was researching all alternatives to solving the global energy problem.\n\nUltimately, the idea of building a Nuclear Power Plant was abandoned in favor of the \"much safer\" alternative of developing the Temporal Bow.
REACTORMODEL.NAME: Model Nuclear Power Plant

ROBOTARM.ARTIFACT: A commercially available robot arm that has had a significant amount of modifications made to it.\n\nThe initials B.A. appear on one of the fingers.
ROBOTARM.NAME: Robot Arm

ROCKTORNADO.ARTIFACT: Speculations about the origin of this rock include a paper written by one Harold P. Moreson, Ph.D. in which he theorized it could be a rare form of hollow geode which failed to form any crystals inside.\n\nThis paper appears in the Gravitas archives, and in all probability, was one of the factors in the hiring of Moreson into the Geology department of the company.
ROCKTORNADO.DESCRIPTION: It's unclear how it formed, although I'm glad it did.
ROCKTORNADO.NAME: Tornado Rock

RUBIKSCUBE.ARTIFACT: A well-used, competition-compliant version of the popular puzzle cube.\n\nIt's worth noting that Dr. Dylan 'Nails' Winslow was once a regional Rubik's Cube champion.
RUBIKSCUBE.DESCRIPTION: This mystery of the universe has already been solved.
RUBIKSCUBE.NAME: Rubik's Cube

SANDSTONE.ARTIFACT: This sample of sandstone appears to have been processed by the Gravitas Mining Gun that was made available to the general public.\n\nNote: The Gravitas public Mining Gun model is different than ones used by Duplicants in its larger size, and extra precautionary features added in order to be compliant with national safety standards.
SANDSTONE.DESCRIPTION: A beautiful rock composed of multiple layers of sediment.
SANDSTONE.NAME: Sandstone

SAXOPHONE.ARTIFACT: Though it is often remarked that \"in space, no one can hear you scream\", Thomas Pesquet proved the same cannot be said for the smooth jazzy sounds of a saxophone.\n\nAlthough this instrument once belonged to the eminent French Astronaut its current bumped and bent shape suggests it has seen many adventures beyond that of just being used to perform an out-of-this-world saxophone solo.
SAXOPHONE.DESCRIPTION: The name \"Pesquet\" is barely legible on the inside.
SAXOPHONE.NAME: Mangled Saxophone

SHIELDGENERATOR.ARTIFACT: The energy field produced by this shield generator completely ignores those light behaviors which are wave-like and focuses instead on its particle behaviors.\n\nThis seemingly paradoxical state is possible when light is slowed down to the point at which it stops entirely.
SHIELDGENERATOR.DESCRIPTION: A mechanical prototype capable of producing a small section of shielding.
SHIELDGENERATOR.NAME: Shield Generator

SINK.ARTIFACT: A small trace of encrusted soap on this sink strongly suggests it was installed in a personal bathroom, rather than a public one which would have used a soap dispenser.\n\nThe soap sliver is light blue and contains a manufactured blueberry fragrance.
SINK.DESCRIPTION: No collection is complete without it.
SINK.NAME: Sink

SOLARSYSTEM.ARTIFACT: This marvel of a device was built using parts from an old Tornado-in-a-Box science fair project.\n\nVery faint, faded letters are still visible on the display bottom that read 'Camille P. Grade 5'.
SOLARSYSTEM.DESCRIPTION: A marvel of the cosmos, inside this display is an entirely self-contained solar system.
SOLARSYSTEM.NAME: Self-Contained System

STETHOSCOPE.ARTIFACT: The size and shape of this stethescope suggests it was not intended to be used by neither a human-sized nor a Duplicant-sized person but something half-way in between the two beings.
STETHOSCOPE.DESCRIPTION: Listens to Duplicant heartbeats, or gurgly tummies.
STETHOSCOPE.NAME: Stethoscope

TEAPOT.ARTIFACT: The amount of Neutronium present in this teapot suggests that it has crossed the threshold of the spacetime continuum on countless occasions, floating through many multiple universes over a plethora of times and spaces.\n\nThough there are, theoretically, an infinite amount of outcomes to any one event over many multi-verses, the homogeneity of the still relatively young multiverse suggests that this is then not the only teapot which has crossed into multiple universes. Despite the infinite possible outcomes of infinite multiverses it appears one high probability constant is that there is, or once was, a teapot floating somewhere in space within every universe.
TEAPOT.DESCRIPTION: A teapot from the depths of space, coated in a thick layer of Neutronium.
TEAPOT.NAME: Encrusted Teapot

VHS.ARTIFACT: The label on this VHS tape reads \"Jackie and Olivia's House Warming Party\".\n\nUnfortunately, a device with which to play this recording no longer exists in this universe.
VHS.DESCRIPTION: Be kind when you handle it. It's very fragile.
VHS.NAME: Archaic Tech

GRAVITASSPACESTATION1.DESC: The remnants of a bygone era, lost in time.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION1.NAME: Destroyed Satellite

GRAVITASSPACESTATION2.DESC: A defunct rocket from a corporation that vanished long ago.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION2.NAME: Demolished Rocket

GRAVITASSPACESTATION3.DESC: The ruins of a rocket that stopped functioning ages ago.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION3.NAME: Ruined Rocket

GRAVITASSPACESTATION4.DESC: A rocket part from a society that has been wiped out.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION4.NAME: Retired Planetary Excursion Module

GRAVITASSPACESTATION5.DESC: A destroyed Gravitas satellite.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION5.NAME: Destroyed Satellite

GRAVITASSPACESTATION6.DESC: The remains of a satellite made some time in the past.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION6.NAME: Annihilated Satellite

GRAVITASSPACESTATION7.DESC: A defunct space shuttle that floats through space unattended.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION7.NAME: Wrecked Space Shuttle

GRAVITASSPACESTATION8.DESC: The module from a space station that ceased to exist ages ago.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
GRAVITASSPACESTATION8.NAME: Obsolete Space Station Module

RUSSELLSTEAPOT.DESC: Has never been disproven to not exist.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Gathering</link> space junk requires a rocket equipped with an <link=\"ARTIFACTCARGOBAY\">Artifact Transport Module</link>.
RUSSELLSTEAPOT.NAME: Russell's Teapot

CARBONACEOUSASTEROID.DESCRIPTION: A common asteroid containing several useful resources.
CARBONACEOUSASTEROID.NAME: Carbon Asteroid

GOLDASTEROID.DESCRIPTION: A rich asteroid with thin gold coating and veins of gold deposits throughout.
GOLDASTEROID.NAME: Gilded Asteroid

METALLICASTEROID.DESCRIPTION: A shimmering conglomerate of various metals.
METALLICASTEROID.NAME: Metallic Asteroid

OILYASTEROID.DESCRIPTION: A viscous asteroid that is only loosely held together. Contains fossil fuel resources.
OILYASTEROID.NAME: Oily Asteroid

ROCKYASTEROID.DESCRIPTION: A minor mineral planet. Unlike a comet, it does not possess a tail.
ROCKYASTEROID.NAME: Rocky Asteroid

COPPER.DESCRIPTION: A shower of metallic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
COPPER.NAME: Copper Meteor

IRON.DESCRIPTION: A shower of metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
IRON.NAME: Iron Meteor

LARGEIMACTOR.DESCRIPTION: An ancient impactor asteroid on a collision course with the surface of this world.
LARGEIMACTOR.NAME: Demolior

BLEACHSTONE.DESCRIPTION: A shower of bleach stone meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
BLEACHSTONE.NAME: Bleach Stone Meteor Shower

COPPER.DESCRIPTION: A shower of metallic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
COPPER.NAME: Copper Meteor Shower

GOLD.DESCRIPTION: A shower of shiny metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
GOLD.NAME: Gold Meteor Shower

HEAVYDUST.DESCRIPTION: A dark cloud of heavy dust meteors heading towards the surface of an asteroid.
HEAVYDUST.NAME: Dense Dust Meteor Shower

ICE.DESCRIPTION: A hailstorm of icy space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
ICE.NAME: Ice Meteor Shower

ICEANDTREES.DESCRIPTION: A hailstorm of sweet, icy space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid
ICEANDTREES.NAME: Icy Nectar Meteor Shower

IRON.DESCRIPTION: A shower of metallic space rocks on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
IRON.NAME: Iron Meteor Shower

LIGHTDUST.DESCRIPTION: A cloud-like shower of dust fluff meteors heading towards the surface of an asteroid.
LIGHTDUST.NAME: Dust Fluff Meteor Shower

MOO.DESCRIPTION: A herd of methane-infused meteors that cause a bit of a stink, but do no actual damage.
MOO.NAME: Gassy Mooteor Shower

OXYLITE.DESCRIPTION: A shower of rocky, oxygen-rich meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
OXYLITE.NAME: Oxylite Meteor Shower

REGOLITH.DESCRIPTION: A shower of rocky meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
REGOLITH.NAME: Regolith Meteor Shower

SLIME.DESCRIPTION: A shower of slimy, biodynamic meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
SLIME.NAME: Slimy Meteor Shower

SNOW.DESCRIPTION: A shower of cold, cold meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
SNOW.NAME: Blizzard Meteor Shower

UNIDENTIFIED.DESCRIPTION: A cosmic anomaly is traveling through the galaxy.\n\nIts origins and purpose are currently unknown, though a <link=\"CLUSTERTELESCOPE\">Telescope</link> could change that.
UNIDENTIFIED.NAME: Unidentified Object

URANIUM.DESCRIPTION: A toxic shower of radioactive meteors on a collision course with the surface of an asteroid.
URANIUM.NAME: Uranium Meteor Shower

SATELLITE.DESCRIPTION: An artificial construct that has escaped its orbit. It no longer appears to be monitored.
SATELLITE.NAME: Satellite

DUSTYDWARF.DESCRIPTION: A loosely held together composite of minerals.
DUSTYDWARF.NAME: Dusty Dwarf

ICYDWARF.DESCRIPTION: A terrestrial destination, frozen completely solid.
ICYDWARF.NAME: Interstellar Ice

ORGANICDWARF.DESCRIPTION: A mass of organic material similar to the ooze used to print Duplicants. This sample is heavily degraded.
ORGANICDWARF.NAME: Organic Mass

REDDWARF.DESCRIPTION: An M-class star orbited by clusters of extractable aluminum and methane.
REDDWARF.NAME: Red Dwarf

SALTDWARF.DESCRIPTION: A dwarf planet with unusually high sodium concentrations.
SALTDWARF.NAME: Salty Dwarf

GASGIANT.DESCRIPTION: A massive volume of <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link> formed around a small solid center.
GASGIANT.NAME: Gas Giant

HYDROGENGIANT.DESCRIPTION: A massive volume of <link=\"HELIUM\">Helium</link> formed around a small solid center.
HYDROGENGIANT.NAME: Helium Giant

ICEGIANT.DESCRIPTION: A massive volume of frozen material, primarily composed of <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>.
ICEGIANT.NAME: Ice Giant

CARBONASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid containing <link=\"REFINEDCARBON\">Refined Carbon</link> and <link=\"CARBON\">Coal</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
CARBONASTEROIDFIELD.NAME: Carbon Asteroid Field

CHLORINECLOUD.DESC: A cloud of harvestable debris containing <link=\"CHLORINEGAS\">Chlorine Gas</link> and <link=\"BLEACHSTONE\">Bleach Stone</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
CHLORINECLOUD.NAME: Chlorine Cloud

DLC2CERESFIELD.DESC: The harvestable remains of a planet containing <link=\"CINNABAR\">Cinnabar</link>, <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link> and <link=\"MERCURY\">Mercury</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC2CERESFIELD.NAME: Frozen Cinnabar Asteroid Field

DLC2CERESOREFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"CINNABAR\">Cinnabar</link>, <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link> and <link=\"MERCURY\">Mercury</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC2CERESOREFIELD.NAME: Frozen Mercury Asteroid Field

DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD1.DESC: The solid harvestable remains of Demolior, containing <link=\"IRIDIUM\">Iridium</link>, <link=\"MAFICROCK\">Mafic Rock</link>, <link=\"GOLD\">Gold</link>, and <link=\"GRANITE\">Granite</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD1.NAME: Demolior Debris

DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD2.DESC: The harvestable liquid remains of Demolior, containing <link=\"ISORESIN\">Isosap</link>, <link=\"PETROLEUM\">Petroleum</link>, and <link=\"LIQUIDSULFUR\">Liquid Sulfur</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD2.NAME: Liquid Demolior Debris

DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD3.DESC: The harvestable molten remains of Demolior, containing <link=\"MOLTENIRIDIUM\">Molten Iridium</link>, <link=\"MAGMA\">Magma</link>, <link=\"LIQUIDOXYGEN\">Liquid Oxygen</link>, and <link=\"LIQUIDHYDROGEN\">Liquid Hydrogen</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC4IMPACTORDEBRISFIELD3.NAME: Molten Demolior Debris

DLC4PREHISTORICMIXINGFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"NICKELORE\">Nickel Ore</link>, <link=\"PEAT\">Peat</link>, <link=\"AMBER\">Amber</link> and <link=\"SHALE\">Shale</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC4PREHISTORICMIXINGFIELD.NAME: Conductive Ore Field

DLC4PREHISTORICOREFIELD.DESC: The harvestable remains of a planet containing <link=\"NICKELORE\">Nickel Ore</link>, <link=\"PEAT\">Peat</link>, <link=\"AMBER\">Amber</link> and <link=\"SHALE\">Shale</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
DLC4PREHISTORICOREFIELD.NAME: Amber Field

FORESTYOREFIELD.DESC: A field of harvestable resources containing <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>, <link=\"IGNEOUSROCK\">Igneous Rock</link> and <link=\"ALUMINUMORE\">Aluminum Ore</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
FORESTYOREFIELD.NAME: Forested Ore Field

FROZENOREFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"DIRTYICE\">Polluted Ice</link>, <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>, <link=\"SNOW\">Snow</link> and <link=\"ALUMINUMORE\">Aluminum Ore</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

GASGIANTCLOUD.NAME: Exploded Gas Giant

GILDEDASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"GOLD\">Gold</link>, <link=\"FULLERENE\">Fullerene</link>, <link=\"REGOLITH\">Regolith</link> and more.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
GILDEDASTEROIDFIELD.NAME: Gilded Asteroid Field

GLIMMERINGASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"TUNGSTEN\">Tungsten</link>, <link=\"WOLFRAMITE\">Wolframite</link> and more.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
GLIMMERINGASTEROIDFIELD.NAME: Glimmering Asteroid Field

HELIUMCLOUD.DESC: A cloud of resources containing <link=\"WATER\">Water</link> and <link=\"HYDROGEN\">Hydrogen Gas</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
HELIUMCLOUD.NAME: Helium Cloud

ICEASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: A cloud of planetary remains containing <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>, <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>, <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link> and <link=\"METHANE\">Natural Gas</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

INTERSTELLARICEFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>, <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link> and <link=\"OXYGEN\">Oxygen</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

METALLICASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"IRON\">Iron</link>, <link=\"COPPER\">Copper</link>, <link=\"LEAD\">Lead</link>, and <link=\"OBSIDIAN\">Obsidian</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

OXYGENRICHASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>, <link=\"CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN\">Polluted Oxygen</link> and <link=\"WATER\">Water</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

RADIOACTIVEASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"BLEACHSTONE\">Bleach Stone</link>, <link=\"RUST\">Rust</link>, <link=\"URANIUMORE\">Uranium Ore</link> and <link=\"SULFUR\">Sulfur</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

RADIOACTIVEGASCLOUD.NAME: Radioactive Gas Cloud

ROCKYASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"GRANITE\">Granite</link>, <link=\"KATAIRITE\">Abyssalite</link>, <link=\"SEDIMENTARYROCK\">Sedimentary Rock</link>, and <link=\"IGNEOUSROCK\">Igneous Rock</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.

SALTYASTEROIDFIELD.DESC: A field of harvestable resources containing <link=\"SALTWATER\">Salt Water</link>,<link=\"BRINE\">Brine</link> and <link=\"CARBONDIOXIDE\">Carbon Dioxide</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
SALTYASTEROIDFIELD.NAME: Salty Asteroid Field

SANDYOREFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"SANDSTONE\">Sandstone</link>, <link=\"ALGAE\">Algae</link>, <link=\"CUPRITE\">Copper Ore</link> and <link=\"SAND\">Sand</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
SANDYOREFIELD.NAME: Sandy Ore Field

SATELLITEFIELD.NAME: Space Debris

SWAMPYOREFIELD.DESC: An asteroid field containing <link=\"MUD\">Mud</link>, <link=\"TOXICSAND\">Polluted Dirt</link> and <link=\"COBALTITE\">Cobalt Ore</link>.\n\n<link=\"EXOBASESDLC1\">Space mining</link> requires a rocket equipped with a <link=\"NOSECONEHARVEST\">Drillcone</link> and a cargo module.
SWAMPYOREFIELD.NAME: Swampy Ore Field

CHLORINEPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A noxious planet permeated by unbreathable chlorine.
CHLORINEPLANET.NAME: Chlorine Planet

DLC2CERESSPACEDESTINATION.DESCRIPTION: A frozen planet peppered with cinnabar deposits.
DLC2CERESSPACEDESTINATION.NAME: Ceres

DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION.DESCRIPTION: The remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of iridium.
DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION.NAME: Demolior Debris

DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION2.DESCRIPTION: The liquid remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of isosap.
DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION2.NAME: Liquid Demolior Debris

DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION3.DESCRIPTION: The hot metallic remains of an obliterated asteroid containing a renewable source of iridium.
DLC4PREHISTORICDEMOLIORSPACEDESTINATION3.NAME: Molten Demolior Debris

DLC4PREHISTORICSPACEDESTINATION.DESCRIPTION: A destination with extractable resources from another era.
DLC4PREHISTORICSPACEDESTINATION.NAME: Prehistoric Ore Field

FORESTPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A small green planet displaying several markers of primitive life.
FORESTPLANET.NAME: Living Planet

RUSTPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A small planet covered in large swathes of brown rust.
RUSTPLANET.NAME: Oxidized Asteroid

SALTDESERTPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A sweltering, desert-like planet covered in surface salt deposits.
SALTDESERTPLANET.NAME: Arid Planet

SHATTEREDPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A once-habitable planet that has sustained massive damage.\n\nA powerful containment field prevents our rockets from traveling to its surface.
SHATTEREDPLANET.NAME: Shattered Planet

SHINYPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A planet composed of rare, shimmering minerals. From the distance, it looks like gem in the sky.
SHINYPLANET.NAME: Glimmering Planet

TERRAPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A planet with a walkable surface, though it does not possess the resources to sustain long-term life.
TERRAPLANET.NAME: Terrestrial Planet

VOLCANOPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A large terrestrial object composed mainly of molten rock.
VOLCANOPLANET.NAME: Volcanic Planet

RESEARCHDESTINATION.DESCRIPTION: Our researchers would have a field day with this if they could only get close enough.
RESEARCHDESTINATION.NAME: Alluring Anomaly

WORMHOLE.DESCRIPTION: The source of our misfortune, though it may also be our shot at freedom. Traces of Neutronium are detectable in my readings.
WORMHOLE.NAME: Temporal Tear

STARMAP.NO_ROCKETS_HELP_TEXT:
Rockets allow you to visit nearby celestial bodies.

Each rocket must have a Command Module, an Engine, and Fuel.

You can also carry other modules that allow you to gather specific resources from the places you visit.

Remember the more weight a rocket has, the more limited it'll be on the distance it can travel. You can add more fuel to fix that, but fuel will add weight as well.
STARMAP.REPLENISH_RATE_TOOLTIP: The rate at which this destination regenerates resources

TOOLTIPS.JOBSSCREEN_PRIORITY: High priority tasks are always performed before low priority tasks.\n\nHowever, a busy Duplicant will continue to work on their current work errand until it's complete, even if a more important errand becomes available.

TOOLTIPS.MANAGEMENTMENU_REQUIRES_RESEARCH: Build a Research Station to unlock this menu\n\nThe Research Station can be found in the Stations Tab {Hotkey/Plan10} of the Build Menu
TOOLTIPS.MANAGEMENTMENU_REQUIRES_SKILL_STATION: Build a Printing Pod to unlock this menu\n\nThe Printing Pod can be found in the Base Tab {Hotkey/Plan1} of the Build Menu

READLORE.ALREADY_SEARCHED: I already took everything of interest from this. I can check the Database to re-read what I found.
READLORE.ALREADY_SEARCHED_STERNSDESK: The desk is eerily empty inside.
READLORE.NAME: Inspect
READLORE.SEARCH_CABINET: One intact document remains - an old yellowing newspaper clipping. It won't be of much use, but I add it to my database nonetheless.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH1: Unfortunately, the computer's hard drive is irreparably corrupted.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH2: The computer was wiped clean before I got here. There is nothing to recover.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH3: Some intact files are available on the computer, but nothing I haven't already discovered elsewhere. I find nothing else.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH4: The computer has nothing of import.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH5: Someone's left a solitaire game up. There's nothing else of interest on the computer.\n\nAlso, it looks as though they were about to lose.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH6: The background on this computer depicts two kittens hugging in a field of daisies. There is nothing else of import to be found.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH7: The user alphabetized the shortcuts on their desktop. There is nothing else of import to be found.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH8: The background is a picture of a golden retriever in a science lab. It looks very confused. There is nothing else of import to be found.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_FAIL.SEARCH9: This user never changed their default background. There is nothing else of import to be found. How dull.

SEARCH_COMPUTER_PODIUM.SEARCH1: I search through the computer's database and find an unredacted e-mail.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.

SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH1: After searching through the computer's database, I managed to piece together some files that piqued my interest.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH2: Searching through the computer, I find some recoverable files that are still readable.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH3: The computer looks pristine on the outside, but is corrupted internally. Still, I managed to find one uncorrupted file, and have added it to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH4: The computer was wiped almost completely clean, except for one file hidden in the recycle bin.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH5: I search the computer, storing what useful data I can find in my own memory.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_COMPUTER_SUCCESS.SEARCH6: This computer is broken and requires some finessing to get working. Still, I recover a handful of interesting files.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.

READLORE.SEARCH_CRYO_TANK: There are some safety instructions included in the operating instructions of this Cryotank. I add them to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
READLORE.SEARCH_DISPLAY: The display is still functional. I copy its message into my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

SEARCH_DISPLAY_FAIL.SEARCH1: The display is frozen. Whatever information it once contained is long gone.

READLORE.SEARCH_ELLIESDESK: All I find on the machine is a curt e-mail from a disgruntled employee.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

SEARCH_MIRROR_FAIL.SEARCH1: There's nothing to see here but the streaks left by a distracted cleaner.

SEARCH_MIRROR_SUCCESS.SEARCH1: I look behind the mirror and find a recording device taped to the back.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.

SEARCH_OBJECT_FAIL.SEARCH1: I look around but find nothing of interest.

SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH1: I look around and recover an old file.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH2: There's a three-ringed binder inside. I scan the surviving documents.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH3: A discarded journal inside remains mostly intact. I scan the pages of use.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH4: A single page of a long printout remains legible. I scan it and add it to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH5: A few loose papers can be found inside. I scan the ones that look interesting.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_OBJECT_SUCCESS.SEARCH6: I find a memory stick inside and copy its data into my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

READLORE.SEARCH_POD: I search my incoming message history and find a single entry. I move the odd message into my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
READLORE.SEARCH_PROPGRAVITASCREATUREPOSTER: There's a handwritten note taped to the back of this poster. I add it to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

SEARCH_SPACEPOI_FAIL.SEARCH1: There's nothing of interest left in this old space junk.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_FAIL.SEARCH2: I've salvaged everything I can from this vehicle.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_FAIL.SEARCH3: Years of neglect and radioactive decay have destroyed all the useful data from this derelict spacecraft.

SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH1: A quick analysis of the hardware of this debris has uncovered some searchable files within.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH2: There's an archaic interface I can interact with on this device.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH3: While investigating the software of this wreckage, a compelling file comes to my attention.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH4: Not much remains of the software that once ran this spacecraft except for one file that piques my interest.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH5: I find some noteworthy data hidden amongst the system files of this space junk.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.
SEARCH_SPACEPOI_SUCCESS.SEARCH6: Despite being subjected to years of degradation, there are still recoverable files in this machinery.\n\nNew Database Entry unlocked.

READLORE.SEARCH_STERNSDESK: There's an old magazine article from a publication called the \"Nucleoid\" tucked in the top drawer. I add it to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

SEARCH_TECHNOLOGY_SUCCESS.SEARCH1: I scour the internal systems and find something of interest.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_TECHNOLOGY_SUCCESS.SEARCH2: I see if I can salvage anything from the electronics. I add what I find to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
SEARCH_TECHNOLOGY_SUCCESS.SEARCH3: I look for anything of interest within the abandoned machinery and add what I find to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.

READLORE.SEARCH_TELEPORTER_RECEIVER: Incongruously placed research notes are hidden within the operating instructions of this device. I add them to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
READLORE.SEARCH_TELEPORTER_SENDER: While scanning the antiquated computer code of this machine I uncovered some research notes. I add them to my database.\n\nNew Database Entry discovered.
READLORE.TOOLTIP_ALREADYINSPECTED: This structure has already been inspected

UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY: I've awoken at the target location, but colonization efforts have already hit a hitch. I was supposed to land on the planet's surface, but became trapped many miles underground instead.\n\nAlthough the conditions are not ideal, it's imperative that I establish a colony here and begin mounting efforts to escape.
UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC2_CERES:
The ambient temperatures of this planet are inhospitably low.

I've detected the ruins of a scientifically advanced settlement buried deep beneath our landing site.

If my Duplicants can survive the journey into this frosty planet's core, we could use this newfound technology to build a colony like no other.
UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC4_PREHISTORIC: My collision monitoring system has detected an imminent threat to our survival: a huge impactor asteroid is hurtling directly at this planet.\n\nWe must make our way to the surface and mount a defense system in time to destroy the incoming asteroid before it destroys us.
UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_DLC4_PREHISTORIC_SHAT:
Impactor asteroid collision in 10 cycles!

My scans indicate that the impact will trigger the eruption of all geysers that surround our landing site. There are...so many.

Initiate survival procedures immediately.
UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_KF23: This asteroid is oddly tilted, as though a powerful external force once knocked it off its axis.\n\nI'll need to recalibrate my approach to colony-building in order to make the most of this unusual distribution of resources.
UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY_SPACEDOUT: The asteroid we call home has collided with an anomalous planet, decimating our colony. Rebuilding it is of the utmost importance.\n\nI've detected a new cluster of material-rich planetoids in nearby space. If I can guide the Duplicants through the perils of space travel, we could build a colony even bigger and better than before.

WORLDGEN.BORDERS5: Avoiding awkward eye contact with the void...

WORLDGEN.FAILED: Goodness, has this ever gone terribly wrong!

BADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Badlands poses no immediate threats, but sparse resource availability will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
BADLANDS.NAME: The Badlands

BIGEMPTY.DESCRIPTION: A big ol' biome-free spacerock for claustrophobic devs.
BIGEMPTY.NAME: Big Empty FOR DEVS

CERESBASEGAME.DESCRIPTION: A frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
CERESBASEGAME.NAME: Ceres

CERESBASEGAMESHATTERED.DESCRIPTION: The heavily damaged remnants of a frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Exploring the rubble of Blasted Ceres's sub-zero temperatures is particularly challenging, yet natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
CERESBASEGAMESHATTERED.NAME: Blasted Ceres

CERESCLASSIC.DESCRIPTION: A frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
CERESCLASSIC.NAME: Ceres Asteroid

CERESCLASSICSHATTERED.DESCRIPTION: The heavily damaged remnants of a frosty location with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Exploring the rubble of Blasted Ceres's sub-zero temperatures is particularly challenging, yet natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
CERESCLASSICSHATTERED.NAME: Blasted Ceres

CERESMIXING.DESCRIPTION: A fragment of a frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
CERESMIXING.NAME: Ceres Fragment

CERESSPACEDOUT.DESCRIPTION: A smaller frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants who work in Ceres's sub-zero temperatures will need to wear or build warming equipment. Abundant natural fuel sources could lead to a well-powered colony.</smallcaps>
CERESSPACEDOUT.NAME: Ceres Minor

FORESTMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small moon with a forest start.\n\n<smallcaps>Folia Asteroids have plenty of organic material but Duplicants will have to venture outside their starting biome quickly to find any metal.</smallcaps>
FORESTMOONLET.NAME: Folia Asteroid

FOREST_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A location with a natural abundance of trees.

<smallcaps>Colonizing Arboria will require careful planning right from the start. Because of its lack of metals, finding biological solutions to problems is a must.</smallcaps>
FOREST_DEFAULT.NAME: Arboria

FOREST_HOT.DESCRIPTION:
A location with oppressively hot temperatures.

<smallcaps>Temperatures on Aridio are much higher than expected. While resources are abundant, maintaining food and infrastructure could be difficult as our colony warms.</smallcaps>
FOREST_HOT.NAME: Aridio

FOREST_LUSH.DESCRIPTION:
A lush location rich in wildlife and life-sustaining resources.

<smallcaps>Establishing a foothold on Verdante will be challenging due to reduced food and oxygen options. However, abundant biological and mineral resources should afford excellent long-term growth.</smallcaps>
FOREST_LUSH.NAME: Verdante

HELICONA.DESCRIPTION:
Due to its highly elliptical orbit around its host star, this rock is cold. Oh so very cold.

<smallcaps></smallcaps>
HELICONA.NAME: Helicona

IDEALLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION: A sandstone and forest world with significant radiation.\n\n<smallcaps>Irradiated Forest Asteroids have an abundance of metal for the taking if Duplicants can withstand the planetoid's radiation.</smallcaps>
IDEALLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Forest Asteroid

MARSHYMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small location with an abundance of marshland.\n\n<smallcaps>While Marshy Asteroids offer an abundance of organic resources like Slime Mold and Algae, their air quality poses a significant disease risk for Duplicants.</smallcaps>
MARSHYMOONLET.NAME: Marshy Asteroid

MEDIUMFORESTYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANE.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish forested asteroid with a frozen radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>While Radioactive Forest Asteroid are largely foresty, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMFORESTYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANE.NAME: Radioactive Forest Asteroid

MEDIUMFORESTYWASTELAND.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish forested asteroid with a frozen radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>While Glowood Wasteland Asteroids are largely foresty, they also contain a great deal of rust and wasteland.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMFORESTYWASTELAND.NAME: Glowood Wasteland Asteroid

MEDIUMRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish partially frozen world with a radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>While Radioactive Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANET.NAME: Radioactive Swamp Asteroid

MEDIUMSANDYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANET.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish terra world with a radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>The Radioactive Terra Asteroid is fairly dry and sandy, but does contain areas of jungle.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMSANDYRADIOACTIVEVANILLAWARPPLANET.NAME: Radioactive Terra Asteroid

MEDIUMSANDYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish terra world with a radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>The Radioactive Terrabog Asteroid is fairly dry and sandy, but does contain swampy areas with a partially frozen surface.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMSANDYSWAMP.NAME: Radioactive Terrabog Asteroid

MEDIUMSWAMPY.DESCRIPTION: A large-ish, polluted swamp world.\n\n<smallcaps>Stinko Swamp Asteroids are full of swampy and marshy areas, but also contain a variety of other biomes diverse enough to keep a determined colony supplied with essentials.</smallcaps>
MEDIUMSWAMPY.NAME: Stinko Swamp Asteroid

METALHEAVYLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION: A marshy world with significant radiation.\n\n<smallcaps>Irradiated Marsh Asteroids have an abundance of metal for the taking if Duplicants can withstand the planetoid's radiation.</smallcaps>
METALHEAVYLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Marsh Asteroid

MINIBADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources and oil.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Desolands poses no immediate threats, but the limited variety of resources will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
MINIBADLANDS.NAME: The Desolands Asteroid

MINIFLIPPED.DESCRIPTION:
An asteroid in which the surface is molten hot lava and the core is livable.

<smallcaps>The lava surface of the Flipped Asteroid will make it challenging to start a rocketry program.</smallcaps>
MINIFLIPPED.NAME: Flipped Asteroid

MINIFORESTFROZEN.DESCRIPTION:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>The Frozen Forest Asteroid's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic.</smallcaps>
MINIFORESTFROZEN.NAME: Frozen Forest Asteroid

MINIMETALLICSWAMPY.DESCRIPTION: A small swampy world with an abundance of renewable metal.\n\n<smallcaps>Metallic Swampy Asteroids have a high concentration of metal and a swampy, polluted atmosphere.</smallcaps>
MINIMETALLICSWAMPY.NAME: Metallic Swampy Asteroid

MINIRADIOACTIVEOCEAN.DESCRIPTION:
An irradiated world with renewable water sources.

<smallcaps>Both the radioactive biome and the ocean biome present unique challenges yet considerable payoffs.</smallcaps>
MINIRADIOACTIVEOCEAN.NAME: Radioactive Ocean Asteroid

MINISHATTEREDGEO.DESCRIPTION: A molten mini asteroid with a failed experiment buried inside.\n\n<smallcaps>Extremely high temperatures threaten colony safety but could yield an unimaginably powerful payoff.</smallcaps>
MINISHATTEREDGEO.NAME: Ceres Core Asteroid

MINISHATTEREDSTART.DESCRIPTION: A battered chunk of a smaller frosty starting world with sub-zero temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Surviving Ceres Mantle's frigid landscape is no easy task, but natural fuel sources provide a valuable payoff.</smallcaps>
MINISHATTEREDSTART.NAME: Ceres Mantle Asteroid

MINISHATTEREDWARP.DESCRIPTION: A small, snow-laden world rich with oil and nectar resources.\n\n<smallcaps>Sub-zero temperatures pose unique challenges but the potential for power production is very valuable.</smallcaps>
MINISHATTEREDWARP.NAME: Sweet Ceres Asteroid

MOOMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small world with unique local lifeforms.\n\n<smallcaps>Moo Asteroids are the natural breeding ground of Gassy Moos due to their abundance of Gas Grass and Methane.</smallcaps>
MOOMOONLET.NAME: Moo Asteroid

MOON_BARREN.DESCRIPTION:
A smaller planetoid in orbit around a larger, resource rich world.

<smallcaps>Barren Moons are rich in minerals, but Duplicants will need to branch out into space early to find the resources the colony needs to stay alive.</smallcaps>
MOON_BARREN.NAME: Barren Moon

NIOBIUMMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small location with an abundance of solid Niobium.\n\n<smallcaps>Superconductive Asteroids offer rich veins of Niobium to Duplicants that can withstand its molten rivers of magma.</smallcaps>
NIOBIUMMOONLET.NAME: Superconductive Asteroid

OASIS.DESCRIPTION:
A desolate location with a cache of life-sustaining water trapped beneath the surface.

<smallcaps>A wide underground desert will pose temperature threats and strain the resources of a colony on Oasisse. However, surviving the challenge should present great industrial opportunities.</smallcaps>
OASIS.NAME: Oasisse

OCEANIA.DESCRIPTION:
A location with vast quantities of undrinkable salt water.

<smallcaps>Oceania is quite stable and resource rich, but the majority of the area is covered in a saltwater ocean. Careful expansion and resource usage should lead to a successful colony.</smallcaps>
OCEANIA.NAME: Oceania

OILRICHWARPTARGET.DESCRIPTION: A rusty world with an oily core.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants must sift through a great deal of rust and ocean to reach the prize of this planetoid's oil.</smallcaps>
OILRICHWARPTARGET.NAME: Rusty Oil Asteroid

OILYMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small location with an abundance of fossil fuels.\n\n<smallcaps>Viscosia Asteroids are filled with valuable crude oil, natural gas, and ethanol deposits at the expense of other essential resources. Early expansion to other planetoids will be essential for survival.</smallcaps>
OILYMOONLET.NAME: Viscosia Asteroid

PREHISTORICBASEGAME.DESCRIPTION: An endangered location with abundant food resources.\n\n<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
PREHISTORICBASEGAME.NAME: Relica

PREHISTORICCLASSIC.DESCRIPTION: An endangered starting world with abundant food resources.\n\n<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
PREHISTORICCLASSIC.NAME: Relica Asteroid

PREHISTORICMIXING.DESCRIPTION: A fragment of a prehistoric starting world.\n\n<smallcaps>Its biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. </smallcaps>
PREHISTORICMIXING.NAME: Relica Fragment

PREHISTORICSHATTERED.DESCRIPTION: A geyser-rich location that will be struck by an impactor asteroid almost immediately.\n\n<smallcaps>Impact-related damage will trigger the eruption of this world's unusually high number of geysers. Colonies that survive the volatile aftermath will reap the benefits of the abundant natural resources released into the environment.</smallcaps>
PREHISTORICSHATTERED.NAME: RelicAAAA<sup>AAAGHH</sup>

PREHISTORICSPACEDOUT.DESCRIPTION: A smaller endangered starting world with abundant food resources.\n\n<smallcaps>Relica's biodiversity makes reliable food production more attainable for new colonies. Construction materials and fuels are also ample. Surface defence must be prioritized to minimize damage from an incoming impactor asteroid.</smallcaps>
PREHISTORICSPACEDOUT.NAME: Relica Minor

REGOLITHMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small, cold world with plenty of craters.\n\n<smallcaps>Regolith Asteroids have frequent meteor showers and are chock-full of Regolith, an incredibly useful filtration material. </smallcaps>
REGOLITHMOONLET.NAME: Regolith Asteroid

SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A promising location with a balanced variety of resources.

<smallcaps>Terra meets all the requirements for Duplicant life and holds no surprises. It's an ideal location for a first attempt at establishing a colony.</smallcaps>
SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.NAME: Terra

SANDSTONE_FROZEN.DESCRIPTION:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Rime's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic. However, the wide spectrum of minerals and cool environment could lead to thriving industry.</smallcaps>
SANDSTONE_FROZEN.NAME: Rime

STRANGERICHSANDSTONE.DESCRIPTION: A petite rocky world with an oily core.\n\n<smallcaps>Though it looks deceptively nondescript from space, readings from this planet suggest a strong fuel source lurks somewhere beneath the surface.</smallcaps>
STRANGERICHSANDSTONE.NAME: Rocky Asteroid

STRANGE_ASTEROID_KF23.DESCRIPTION:
A tilted world, at once strange and...strangely familiar. Its singular terrain is consistent across all universes.

This resistance to the fluidity of temporal shifts has the cosmos buzzing, as individual colonies compare notes on successes, failures and the bizarre redistribution of resources.

<smallcaps>Released for Klei Fest 2023.
STRANGE_ASTEROID_KF23.NAME: Skewed Asteroid

SULFURMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A smaller landmass with a distinct odor.\n\n<smallcaps>Brimstonia Asteroids contain an abundant supply of Sulfur.</smallcaps>
SULFURMOONLET.NAME: Brimstonia Asteroid

SWAMPMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A large, polluted swamp world.\n\n<smallcaps>Quagmiris Asteroids are a great mass of frozen slush and wasteland. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
SWAMPMOONLET.NAME: Quagmiris Asteroid

SWAMPYLANDINGSITE.DESCRIPTION: A small swampy world with a radioactive core.\n\n<smallcaps>Irradiated Swamps have a high concentration of rare swampy and radioactive resources but are also chocked full of dangers.</smallcaps>
SWAMPYLANDINGSITE.NAME: Irradiated Swampy Asteroid

TERRAMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A balanced variety of resources on a smaller sandstone world.\n\n<smallcaps>Terrania Asteroids have everything needed to start a colony in a compact area. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
TERRAMOONLET.NAME: Terrania Asteroid

TINYEMPTY.DESCRIPTION: A fun-sized 'fixer upper', perfect for game devs.
TINYEMPTY.NAME: Tiny Empty FOR DEVS

TINYFOREST.DESCRIPTION: A petite forest world for nature loving devs.
TINYFOREST.NAME: Tiny Forest FOR DEVS

TINYICE.DESCRIPTION: A tiny ice cold world for dev snow forts.
TINYICE.NAME: Tiny Ice FOR DEVS

TINYMAGMA.DESCRIPTION: A small hellscape just for devs.
TINYMAGMA.NAME: Tiny Magma FOR DEVS

TINYSTART.DESCRIPTION: A cozy little starter location, just for devs.
TINYSTART.NAME: Tiny Start FOR DEVS

TINYSURFACE.DESCRIPTION: A cute little Dev location, with scenic space views.
TINYSURFACE.NAME: Tiny Surface FOR DEVS

TUNDRAMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small frozen planetoid with sub-zero temperatures.\n\n<smallcaps>Duplicants that travel to Tundra Asteroids will need to wear protective gear due to its harsh environment.</smallcaps>
TUNDRAMOONLET.NAME: Tundra Asteroid

TWINMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: Two small dev worlds for the price of one.
TWINMOONLET.NAME: Tiny Twin Asteroid FOR DEVS

VANILLAARBORIA.DESCRIPTION: A location with a natural abundance of trees.\n\n<smallcaps>Colonizing Arboria will require careful planning right from the start. Because of its lack of metals, finding biological solutions to problems is a must.</smallcaps>
VANILLAARBORIA.NAME: Arboria Asteroid

VANILLAARIDIO.DESCRIPTION: A location with oppressively hot temperatures.\n\n<smallcaps>Temperatures on Aridio are much higher than expected. While resources are abundant, maintaining food and infrastructure could be difficult as our colony warms.</smallcaps>
VANILLAARIDIO.NAME: Aridio Asteroid

VANILLABADLANDS.DESCRIPTION: A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources.\n\n<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Badlands poses no immediate threats, but sparse resource availability will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
VANILLABADLANDS.NAME: The Badlands Asteroid

VANILLAFORESTDEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A lush location rich in wildlife and life-sustaining resources.

<smallcaps>Establishing a foothold on Verdante will be challenging due to reduced food and oxygen options. However, abundant biological and mineral resources should afford excellent long-term growth.</smallcaps>
VANILLAFORESTDEFAULT.NAME: Verdante Asteroid

VANILLAOASIS.DESCRIPTION: A desolate location with a cache of life-sustaining water trapped beneath the surface.\n\n<smallcaps>A wide underground desert will pose temperature threats and strain the resources of a colony on Oasisse. However, surviving the challenge should present great industrial opportunities.</smallcaps>
VANILLAOASIS.NAME: Oasisse Asteroid

VANILLAOCEANIA.DESCRIPTION: A location with vast quantities of unpotable salt water.\n\n<smallcaps>Oceania is quite stable and resource rich, but the majority of the area is covered in a saltwater ocean. Careful expansion and resource usage should lead to a successful colony.</smallcaps>
VANILLAOCEANIA.NAME: Oceania Asteroid

VANILLASANDSTONEDEFAULT.DESCRIPTION:
A promising location with a balanced variety of resources.

<smallcaps>Terra meets all the requirements for Duplicant life and holds no surprises. It's an ideal location for a first attempt at establishing a colony.</smallcaps>
VANILLASANDSTONEDEFAULT.NAME: Terra Asteroid

VANILLASANDSTONEFROZEN.DESCRIPTION: A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.\n\n<smallcaps>Rime's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic. However, the wide spectrum of minerals and cool environment could lead to thriving industry.</smallcaps>
VANILLASANDSTONEFROZEN.NAME: Rime Asteroid

VANILLASWAMPDEFAULT.DESCRIPTION: A large, polluted swamp world.\n\n<smallcaps>Squelchy Asteroids are a great mass of frozen slush and wasteland. With a short distance to the surface, inter-world travel can be achieved quickly.</smallcaps>
VANILLASWAMPDEFAULT.NAME: Squelchy Asteroid

VANILLAVOLCANIC.DESCRIPTION: A location rife with molten lava pockets and intense heat.\n\n<smallcaps>Volcanea would be perfect if it wasn't for the volcanoes. Digging carefully and managing the temperatures in our colony will be essential to success.</smallcaps>
VANILLAVOLCANIC.NAME: Volcanea Asteroid

VOLCANIC.DESCRIPTION:
A location rife with molten lava pockets and intense heat.

<smallcaps>Volcanea would be perfect if it wasn't for the volcanoes. Digging carefully and managing the temperatures in our colony will be essential to success.</smallcaps>
VOLCANIC.NAME: Volcanea

WARPOILYSANDYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION: A mildly frozen world with an oily core.\n\n<smallcaps>While Oily Sandy Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of wasteland.</smallcaps>
WARPOILYSANDYSWAMP.NAME: Oily Sandy Swamp Asteroid

WARPOILYSWAMP.DESCRIPTION: A partially frozen world with an oily core.\n\n<smallcaps>While Oily Swamp Asteroids are largely swampy, they also contain a great deal of rust.</smallcaps>
WARPOILYSWAMP.NAME: Oily Swamp Asteroid

WATERMOONLET.DESCRIPTION: A small, water-submerged world.\n\n<smallcaps>Water Asteroids possess a variety of liquid resources and are a natural source of Graphite, but Duplicants should come prepared for a swim.</smallcaps>
WATERMOONLET.NAME: Water Asteroid

BOULDERS_LARGE.DESCRIPTION: Huge boulders make digging through this world more difficult
BOULDERS_LARGE.NAME: Large Boulders

BOULDERS_MEDIUM.DESCRIPTION: Mid-sized boulders make digging through this world more difficult
BOULDERS_MEDIUM.NAME: Medium Boulders

BOULDERS_MIXED.DESCRIPTION: Boulders of various sizes make digging through this world more difficult
BOULDERS_MIXED.NAME: Mixed Boulders

BOULDERS_SMALL.DESCRIPTION: Tiny boulders make digging through this world more difficult
BOULDERS_SMALL.NAME: Small Boulders

CRASHED_SATELLITES.DESCRIPTION: This world contains crashed radioactive satellites
CRASHED_SATELLITES.NAME: Crashed Satellites

DEEP_OIL.DESCRIPTION: Most of the <style=\"KKeyword\">Oil</style> in this world will need to be extracted with <link=\"OILWELLCAP\">Oil Well</link>s
DEEP_OIL.NAME: Trapped Oil

DISTRESS_SIGNAL.DESCRIPTION: This world contains a frozen friend from a long time ago
DISTRESS_SIGNAL.NAME: Frozen Friend

FROZEN_CORE.DESCRIPTION: This world has a chilly core of solid <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link>
FROZEN_CORE.NAME: Frozen Core

GEOACTIVE.DESCRIPTION: This world has more <style=\"KKeyword\">Geysers</style> and <style=\"KKeyword\">Vents</style> than usual
GEOACTIVE.NAME: Geoactive

GEODES.DESCRIPTION: Large geodes containing rare material caches are deposited across this world
GEODES.NAME: Geodes

GEODORMANT.DESCRIPTION: This world has fewer <style=\"KKeyword\">Geysers</style> and <style=\"KKeyword\">Vents</style> than usual
GEODORMANT.NAME: Geodormant

GLACIERS_LARGE.DESCRIPTION: Huge chunks of primordial <link=\"ICE\">Ice</link> are scattered across this world
GLACIERS_LARGE.NAME: Large Glaciers

IRREGULAR_OIL.DESCRIPTION: The <style=\"KKeyword\">Oil</style> on this asteroid is anything but regular!
IRREGULAR_OIL.NAME: Irregular Oil

LUSH_CORE.DESCRIPTION: This world has a lush forest core
LUSH_CORE.NAME: Lush Core

MAGMA_VENTS.DESCRIPTION: The <link=\"MAGMA\">Magma</link> from this world's core has leaked into the mantle and crust
MAGMA_VENTS.NAME: Magma Channels

METAL_CAVES.DESCRIPTION: This world has caves of metal ore
METAL_CAVES.NAME: Metallic Caves

METAL_POOR.DESCRIPTION: There is a reduced amount of <style=\"KKeyword\">Metal Ore</style> on this world, proceed with caution!
METAL_POOR.NAME: Metal Poor

METAL_RICH.DESCRIPTION: This asteroid is an abundant source of <style=\"KKeyword\">Metal Ore</style>
METAL_RICH.NAME: Metal Rich

MISALIGNED_START.DESCRIPTION: The <link=\"HEADQUARTERS\">Printing Pod</link> didn't end up in the asteroid's exact center this time... but it's still nowhere near the surface
MISALIGNED_START.NAME: Alternate Pod Location

NO_TRAITS.DESCRIPTION: This world exists in a particularly stable configuration each time it is encountered
NO_TRAITS.NAME: This world is stable and has no unusual features.

RADIOACTIVE_CRUST.DESCRIPTION: Deposits of <link=\"URANIUMORE\">Uranium Ore</link> are found in this world's crust
RADIOACTIVE_CRUST.NAME: Radioactive Crust

SLIME_SPLATS.DESCRIPTION: Sickly <link=\"SLIMEMOLD\">Slime</link> growths have crept all over this world
SLIME_SPLATS.NAME: Slime Molds

SUBSURFACE_OCEAN.DESCRIPTION: Below the crust of this world is a <link=\"SALTWATER\">Salt Water</link> sea
SUBSURFACE_OCEAN.NAME: Subsurface Ocean

VOLCANOES.DESCRIPTION: Several active <style=\"KKeyword\">Volcanoes</style> have been detected in this world
VOLCANOES.NAME: Volcanic Activity
